author: Courtney Cunningham
author_info: Salesforce Certified Administrator at Talent Stacker Salesforce Career Development Program | Salesforce Administration and Business Analyst Interest | #Open to Work |  Early Childhood Educator Background
content:
This is the post I've been waiting to make for what feels like FOREVER!  I have watched so many amazing and talented members of the #Ohana start (or continue) their journeys as Salesforce Professionals and now I am ECSTATIC to share that I've joined the ranks: I am a Salesforce CERTIFIED Administrator!

In January 2021, I took the Five-Day Challenge from #TalentStacker and decided that Salesforce wasn't for me.  I did not believe that I could transition from a successful career as a teacher to someone who works in tech.  I left my teaching job in May and ventured into the unknown.  I continued to teach online classes, which were amazing and I loved keeping that connection to my students and to a field I love.  Because of some changes to the online ESL teaching company I worked for, I realized that I needed to figure out my next steps quicker than I had planned.  

Fast forward to the end of August, my husband and I were enjoying a nice walk and we started talking about #FinancialIndependence, #ChooseFI, and then #Salesforce.  In the span of a few conversations, my husband convinced me that I did have "what it takes" and my skills as a teacher would be transferable to anything new I tried.  He continued to push me and believe in me, which ultimately led me to this day.  I could not be happier to be a Salesforce Certified Administrator.  

There are so many people to thank because no one EVER does anything alone.  First, (and you might have guessed this one), thank you to my wonderful and supportive husband, Noah Farber-Jones.  If he hadn't continued to send #Salesforce and #Talentstacker information my way, I would not be sharing this post today.

Thank you to my amazing study mates, Angie Tinio and Kathy Umanzor, who kept me focused on my studying goals and made learning Salesforce even more fun!  I cannot wait to hear their success stories in the very near future!

Thank you to Caitlin Nguyen for your amazing videos on Trailhead Live that taught me about data analytics, permission sets, and validation rules!  

Thank you to Martin Gessner for the outstanding #FocusonForce practice exams.  I do not think I could have handled the pressure of the test without getting that practice in first.

Thank you to Christine Marshall for allowing me to test your new study materials and for the amazing #SalesforceBen practice exams!  Those resources were instrumental in helping me to get certified!

Last, but certainly not least, thank you to Bradley Rice and the Talent Stacker | Salesforce Career Development Program for guiding me through this process and exposing me to the amazing #Ohana.  I am filled with so much joy because I became a part of the Salesforce ecosystem and joined this giving, supportive, open-minded, and talented group of people!

While this is a great moment, which I plan to soak up, this is only the beginning!  My story is to be continued...

#awesomeadmins #certifiedatlast #salesforceadmin #ohana #talentstacker #alwaysbelearning

author: LinkedIn News India
content:
Srinagar has become the sixth Indian city to be designated as a Creative City by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization.

The summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir has entered the UNESCO Creative Cities Network for excellence in crafts and folk art – only the second Indian city to feature in this category.

Srinagar is celebrated for its traditional Kashmiri handicrafts such as Pashmina shawls, carpets, embroidered jackets, and wood carvings, with the designs heavily influenced by Persian and Mughal art forms. It’s also famous for its papier-mâché craft, wherein paper pulp is used to make decorative objects.

UNESCO’s Creative Cities Network now spans 295 cities globally that invest in culture and creativity — crafts and folk art, design, film, gastronomy, literature, media arts, and music — to promote sustainable urban development, according to UNESCO.

Check out the other Indian cities on the UNESCO Creative Cities Network. Which other cities deserve a spot on this list? Share in the comments below. 

Images: Getty/Shutterstock
Source: https://lnkd.in/gKxk5uAx

author: LinkedIn News Australia
content:
Workers in most functions are feeling more confident about their ability to progress in their career in the next year, according to LinkedIn’s Workforce Confidence Index.

Those working in business development and admin roles — across a variety of industries — are leading the way in confidence, followed by those in arts & design and healthcare services.

At the other end of the scale, those in operations and media & communications roles are the least confident about being able to make any career progression — with their optimism levels remaining pretty stagnant since April.

Overall, 18% of respondents expect there will be new jobs available in the next two weeks, up from 8% at the start of the pandemic. When it comes to job seekers, things are looking most competitive for those in media & communications, arts & design and community & social services roles — with the number of active job seekers outweighing the number of workers in those functions who believe that new jobs will become available.

For those with accounting, program & project management and healthcare services roles, however, demand for new jobs is lower than the perceived supply.

Do you relate to these findings? For more #workforceconfidenceindex findings, visit https://lnkd.in/dRhX-uZ.

author: PAST Foundation
content:
This week on the Learning Unboxed podcast, PAST CEO Annalies Corbin talks with Denise Daniels & Andrew Ravin about Revolutionizing the Middle School Experience.

Many people shy away from talking about middle school, but it’s an important topic. Middle school is often where we make or break a kid’s future – and there is so much opportunity and potential during middle school to shape them for the rest of their lives.

Andrew Ravin is the founder and head of school at Workshop Middle School. He’s deeply committed to social change and, for seven years, worked in community social services in both New York and Chicago. In addition, he’s spent more than 15 years working in New York City public schools.

Denise Daniels is the co-founder and director of learning at Workshop Middle School, with more than 22 years of experience in education as a teacher, a staff developer, a curriculum designer, an instructional coach, and a school leader.

We discuss what Workshop Middle School does differently and how they’re rethinking the classroom structure, from starting later in the day to organizing smaller class sizes. Getting things right for kids at this transitional period in life is so important.

Find this and every episode of the Learning Unboxed podcast on Apple Podcasts or wherever you listen to podcasts.

Now available as Audio, Video, or as a written Transcript
Learning Unboxed is produced in part by Crate Media
#thisispast

author: Martin Spellacy   MS-EM  CEM. LTC USA (RET)
author_info:
EMERGENCY RESPONSE and RISK MANAGEMENT SPECIALIST
National, State, and Local Level Disaster Response Experience | Inter-Agency Planning Experience
content:
I just completed an incredible four-month mission in Florida to support the Florida Division of Emergency Management COVID19 Mobile Vaccine program.  Using the CDC Social Vulnerability Index (SVI), we focused our efforts on deploying our mobile vaccine teams to areas within the State where the population would not have easy access to the vaccine.  In all, we were able to provide vaccines to over 290 towns and villages throughout the State.

As is often the case, it took teamwork across many organizations to ensure success.

 The work of the local community social services agencies and advocacy groups supported the efforts of our teams by “getting the word out” to the neighborhoods and helping to select locations for the clinics.
 
The nurses, medical technicians, on-site admin support who ran these clinics ensured that everyone who wanted a vaccine and was medically eligible received one.  In addition, when informed of homebound individuals, our medical team would drive to those homes and provide the vaccines.  More importantly, they treated each individual who came to our clinics with respect and compassion.

author: Stefan Thomas
author_info: Helping Students Find Their Path & Purpose 🎓 | Student Recruitment Officer 📚 | Public Speaker🎙 | LinkedIn Content Creator & Motivator 🧑🏽💻
content:
I’VE FINALLY GRADUATED UNIVERSITY 🎓 

Can I start by saying, GOD IS SO GOOD! After 4 hard years of grinding, I’m proud to say that I graduated from University of Guelph-Humber with a 3.7 GPA (90% cumulative average). 

Ever since I was in high school, I’ve always been one to work extremely hard. Although I achieved many things throughout my undergrad, I’ve always tried my best to use each achievement as an opportunity to inspire other students around me and show them that with a little dedication and a strong work ethic, anything you want is possible.

I’m grateful for everyone who has supported and believed in me throughout this journey! This isn’t the end, but it’s simply the beginning of something great. I’m super excited for the next chapter of my life and for pursuing what will be a fulfilling career in higher education; while pursuing my dreams as a motivational speaker on the side!

Here’s a brief list of some of my accomplishments over the last 4 years:

🔸Graduated with Distinction 
🔹BASc in Family and Community Social Services
🔸Diploma in SSW 
🔹Board of Directors for IGNITE
🔸Student Ambassador (aka START Leader) for UoGH
🔹3 Scholarships
🔸3 Field practicums (850 hours of field experience)
🔹Paid off OSAP in FULL (screams for joy!)

#collegesanduniversities #students #graduation #graduates #university #leadership #blackexcellence #education #highereducation #career #socialwork #success #motivation #inspiration #Toronto #Ontario #Canada #GHgrad #Classof2021

author: Michele Gustin
content:
A new chapter! 

#community #businessdevelopment #events #entertainment #nonprofits #programming 

Michigan City, IN, November 9, 2021 – Kim Olesker, Director of Operations for the Barker Mansion, announced that Michele Gustin has joined the Barker Mansion staff as full time Program & Events Coordinator.

“We are so pleased Michele has joined the Barker Mansion staff. Her skills and experience will bring great value to all aspects of programming and events at the Barker Mansion.”

Most recently, Michele was the Director of Business Development at the Mascot Hall of Fame, a children’s museum in Whiting, IN. Previously, she worked in Valpariso, IN as the Community Business Development Manager for Barnes & Noble, and was Entertainment Director/Special Events & Marketing Coordinator for the Memorial Opera House.

Michele Gustin, Program & Events Coordinator, "I am so excited to be part of the new team reopening the restored Barker Mansion and developing exciting new adult and youth programming for the whole community, with a focus on the history of the Barker family and Michigan City, as well as being an inviting community center for all groups.”

The Barker Mansion is the historic 1905 home of entrepreneur, civic leader and philanthropist, John H. Barker and his daughter Catherine Barker Hickox. In July, Michigan City transferred the Barker Mansion to the Barker Welfare Foundation. The Mansion is completing a $2 million restoration.

Since the creation of the Barker Welfare Foundation in 1934 by Catherine Barker Hickox, the foundation has donated over $10 million to 70 community, social service and arts nonprofits serving Michigan City and LaPorte County.

For further information please contact us at:
Info@barkermansion.org

author: Andrei Kurtuy
content:
The rapid technological development has changed the modern industrial world, and it’ll shape the future of work.

In fact, we can already see a significant shift in the way industries function. But technology isn’t the only factor that will influence the future of jobs:

👉 As the population gets older, we see an increase in the number of job openings in several industries, such as Personal Care, Healthcare, Elderly Care, and Community & Social Services.

👉 In addition, Millennials and Gen Z's interest in traveling and sustainability will bring more opportunities in the Hospitality industry and various environmentally-focused areas.

Training your skills will help you adapt to upcoming changes and boost your employability in the fastest growing industries 🚀

These are the top skills to learn nowadays 👇

1️⃣ Complex problem-solving
2️⃣ Critical thinking
3️⃣ Creativity
4️⃣ People management
5️⃣ Coordinating with others
6️⃣ Emotional intelligence
7️⃣ Judgement and decision making
8️⃣ Service orientation
9️⃣ Negotiation
🔟 Cognitive flexibility

Is there any other skill you think is valuable to learn to land a job in these industries? Let me know in the comments 😊

#jobopportunities #careeradvice #futureofjobs #topskills #careeropportunities

author: Mary Wade
content:
Join us in welcoming Michael A. O’Brien, FACHE to the #MaryWade family.

Michael has been appointed the Interim Executive Director of Chatham Place at Mary Wade.  He brings 40 years of senior executive leadership experience in senior care and acute care settings with demonstrated success in strategic planning; operations; program and facility development; and staff, physician, and community relations.  Michael recently retired as the President and CEO of Duncaster Retirement Community, a Life Plan Community in Bloomfield.  During his tenure, he guided the community through significant growth and facility development, improvement in the quality of healthcare and wellness services, enhancement of life enrichment programs and services, active community stewardship, and strong financial performance.  Michael has a BA in Psychology from Fairfield University, a Masters in Health Administration from Saint Louis University, and is a Fellow in the American College of Healthcare Executives. Michael has served on the Board of LEADINGAGE CONNECTICUT, the Connecticut Assisted Living Association, Saint Mary's Hospital, and several other community social service agencies.

Send a warm welcome to Michael below in the comments section.

author: The Elizabeth Fry Society of Greater Vancouver (EFry)
content:
Huge congratulations to our very own Bonnie Moriarty, Director of Homelessness Initiatives who is the winner of this year’s Community Social Services Award of Excellence in the Leader category. 

The prestigious awards recognize individuals who have made outstanding contributions to the social services sector. 

Bonnie, has spent 33 years – 28 at Elizabeth Fry – improving the lives of women and children, and raising the importance of gender informed services to address homelessness. 

Bonnie is a trailblazer in developing housing and programs informed by gender and equity and advocating for the needs of the homeless on community task forces, steering committees and boards. 

Through her extensive experience Bonnie has been able to articulate how women experience, and their different needs they have related to trauma, mental health challenges, substance use and sexual exploitation.  

Bonnie has advocated for systemic changes to improve women’s safety and the lives of children, and improved the lives of not only EFry clients but that of other providers. 

Well done Bonnie!!

#CommunitySocialServicesAwardOfExcellence #Award #EFry #DignityEqualityOpportunity

author: Annalies Corbin
content:
129. Revolutionizing the Middle School Experience with Denise Daniels & Andrew Ravin

Many people shy away from talking about middle school, but it’s an important topic. Middle school is often where we make or break a kid’s future – and there is so much opportunity and potential during middle school to shape them for the rest of their lives.

Andrew Ravin is the founder and head of school at Workshop Middle School. He’s deeply committed to social change, and, for seven years, worked in community social services in both New York and Chicago. He’s spent more than 15 years working in New York City public schools.
Denise Daniels is the co-founder and director of learning at Workshop Middle School, with more than 22 years of experience in education as a teacher, a staff developer, a curriculum designer, an instructional coach, and a school leader.

We discuss what Workshop Middle School does differently and how they’re rethinking the structure of the classroom, from starting later in the day to organizing smaller class sizes. Getting things right for kids at this transitional period in life is so important.

Subscribe to Learning Unboxed to hear more: https://lnkd.in/eY8n87wD

Now available as Audio, Video, or as a written Transcript
Learning Unboxed is produced in part by Crate Media
#thisispast Workshop Middle School PAST Foundation

author: Leon B.
content:
With cold, wintry weather already here, the City of Detroit is reminding residents that warming centers and respite locations are open to provide relief from the cold.
WARMING CENTERS
The City has four warming centers, in conjunction with Cass Community Social Services and Detroit Rescue Mission Ministries, open from now through March 31. The centers provide temporary relief to persons who are homeless when year-round shelters may be at capacity. A fifth day center at the TCF Center is operated by the Pope Francis Center.
Due to COVID-19, the Coordinated Assessment Model (CAM) access points have moved from in-person to a call line. Contact CAM at (313) 305-0311 Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday from 9 a.m. - 6 p.m. and Wednesday from 11 a.m. – 5 p.m. CAM staff will explore alternatives to shelters or make a shelter placement referral.

RESPITE LOCATIONS
The City’s recreation centers and Detroit Public Library branches are open during business hours to provide residents relief from extreme weather. Both recreation centers and the libraries will follow COVID-19 safety protocols.
To get additional information on warming centers and respite locations, go to detroitmi.gov/news.

author: Rick Parsons, P.E., CWRE
content:
Recent Snowstorms in Oregon

If you are going out in the backcountry - snowshoeing, skiing, snowboarding - be prepared for changing snow conditions. Be sure to follow snowpack in your area as it develops over the season not just the day or day before you go out.

Oregon doesn't have too many avalanches - the snowpack is not as fickle as occurs in the intermountain west but the hazards still lurk in the northwest. There's been one fatality in WA this year followed by two in ID and as of yesterday, one in CO.

Check out the following sites to keep aware of what is going on locally this year. See Observations over time that are posted to see what is happening in the field - 1) Nationally and in the 2) Northwest and in 3) Central Oregon and in 4) Northeast Oregon and in 5) Southern Oregon and in 6) Northern California. There are other Facebook pages with similar information not posted here.

1) https://lnkd.in/gtgHaFh8

author: Amit Paranjape
author_info: Founder and Chairman of Persistent Systems
content:
The James Webb Space Telescope was launched earlier today, via the Ariane 5 rocket. The JWST will take another 28 days to reach its final orbit at the 'Lagrange 2' point, about 1.5 million km away from the earth. Actual full scale operations will take longer.

The JWST is one of the most complex and expensive scientific instruments built by humans. It will help us 'look back' at the earliest objects in the universe, billions of light years away. Its development has taken over 20,000 human years, spanning three decades and has cost over $10 billion.

Do watch this excellent documentary about the 'insane' engineering behind the JWST:

'The Insane Engineering of James Webb Telescope'

https://lnkd.in/d8Xc5535 

Insane and incredible! Materials, heat exchange & cooling, cryogenics, optics, mechanics, controls... and a lot more. Almost every branch of engineering/tech involved in this complex mission.

Wishing team JWST at NASA, ESA and other countries all the best!

Do follow regular updates via NASA, NASAWebb on twitter.

#JWST #NASA #ESA #JamesWebbSpaceTelescope

author: Raghda Yahyaoui
content:
The shiny silver material of the five-layer sunshield that will fly aboard NASA's James Webb Space Telescope is a complex and innovative feat of material science and engineering. Each layer is made from a unique composite material, each has a specific thickness and size, and they must be precisely separated in space. There are even special seams and reinforcements to limit meteorite damage.

author: 🍀 Camille MARLE 🌻
content:
Pour Noël, j’ai AUSSI fait un cadeau à la planète…

J’ai rejoint le mouvement Time for the Planet en tant qu'investisseur ! Pourquoi ?

Parce que nous sommes la dernière génération capable d'empêcher un effondrement climatique.

C'est une société à but non lucratif, ambitieuse et passionnée, qui se consacre à lutter contre le problème le plus important et le plus urgent pour l'humanité : le réchauffement climatique.

Time for the Planet s'appuie sur l'#entrepreneuriat, l’#intelligencecollective, et le principe du partage de ces solutions selon les règles de l’#opensource.

Leur vision m’a conquise !
Si vous vous sentez concernés, et que vous souhaitez vous informer ou apporter votre soutien, n'hésitez pas à visiter le site internet ! 

Arthur Auboeuf

🏴☠️Is there hidden treasures 💰waiting for you in your spam folder?

Today I just decided to scroll through my spam folder...

As I scrolled down I was surprised to see several hot 🥵 leads that wanted my service stuck in my junk mailbox 📫

I bring this up because I get called and messaged all the time with people telling me they never got my FREE offers...

author: Tim Denning
author_info: Aussie Blogger | Leader | Sales Professional | 500M+ content views in 7 years – Inspiring The World Through Personal Development & Entrepreneurship | Let's connect: timdenning.com/lb/
content:
Entrepreneurship nearly killed me. I quit. 

I got a normal job in finance. 

It took another 10 years to build up the courage.

This year I tried entrepreneurship again.

No more fancy cars.
No more inflated ego.
No more teams of people kissing my feet.

Just plain old solopreneurship practiced quietly from my home office.

This week has been an exceptional week of growth for my business.

Everything in your career is worth a second try. 

If you don't succeed first time around, 
Try again when you're ready. 

Nothing wrong with being too early.

Friday passed was my last day at Superdrug. I had spent seven years at this historic organisation, going from a pharmacy manager to a senior manager in healthcare services.  They have gone by so fast yet will leave an indelible imprint on who I am.

The journey took me from the front line to head office in Croydon where I've helped develop and deliver initiatives that improve our customers' lives.  Now I am spreading my wings and flying the nest, taking all that I have learnt beneath the spangly pink star of Superdrug and applying it to the tech start-up world with Thriva, as a senior partnerships manager.

I have worked with some truly fantastic humans over the years. I hope I have left an impression on them as they have on me. I am grateful for the years that have gone by and relish the years that are to come with the support of the most important people in my life.

Thank you #superdrug
Hello #Thriva

author_info: Lawyer|Creative Writer|Personal Development Expert|The TOP Person Ambassador|Poetess| Mental Health Advocate.
content:
WHAT IOT IS DOING IN HUMAN RESOURCES by NAVEEN JOSHI - THE GLOBALLY RENOWNED BUSINESS AND TECH ARTICLE AUTHOR
	
	
"HR teams across all the industries are leveraging IoT in HR management to improve employee health, safety, productivity, and comfort in an organization.

HR management is a field where HR managers are responsible for monitoring and enhancing relationships among employees and with the organization right from hiring to relieving.

They have to hire suitable talent for their organizations to close the skills gap, ensure employees are safe and comfortable, and offer them the necessary services and benefits.

To excel in these tasks, HR managers need to constantly monitor and track employee's work, behavior, activities, and comfort.

Traditionally, HR personnel used to monitor employees by observing them, using feedback forms, or by integrating monitoring software in computers.

But, such methods of monitoring cannot provide an..."

author_info: Certified Elder Law Attorney, Mannor Law Group, PLLC
content: if you’re incredibly concerned about omicron—and, frankly, even if you’re not—first consider that panicking with the markets is rarely a good idea. Selling out at the first sign of turbulence is a good way to take a loss on otherwise-solid positions. Instead, it’s best to design your investment strategy ahead of time and make calculated moves.

author: Veronica Restrepo
content:
I can’t believe I am writing this post, but I am officially graduated! 

I graduated yesterday from Temple University with a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Advertising, with a Digital Marketing minor, Brand Strategy & Research concentration, and a cumulative GPA of 3.81. 

I cannot put into words how thankful I am for every blessing, challenge, and opportunity Temple has given me the past 3.5 years. Not only was I able to dive into my studies in the Lew Klein College of Media & Communication and the Fox School of Business, but I was very lucky to be involved in many communities on campus. I am so grateful for being a part of the University Honors College, Delta Zeta Sorority, Temple University Rome, and Temple University Advertising Club over the past few years.

I would love to thank my parents, friends, and professors for supporting me during my time at Temple University. I am so proud to be an owl and I am excited to see what comes next in my journey!

author: Alessandro Scaglione
author_info: CONTINUARE INSIEME. Strategia e Continuità per l'Impresa Familiare italiana
content:
“Ho 31 anni e continuo a ricevere commenti che mettono in dubbio il mio essere abbastanza adulta per parlare di grappa. Lo trovo umiliante.”

Sono passati 125 anni da quando Orazio Nonino tirava la carretta nelle campagne friulane e col suo alambicco distillava gli scarti delle vigne dei padroni.

Potrebbe finire dopo 2 generazioni quando suo nipote Antonio cade in guerra lasciando due figli piccoli, ma sua moglie Silvia non ci sta. Si rimbocca le maniche, diventa la prima mastra distillatrice italiana. 

L’impresa va avanti col figlio Benito, ma il destino ha deciso che saranno le donne a fare la differenza a cominciare da sua moglie Giannola.

Sarà lei a fare di un prodotto dell'economia contadina la Regina dei distillati al pari di maschi alfa come whisky e cognac. Sfiderà l’usanza di distillare vinacce assemblate a favore del solo Picolit, metterà le sue bottiglie in mano ad iconici trendsetters da Gianni Agnelli a Silvana Mangano e farà della grappa un fatto culturale col Premio Nonino, nato per recuperare vitigni rari.

Poteva finire alla quarta generazione perché Giannola non avrebbe dovuto avere figli per un problema al cuore. Ne avrà invece 3. Tutte femmine. Tutte in azienda con Cristina che avrà due femmine e un maschio.

Francesca è la più piccola. Il peso che deve portare è quello di una storia più grande di lei. L’orgoglio è quello di avere la fortuna di volerne e poterne far parte.

A Milano, dove va ad abitare da sola per la prima volta per l’università, prende le misure della vita adulta. Non sarà facile scrollarsi di dosso la marca della campagnola che viene dal nulla.

Lei lo farà con una ricetta che diventerà la cifra della sua credibilità: essere autentica e studiare continuamente (per ora laurea in economia, sommelier, bartender e master in Social Media Communication).

In 5 anni di duro lavoro sbarca sui social e col suo volto fresco e vitale riesce a sdoganare la storia di famiglia e la sua grappa ad un pubblico giovane e a superare le limitazioni della pandemia digitalizzando un marketing basato da sempre sull’incontro fisico col pubblico di estimatori.

In un mondo di urlatori lo farà senza megafoni, parlando di colonne di distillazione e danza della grappa ed essendo semplicemente sé stessa. Su LinkedIn raccoglie oltre 40.000 followers. La chiamano al decennale a raccontare la sua storia in quella stessa Milano che l’aveva snobbata.

La ragazza venuta dal Friuli ha 31 anni ed ha tutti i numeri per portare nel terzo millennio la Migliore Distilleria del Mondo, prima italiana a ottenere questo riconoscimento. Lo sta già facendo.

Ha detto Emerson: “Quel che abbiamo alle spalle e quel che abbiamo davanti sono piccole cose se paragonate a ciò che abbiamo dentro”

author: Mohamed A Umar
author_info:
Advisor / Mentor at Infinity Lab, 
Digital Robin Hood - Shaping a better World
content:
#Transforming #HigherEducation - The #Meta #University Model

As new models of #Education are fast emerging across the world to increase access & bridge the education divide especially at the school level, there is far greater need to first bridge the digital divide (access to devices & connectivity)

10 Most #Innovative Edutech Ventures of 2021
Learn More: https://lnkd.in/dtFsNATF

Besides transforming school education, Higher Education is a domain ideal for Disruption & Transformation
 
Developing economies are still far from meeting the growing demand for Quality Higher Education due to shortage of institutions & faculty. #China spends 4% of GDP on education while #India spends just 3.2% against the long standing recommendation of 6%. 


#Meta #University
Collaboratively Developed Quality Education with Flexible Delivery to meet growing global demand for Affordable & Quality Higher Education

#MIT Open Learning, MicroMasters & #iLab - A Meta University Model

Since 2012, MIT has offered MITx online classes, available to anyone worldwide, free of charge

MIT’s OpenCourseWare (OCW) consists of lecture notes, exams & videos from nearly 2,500 MIT courses

More than 4 million learners in over 200 countries have enrolled since the MITx program began & MIT surveys show OCW materials are received with considerable appreciation and goodwill around the world

The next stage in the evolution of the open content movement is the #iLab, Online Laboratory. The principle is simple. Most experiments today are controlled by computers so researchers can access expensive equipment from MIT etc., remotely & conduct experiments to find solutions to local sustainability challenges

The emerging meta-university, built on the power of the Web & launched by the open courseware movement, will give teachers & learners everywhere the ability to access & share teaching materials, scholarly publications, scientific works in progress, run remote experiments & collaborate worldwide to meet the growing demand for high quality & affordable Higher Education

Flexibility in HigherEd is essential to facilitate multidisciplinary studies so that an MBA Marketing student can take a Credit Course in Psychology, a student of Media & Communications can take a course in Digital Design & Visual Storytelling & an Engineering/Technology student can study Marketing/Finance/Law which are essential

The benefits are manifold & the possibilities are Infinite with the Meta-University Concept with Technology further adding value - VR/AR enhancing learning experience, #KnowledgePlatforms,  Communication & Collaboration tools facilitating sharing of knowledge & scholarly resources, Flexible New #Payment Models & #DigitalCredentials

Welcome to The University of the Future - Meta University

If the Meta University Concept is to reach its full potential in bridging the worldwide higher education gap fundamental issues related to IP Rights, Quality Control, Digital Divide & Costs need to be addressed

author: Joel F.
author_info: Global Client Engagement Director | Ex-Military Careers | Veteran
content:
There are 19 million employed veterans between the age of 16 and 64 in the US
There are 1.7 million employed veterans between the age of 16 and 64 in the UK

581,000 veterans are unemployed between the age of 16-64 in the US
167,000 veterans are unemployed between the age of 16-64 in the UK

200,000 people leave the services per annum in the US
27,000 people leave the services per annum in the UK

It is our objective at Ex-MilitaryCareers.com to address these staggering numbers and connect with fantastic companies who wish to support such an incredibly diverse and worthy community.

These are some of the most intuitive, motivated, disciplined, hard-working, and loyal members of society and they are eager to look for employment across many industries: 

➸ Operations & HR
➸ Security & Investigation
➸ Business Development
➸ Medical Drug & Healthcare
➸ Supply Chain Procurement
➸ Finance, Compliance & Cyber Security
➸ Information Technology
➸ Data & Engineering
➸ Construction
➸ Military & Protective Service

My question to you is, how can you help?

How can your organization support one of these individuals who have served society and their country? Do you feel they deserve your support, time, and effort? 

Will you read this and move on? Or will you be the 'Force for Change'?

We can connect the dots and align you with our community. 

Drop an email to joel@ex-militarycareers.com to find out more. 

⚔️🇺🇸⚔️🇬🇧⚔️

author: Louise Fletcher
author_info: Curriculum Area Manager for Sport, Military and Protective Services  at The Cornwall College Group
content:
Fantastic job opportunity ⬇️

Lecturer for FE Level 3 Military and the Protective Services – Camborne Campus – Salary: £23,000 to £25,800 - Hours per week: 37 - Weeks per year : 52 

Closing Date: Monday 2nd July 2021 

This role is fixed term until 22 July 2022. We only accept applications via our Cornwall College website, if you wish to apply for this role please visit job profile (cornwall.ac.uk).

Based at Camborne, we are looking for an experienced individual to motivate and inspire learners into careers within the Military & Protective services, through brilliant teaching & learning. You will actively support all aspects of the Study Programme including work/industry placements. You will be responsible for continuously monitoring the attendance, levels of retention and success of your learners. You must ensure that all learners have targets set and take steps to ensure that they are achieving. Applicants must have experience of teaching and/or training in the relevant subject sector, appropriate level (minimum level 3) qualification in a relevant Subject Sector Area and experience working as a Military or Protective Services Personal. If you require further information please call Louise Fletcher at louise.fletcher@cornwall.ac.uk or call 01209 616158. #careers #teaching

author: BRIAN SMITH
author_info: Director & Chief Instructor at Krav Maga Devon
content:
Extremely pleased & honoured to be accepted on the BSc (Hons) Degree in Emergency Sector Management & Interoperability course starting in September studying at Bicton College. I also recently became a permanent Lecturer on their Military Academy. 😀

I completed my A-Levels in 1997, instead of going to Uni I joined the Royal Marines. Definitely no regrets there. 😀

Ps, in fact the day my A-Level results came out I was hanging off a pull-up bar at Derby Armed Forces careers office.

24 Years later, finally cracking a Degree. 
Really looking forward to it & I know I’ll have a great support network from the Military & Protective Services Academy HE team. 😀

content:
WKMD Social Yémen 

Selon l'ONU, la guerre au Yémen a causé la mort de 377 000 personnes, dont plus de la moitié due aux conséquences indirectes du conflit, notamment le manque d'eau potable, la faim et les maladies. Le 22 décembre, l'ONU s'est dite «contrainte» de réduire l'aide alimentaire au Yémen faute de fonds nécessaires, au moment où la faim augmente dans ce pays ravagé par l'une des pires crises humanitaires au monde. Quelque 80% des plus de 30 millions d'habitants du Yémen dépendent de l'aide internationale.

En savoir plus 👇👇

author: Swanand Rao
author_info: Product Management | Leadership | Angel Investor | Cloud | ML/AI | Founder | Author | MS | MBA
content:
Closing the year on a high note, happy to share the publication of my book ‘The Invisible Product Manager - Getting Started With Platform Product Management’.
It is a collection of experiences  that my co-author Ashwin Krishnamurthy and I have had as product managers of software platforms. We hope that this book serves as a primer and benefits anyone who manages software platforms or may be interested in transitioning to product management or program management.

I would like to thank Nazrul Islam, Angela Yee and Saffana Velji for their valuable insights and suggestions & Jillian Rene Smith for excellent copy editing of the book! 

I owe my gratitude to Prof. M.P. Narayanan, Prof. Puneet Manchanda and all my teachers and my wonderful cohort at the University of Michigan - Stephen M. Ross School of Business for imparting the knowledge that has enabled me to evaluate software platforms from a strategic lens! Go blue!!

I would love to get your feedback on the book! 

Happy holidays! 

#productmanagement #productstrategy #platforms #productmamagers #goblue #fighton
Cc: Product League Product School Product People

author: Divya Khanna
author_info: HR Business Manager  at Finesse Global
content:
Urgent Opening for Program Manager, Location: Dubai
 
Responsible for the day-to-day management, operational planning, establishment, execution of IT program. Work closely with program director, cross-functional teams, and assigned project managers to plan and develop scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and delivery plan. Serve as principal point of representation and liaison with external constituencies on operational matters and provide technical/professional guidance and leadership as appropriate to the area of expertise. Responsible for ensuring that projects in a program are planned, scheduled, monitored properly, and that effective communication with management to convey project status is conducted. Manage risks and issues and taking corrective measurements. Align the deliverables to the program’s “outcome” by support in change management initiatives. Implement and manage changes and interventions to ensure program goals are achieved. Produce accurate and timely reporting of program status throughout its life cycle. Contribute to effective quality assurance and the overall integrity of the program - focusing inwardly on the internal consistency of the program, and outwardly on its coherence with infrastructure planning, interfaces with other program and technical standards
 
Qualification & Experience
Bachelor’s in computer science, Software Engineering, Management Information Systems or equivalent degree, 10+ years’ experience. PMP and ITIL V4 foundation certification. Experience in leading and driving projects / programs, higher leadership status reporting or stakeholders' meetings. Working knowledge of program / project management tools.

Locally and Immediately Available Candidates Only

Please send CV at divya@finessedirect.com

author: Pavithra Jay
content:
I am currently seeking to recruit for the role of Project Manager - Dubai. Should this be of interest to you please share your updated profile to pavithra@hirerightt.com with subject as Project Manager for further discussions.
 
Designation: Project Manager
Salary: as per industry standards 
Work Location: Dubai
Retail industry experience must to have 

Job Purpose
Project Manager is responsible for monitoring the progress of various existing and on-going projects for the relevant Business Unit/Department, ensuring that they are completed as per desired quality and within desired timelines. The role holder ensures liaising with internal and external teams to identify opportunities for new projects and devise plans and strategy to leverage the same.

Core Responsibilities:
•                Solely responsible for timely execution of cloud and on-premise ERP and Non-ERP implementation, rollout and support projects.
•                Directs the articulation of an integrated project management plan, based on the prescribed specifications and projects design, ensuring balance between the immediate needs and the long-term goals of the relevant department.
•                Manages the entire life cycle of the project (from inception to go-live) and ensures relevant resources are available and utilized to produce the planned deliverables, in line with agreed timelines and budgets.
•                Manages on-going communication on large projects’ status, and escalates issues to senior management as required.
•                Formulates guidelines for aligning project governance and ensures project management standards are followed in all the projects undertaken by the Business Unit/Department.
•                Oversees, centralizes and coordinates the management of projects documentations and procedures.
•                Implements risk response plans, track identified risks, monitor residual risks, identify new risks, and evaluate risk process effectiveness throughout the project
•                Integrates change management and project management, in order to create a unified approach to implementing change from technical and business perspectives.


Education  and Required Skills
•            Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or relevant field 
•            Master’s degree in Business Administration/ Information System is preferred 
•            Relevant certification in Advanced Program/Project Management Professional (PMP/PRINCE2)
•            Maximum of 10 years of relevant experience with at least 4 years in managing large-scale projects preferably within a retail organization.
•            ERP Applications knowledge in SAP/Oracle/Microsoft/Salesforce etc.,
•            Integration knowledge with 3rd party applications.
•            Business process knowledge in Retail and Supply chain is highly preferred.

#projectmanger #retail

author: Zuheb Ahmed
content:
Dear Connections, we are still hiring candidates for the position of a Sr. Overseeing Engineer - Electrical.

Job Purpose:
An incumbent works under the general supervision of a Project Manager, with whom the incumbent will meet / communicate to discuss their assigned work status and significant issues impacting the program / project regularly which as has been assigned, but should be able to work as much as possible independently within the project management structure in achieving assigned goals being both responsible and accountable for the same. The incumbent shall be the single point of contact for all Electrical and Instrumentation requirements throughout the project execution phase and the future warranty management aspects. The incumbent responsibilities include but not limited to: -
1) Understand and work within all of the Program fundamentals and all existing Project management processes, program budgets, schedules including full knowledge of the Contractual requirements
2) Assist and be able to develop and implement new or additional programmatic / project related plans / processes / requirements and or work definitions as necessary
3) Active participation and provide valuable review comments to all basic design drawings to the company's Engineering Dept., Thorough understanding of ITPs, procedures and associated production / inspection documents including classification rules.
4) Lead the oversight of the Project / Program Milestones and the corresponding project management Acceptance process in order to obtain, coordinate, assimilate and consolidate the necessary information’s from a wide and various number of sources and be responsible for its organization into proper documentation that will facilitate acceptance by the client of the same
5) Plan, oversee and ensure that all of the specified program / project management / production scope of works are inspected, monitored, reported against accurately for being on schedule and proper visibility is disseminated to all required project concerned personnel.
6) Must be able to both understand and comprehensively produce a variety of program / project management related administrative reports, schedules and related documents and in continuity with various existing or new / additional project management processes
7) Must have technical and professional skills with good English language for interfacing with other company's departments divisions, entities or agencies, with focus on the ability to interact with QA/QC issues for the significant quality related inputs required for the acceptance documentation.

*Candidates with the Marine background will be preferred*

If you have the above requirements or if you know somebody else does, then please send your interest to my DM and mention the position title "Sr. Overseeing Engineer - Electrical".

In advance, I thank you for your interest and would like to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

author: Jayrald Ado
content:
Best credit cards for purchase protection

Editor’s note: This is a recurring post, regularly updated with new information.

So you finally splurged for an Apple Watch and broke it a week later. The warranty won’t cover the damage, and you didn’t think you’d need AppleCare. You’re out of luck, right? Not if you used the right credit card to make the purchase.

Purchase protection can save you big if a recently bought item is damaged or stolen. A few credit cards may even provide protection if you lose a recently purchased item. Only some credit cards offer purchase protection, though, and the benefits tend to vary across cards. This guide will describe the basics of credit card purchase protection and detail some of the credit cards that offer the best coverage.

Get the latest points, miles and travel news by signing up for TPG’s free daily newsletter.

In This Post

What is purchase protection?

The purchase protection benefit offered by select credit cards covers eligible purchases against accidental damage or theft — and for some cards, loss — in the first few months after you use an eligible card to pay for the purchase. Some issuers also refer to this benefit as purchase security.

Related: How an often-overlooked credit card benefit put $1,400 back in my wallet

Best credit cards with purchase protection

American Express® Gold Card: Best if you tend to lose items.
Ink Business Cash Credit Card: Best for purchase protection and cash-back earning at office supply stores, with no annual fee.
Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express: Best for purchase protection and cash back on purchases at select U.S. department stores, with no annual fee (see rates and fees).
Chase Freedom Flex: Best for purchase protection and earning on sub-$500 purchases in rotating categories.
Capital One Venture X Rewards Credit Card: Best for purchase protection on purchases in non-bonus categories.

author: Jayrald Ado
content:
Everything you need to know about Amex purchase protection

Editor’s note: This is a recurring post, regularly updated with new information. 

When deciding which travel rewards card to use for large purchases, it’s important to look beyond the points and miles you earn. Card issuers strive to set their products apart from the competition by offering incentives like welcome bonuses, but sometimes the less flashy benefits can also end up being very valuable.

In this post, I’ll look at the three different shopping protection policies offered by many American Express cards and explain how you can leverage these benefits to save money.

New to The Points Guy? Want to learn more about credit card points and miles? Sign up for our daily newsletter.

In This Post

Purchase protection

Purchase protection will reimburse you for theft or accidental damage to eligible items that occurred within 90 days of purchase. To be eligible, all you have to do is charge a portion of your qualifying purchase to your American Express card — but you’ll only be reimbursed up to the amount charged to your card.

With most Amex cards, you’re covered for up to $1,000 per covered incident and up to $50,000 per year, but the reimbursement doesn’t include any shipping or handling expenses. However, certain premium cards cover your purchases for up to $10,000 per incident, with the same limit of up to $50,000 in total claims per calendar year.

Cards with this higher level of coverage include:

The Platinum Card® from American Express, The Business Platinum Card® from American Express and all other consumer versions in the Platinum family.
American Express® Gold Card.
Delta SkyMiles® Reserve American Express Card and the Delta SkyMiles® Reserve Business American Express Card.
Hilton Honors Aspire Card from American Express.

The information for the Hilton Aspire Amex card has been collected independently by The Points Guy. The card details on this page have not been reviewed or provided by the card issuer.

(Photo by Isabelle Raphael/The Points Guy)

As with any insurance policy, the devil is always in the details. In this case, you have to purchase an item that’s eligible for coverage and the loss can’t be due to an excluded reason.

What’s excluded?

The following are ineligible for coverage:

Unconditional satisfaction guarantee.
Damage through altercation or modifications.
Animals or living plants.
One-of-a-kind items such as rare stamps and coins.
Consumable or perishable items such as perfume, light bulbs and batteries.
Negotiable instruments including travelers checks and gift cards.
Items that are rented, leased or borrowed.
Motorized vehicles, parts and accessories.
Anything purchased for resale or commercial use.
Permanent household items such as carpet, flooring, air conditioners and refrigerators.
Land or buildings.
More than one article in a pair or set.
Downloadable services.
Items voluntarily or involuntarily discarded.
Medical or dental equipment or d...

Age : 21-27 years (B.Tech), 21-29 years (M.Tech) (as on April 1, 2022)
 
** Selection will be strictly based on Merit and above mentioned eligibility criteria. No applications will be considered in any circumstances if found not meeting the above criteria.

·         Part time/correspondence qualification

author: Freddy M.
author_info: Governance, Risk & Compliance Specialist at Nemlig.com
content:
Ultimately, hypotheses are nothing more than "tentative propositions set forth to assist in guiding the investigation of a problem or to provide possible explanations for observations made".
A researcher who deliberately sets out to prove a hypothesis does not have the objective, impartial open-mindedness so important for good research.

Difficult as it may be at times, we must let the chips fall where they may. The researcher might bias the procedure by looking only for data that would support the hypothesis. Hypotheses have nothing to do with proof. Rather, their acceptance or rejection depends on what the data — and the data alone — ultimately reveal.

Source: pp59-60 of 
https://lnkd.in/eh57zUPr

author: Practically Perfect PA
content:
What support do you need from your Executive to work in partnership? This will ultimately be personal to you. Still, I wanted to share what I thought were 10 expectations that Assistants should have from their Executive to build a strategic partnership.

Because it is a partnership.

You are there to make your Executive successful in their role, and you do that through many different methods. Still, it is worth remembering that their success moves the business forward, so never forget that you do not work for your Executive. You work for your organisation. You work with your Executive.

So with that being said, you can expect certain things from your Executive to make the partnership work. Here are my ten expectations.

author: The New Stack
content:
Kubernetes has already become successful for what it does, orchestrating containers, but it’s also influencing cloud computing because of how it does it.

The design pattern of its control plane, based on a declarative API that lets users express their desired state, and a set of control loops, also known as controllers that drive the “real world” toward the users’ desired state, is proving to be general enough to be used to manage more than just containers.

A symptom of this is the sprawl of custom Kubernetes controllers and APIs written by the community to manage all sorts of resources, such as virtual machines, data services, software-defined networks and many more.

However, while writing a toy custom controller is relatively easy, there are many challenges when writing a production-grade one.

At anynines, we are building a whole control plane based on custom Kubernetes controllers to fully automate the life-cycle management of data services. In doing so, we became aware of many challenges associated with production-grade controllers. This article describes one challenge we rarely see discussed: The “real world” can autonomously deviate from the users’ desired state, so it must be watched by controllers just like the Kubernetes API.

author: Allan Draper
author_info: Business Startup Expert | Investor | 8-Figure business founder | Business Podcaster | AllanDraper.com
content:
Before you start, just like every other business, you need to develop clear reasons why you want to take on the responsibility of starting a pest control business. You’ll return to these reasons as motivation during frustrating times. 🦠
------
First, as the owner, I do believe that you’re in control of your financial destiny. If your business performs well, the sky’s the limit regarding what you can earn. You have the potential to earn far more money as an owner than an employee. 

Additionally, as the owner, you’re in charge of every aspect of the business. You decide when you work, what clients you want to take on, and all other aspects. Owning the business offers you far more freedom than working for someone else. 

Finally, and perhaps most importantly, owning a pest control business allows you to assist people during trying times. After all, when someone has a pest infestation, they need help fast. You can provide that help so folks feel comfortable and safe in their own homes or anywhere where they need your service.

#allandraper #businesscoach #businessmentor #financialfreedom #taketheleap #growthexpert #businesscash #mentorship #startbusiness #growbusiness #newentrepreneur #pestcontrol #pestcontrolbusiness

content:
Auditor General to Release Interim Audit Report on COVID-19 Intervention Funds 
Auditor General to Release Interim Audit Report on COVID-19 Intervention Funds

The Auditor-General for the Federation (AuGF), Mr. Anthony Ayine on Wednesday said the first interim audit report on the COVID-19 intervention funds will be released next week.

He said the maiden report would assess the utilisation of funds released to manage the pandemic starting from the period the Presidential Task Force (PTF) was established up till June 30.He added that the report would be published quarterly from now on.

He, however,  declined to comment on the highlights of the report, citing administrative protocol of first submitting its findings to the National Assembly before making its content public.

Ayine spoke to journalists shortly after the executive members of the Conference of Auditors-General for Local Governments/Area Councils in Nigeria, led by its chairman, Mr. Atiku Musa, presented him with a https://lnkd.in/dc2CCdc

author: Robert Berry
author_info: I help auditors ask better questions ➟ Corporate & Audit Trainer | Business Consultant | 🎤 International Speaker
content:
Every Auditor Should Study Psychology - Audit Bites EP014

Have you ever sat in a meeting and thought, "Everyone in here is bat sh** crazy"? Thousands of auditors sit in meetings presenting facts to clients who, instead of acknowledging issues, go on the attack. Stunned, trying to figure out what went wrong, these same auditors retreat in defeat while the control environment gets  weaker. 

What happens when clients are crazy? 

In this episode, we'll discuss why every auditor needs to study psychology and how it can help you better understand irrational client behaviors.

author: Arpit Garg
content:
I am delighted to share that I have qualified Certified Internal Auditor (all 3 parts) from one and only most recognized global professional body - Institute of Internal Auditors.
Over the last 1 year of pursuing CIA, I have always tried to add back to the fraternity with the knowledge and push them to purse and qualify this critical and important course in the domain of Risk Advisory (both through voluntary sessions and with  VG Learning Destination). 

Seeing amazing results and 250 + fellow members across countries referring to my recorded videos and sessions for CIA Part 1 and Part 2. I am excited to announce a Free/Voluntary knowledge session series for the CIA Challenge exam beginning this weekend with limited 60 seats (on first cum basis). The sessions will be stretched for 3 weeks and will be mostly done in evening hours on weekdays (from 8 pm to 11 pm) and on the weekends (6 pm to 9 pm). Schedule will be shared separately. 

Please note there will be no recording shared and these will be live sessions. 

I am looking for 50% strength with fellow members who have appeared for CIA challenge exam and could not clear in first attempt and balance 50% of fellow members who are 10 + years experienced in the Risk Advisory domain. Sharing the google form for your quick update and registration. 

https://lnkd.in/ggR6K9fy

The shortlisted members will receive email for the session series. Thanks for all the appreciation so far on this journey.
IIA India

author: Defense Contract Management Agency (DCMA)
content:
Keystones (Developmental Program) to QAs: 
Two women share their path to a career in quality assurance

Hanscom Air Force Base, Mass.  –  
Only around 10 percent of quality assurance specialists with Defense Contract Management Agency are women — something the agency wants to change by encouraging women to enter the career field.
Two recent graduates of DCMA’s Keystone program, Aisha Glover and Myra Valentine, are among the newest women QAs to join the ranks of the quality workforce.
The Keystone Program is a 3-year entry-level developmental program that establishes an avenue to hire internal and external applicants using competitive and noncompetitive appointing authorities.
#qualityassurance #dcma #womeninaerospace #womeninaviation
#qa #asq #quality #careers

author: Ahmed Alamin
content:
It is a privilege and an honor to be a part of one of the world's greatest engineering and technology universities. It was obvious to me that I wanted to pursue my master's degree at a university that could inspire me with its city as well as the wisdom and experience of teachers and students from all over the world, and Politecnico di Torino is definitely the place to achieve it .
I realised that it was not about reaching the end line first but having enjoyed the run.
On 16th of December 2021, I graduated from Poltiecnico di Torino with a master's degree in Mechanical Engineering .
I did my MSc thesis in the field of renewable energy which is going to be considered in the next years for many applications to diminish the global warming ,the title of my thesis is  Numerical optimization of enhanced linear Fresnel collector equipped with Raschig rings porous medium. 
I would like to thank my supportive supervisor Laura Savoldi for her help and guidance throughout the research and special thanks to the PhD student  Mr. Hossein Ebadi  the discussions with him has helped me to overcome difficulties to proceed my thesis.
All thanks and appreciation should be given to my best university Politecnico di Torino and Italian government for fully funded scholarship that provided me to pursue my studies.
At the end of this journey , I should never forget to thank my cousin Khaled Alamin   for his support during these years. Moreover , my family and friends who always have shown their support. Without them, I would not be able to reach this point. My love and gratefulness to them are beyond any words.
Eventually, I am looking forward to the social and career challenges, my commitment to become a mechanical engineer is very strong and I am certain I can contribute to the society I live in.

author: Maximilian Busser
content:
A year ago, I wrote that 2020 – against all odds – had been insane. If 2020 was insane, how can I possibly describe 2021?

What almost killed us at the beginning of 2020 made us infinitely stronger in 2021. We continued to reinvent ourselves and our ecosystem – the company itself, our key suppliers, retailers and partners, our team – blew my mind with their solidarity, creativity and agility, along with an enormous amount of energy.

The result? Hands down our best year ever.

A few highlights? A dozen product launches including the hyper radical HM9-SV, the celebratory LMX marking 10 years of Legacy Machines, and a disruptive experiment called “M.A.D.1”; the first completions of our new retail identity, visible in Dubai and Bangkok; outstanding auction results including the HM10 Panda for Only Watch, reaching the highest price ever for an MB&F; two awards at the GPHG; an euphoric collaboration with Bulgari; and the unprecedented demand for pieces like the new LM101s which collectors are desperate to get their hands on, despite wait times of over two years.

Bottom line, in 2021 we delivered 275 watches to our retailers… who sold nearly 400 to their final customers. Our best sell-in vs sell-out ratio ever.

My most heartfelt thanks go to our clients, retailers, partners, suppliers, supporters, the team… to all of you, our Friends. You make me so happy and so proud.

We’re ready to rock, 2022!

author: Byron Edwards
content:

author: Pedro Costa Ferreira
content:
Boa tarde, amigos!

Escrevo esse post para me despedir e, principalmente agradecer por esse longo período em que estive na FGV|IBRE. Afinal, foram 8 anos de muitas conquistas, desafios, tensões criativas, frustrações, alegrias... Como diria Roberto: “Se chorei ou se sorri, o importante é que emoções eu vivi”.

Projetos? Muitos! Quero citar alguns aqui, não apenas para celebrar as nossas conquistas, mas também para relembrar de aprendizados e conhecimento que cada um gerou, e este capital intelectual continua dentro do IBRE, em vocês, pronto para ser aproveitado. 

	     - Na melhoria da qualidade e eficiência, trabalhamos duro para cocriar o PRICE COLLECTOR, começamos a parceria com os amigos da FGV|Emap em 2015, passamos pela parceria com nosso amigo Alberto Cavallo e chegamos em uma base de preços web robusta que nos ajudou a superar as limitações impostas pelo Covid. Outra conquista? Resolvemos, juntos, o problema de mais de 6 anos do SACV. Thank god, nunca mais ouviu-se falar em SACV.
          - Na monetização também tivemos contribuições importantes. Fizemos algumas versões do Smart IBRE, o Simulador CMG, o InteliRec, em parceria com a Saint Gobain e fizemos mudanças importantes no Licenciados que este ano crescerá a receita em aproximadamente 20%. Acredito também muito nos Projetos QUOD|O/F e de Mercado de trabalho, serão um breakthrough nas finanças\impacto do IBRE.
          - Ficamos mais tempo focado nos “bens públicos” e, por isso, é claro, é onde temos mais contribuições. Fizemos o BETS, maior pacote R de base de dados brasileira com mais de 15 mil downloads por mês e citado internacionalmente. Fizemos o primeiro pacote R de nowcasting do mundo e fomos pioneiros no nowcasting do PIB brasileiro. Criamos o NTF e junto o Portal da Inflação. Publicamos junto com a Elsevier o livro Análise de Séries Temporais em R, que já está na quarta tiragem. Tivemos papel relevante na cultura de dados do FGV|IBRE e fomos pioneiros no uso de ferramentas como o RShiny, Python, Git, Mongo, etc. E, claro, não podíamos esquecer do Indicador de Incerteza da Economia. Citado em mais de 5 atas do Copom é o indicador público mais big data e data Science do Brasil.
              - Além disso, junto com o FGV|IDE tive o prazer e a honra de cocriar o curso de Big Data e Data Science que foi o maior sucesso. Mais de 600 alunos passaram pelo nosso curso, inclusive, claro, vários amigos do IBRE que colocávamos no curso como “ouvinte” (rsrs...).

Tudo isso, é claro, não teria sido possível se não fossem as pessoas e aqui aproveito para agradecer todas elas que trabalharam comigo. Vocês são demais!!!! Meu muito obrigado!! 

Acho que é isso. É muito difícil resumir 8 anos em um post. Quero agradecer a TODXS, sem exceção, por esses oito anos de convivência. Muitos objetivos foram alcançados, mas, o mais importante, foi muito prazeroso trilhar o caminho junto com vocês. OBRIGADO, FGV|IBRE!!!

Muitíssimo obrigado e um forte abraço,
Pedro

author: Isle of Man Public Service Careers
content:
Join our team as a Collection Manager for the Income tax Division within Treasury!

In this role, you will be managing the Payments, Debt Collection and Prosecution Teams to ensure that operational targets and performance measures are met. You will be working closely with the managers of the teams to ensure the targets are met and any issues are identified.

You will ensure that client accounts are reviewed in a timely manner and any payments, refunds or collection actions are dealt with in accordance with the supporting legislation and regulations.

If you have good knowledge of Income Tax legislation and National Insurance in the Isle of Man and are a great communicator at all levels, we would love to hear from you!

The closing date for this role is 14 January 2022. To find out more and apply, click the link below!

author: Shashi Kanth K A
content:
DuPont Hiring Internal Controls Specialist - Finance, Please apply from below link.

Detailed Roles and Responsibilities
Provide SOD/DOA activity guidance (internal control aspect) and education to business/functional personnel
Conduct the activity of SOD (Segregation of Duties) monitoring for all the ERP/Non ERP systems through the defined procedure and raising flag wherever needed
Coordinate with the auditors for the audit procedure around SOD Monitoring activities
Provide on ground support for internal control-related issues
Provide DOA Advisory services and administrations
Conduct assessments within the organization for various SOX aspects and understand the need for continual improvements/upgrades to the processes
Support for all SOX related matters in the Organization
KCA Database administration – set up new control owners, ensure appropriate access, drive adherence to timelines and report the results
Monitors evaluation status during evaluation periods
Ensures evaluation effectively conducted
Advises and directs responses to all control queries from within the assigned areas
Others
Monitors remediation of audit issues; proactively supports remediation to address internal control weaknesses
Internal & External Audit Coordination
Ensuring to act as active back up for other Controls and Governance Processes
Deliver assistance and expertise for additional activities as requested
Provide support in other key areas as requested by Management
Complete requests end to end including communication on the results
Supporting the Global Reconciliation Tool (Blackline) administration process and other Admin activities for such activities covering the compliance & governance scope.
Qualifications & Attributes needed:
CA Inter with 3-4 years of relevant experience.
Working in the fields of Internal Controls and having the good knowledge around SOD/DOA.
Versatility and capability to handle numerous tasks and challenges. Must be open for various roles in Compliance and Governance related activities.
Good analytical skill and communication skills
Must be open to work in EMEA shift (basis needs)
Knowledge on SAP System
Experience in Internal Controls area around IT general controls would be an added advantage.

author: Heber Marinho da Silva
author_info: Assessor de Controles Internos no Sicredi
content:
Dia de comemorar. Hoje recebi o diploma de CICS (Certified Internal Control Specialist) emitido pelo ICI (Internal Control Institute).

Gratidão acima de tudo a Deus, por me conceder forças e sabedoria, minha esposa Diane Duque pelo apoio durante os estudos e na vida, ao professor Eduardo Person Pardini, CICP pelos ensinamentos, ao Sicredi, todas as instâncias pela excelente estrutura e apoio para poder exercer minha atividade, meus pais pelo exemplo de vida e apoio incondicional e você que algum momento torceu, orou,.desejou sorte etc. para que eu conquistasse mais está etapa. Controle é uma das funções da Administração e muitas vezes encarado como burocracia, mas é uma importante instrumento para alcançarmos nossos objetivos. Agora.... Vamos aplicar e compartilhar conhecimento
#sicredi 
#sicredirio#cooperativismo 
#gestaoderiscos
#controlesintermos

CICS Recertification🥳

Para quem não sabe a certificação CICS – Certified Internal Control Specialist é um programa desenvolvido pelo ICI – Internal Control Institute para reconhecer aqueles indivíduos que demonstrem um predefinido nível de conhecimento e competência em controles internos. Este programa de certificação foi desenvolvido para adicionar valor à profissão, aos profissionais e ao empregador. É um programa dirigido por uma comissão independente (Independent Certification Board), administrado pelo Internal Control Institute – ICI USA.

author: Sarwat Khan
author_info: Senior Human Resources Business Partner TPL Corp Ltd. and Visiting Faculty Member Iqra University
content:
Career Opportunity: Internal Control Specialist 
TPL Corp Ltd. is the investment holding company of the TPL Group with investments across the insurance, real estate, transport, security, technology, vehicle and container tracking, navigation and mapping solutions, and financial sectors. 
 
Currently, we are looking for the services of energetic, enthusiastic, and result-oriented professionals for the position of Internal Control Specialist:
 
The Internal Control Specialist will be responsible for ensuring a strong internal control environment through the development of policies and procedures and monitoring compliance. This position will work to foster standardization and consistency across business processes and internal controls. He / She should be a critical thinker with a keen interest in improving an organization’s internal control environment with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
 
The ideal candidate should be ACA / ACMA / ACCA/ CIMA with at least 5 years of post-qualification experience in internal audit departments of well-reputed organizations. 
 
Location: Karachi
 
If this sounds like you, please send your resume to:  sarwat.khan@tplcorp.com & careers@tplcorp.com

author: Danny Woods
author_info: Director of Account Services - EGYM Digital | MBA Student
content:
After 5 amazing years, this is my last week with EGYM | North America. 

I have learned so much during an incredible journey with EGYM and been given countless opportunities that I will be forever thankful for. I joined EGYM (formerly Netpulse) as a Key Account Manager in 2017. In 2018 I was promoted to Head of Account Management - EMEA. In 2019 I was promoted to Director of Account Services - EMEA and attended The ukactive Future Leaders Programme. In 2020 I started my MBA at Oxford Brookes University. And finally, in 2021 I was promoted to Director of Account Services - North America. As I reflect on my time here, enough cannot be said about EGYM's commitment to developing those with a can-do attitude.

Also, a special thank you to Dana Milkie for your trust, support, and advice my friend. It was a short but successful ride under your leadership in N.A. that unfortunately came to a halt due to the ongoing pandemic.

None of the above would have been possible without the support of several other key people (you know who you are) and I cannot speak highly enough of my experiences with EGYM and my awesome colleagues at EGYM | DACH, EGYM | Spain, EGYM | France, EGYM | United Kingdom, EGYM | North America. To past and present colleagues - you will never understand the impact that you had on me personally and the enjoyment that I received from working with you. I do not doubt that 2022 will be the best year yet for EGYM and I wish you all every success personally and professionally.

I would also like to thank every health and fitness operator around the world that I have had the pleasure of collaborating with. I am extremely proud of several projects and achievements. What an epic ride together! In addition to this I would also like to thank our partners across the globe; without you a number of key initiatives wouldn’t have been possible.

As for my future, I am delighted to be taking on a new challenge with Alex Peacock and the talented team at SweatWorks as Global Client Services Director.

Wishing you all a relaxing and happy holiday season and look forward to seeing you in 2022.

author: Bill Kelso
content:
Over the past few months, I have independently studied to pass the APA 91: Principles of Premium Auditing Exam. This past weekend I was able to pass my first exam to achieving my goal of getting my APA designation.

From this course I have gained knowledge in insurance law, premium audit planning, review of insured’s employees and operations, accounting system evaluation, audit program design, data verification and analysis, premium audit report, communication and premium auditing, professionalism in premium auditing, and premium audit technology. Overall the knowledge gained from this course will be beneficial for me in my premium auditing career.

I'm excited to apply this knowledge now and in the future when it comes to my daily premium audits in the field. I recommend this course to anyone interested in gaining a better understanding of premium auditing. Next up, APA 92: Premium Auditing Applications.

author: Daniel West
author_info: Senior Business Development Manager at Brilliant®
content:
Need some end of year or early January assistance in your Accounting/Finance group? We have candidates who can start working IMMEDIATELY on a contract or contract to hire basis. (see below for profiles)
 
Cash Application Specialist  
*Received and applied up to 150 payments daily to appropriate    customer accounts
*Applied ACH/Wire, Check and Credit Card Payments to accounts
*Researched and resolved over pays and short pays
*Issued credit memos and chargebacks
*Systems: MS Dynamics AX and AS400
 
Credit/Collections 
*Maintained portfolios of up to 300 accounts and $6M
*Performed collections activities over the phone and via email
*Prepared AR reporting for customers and sales
*Researched and resolved and invoice discrepancies
*Researched deductions including pricing, rebates, and short shipments
*Processed credit and/or debit memos 
*Systems:  Oracle, Advanced Excel
 
Staff Accountant 
*Performed a 10-day month end close, including posting journal entries and accruals
*Reconciled multiple bank accounts monthly
*Prepared payments/cash receipts and recorded all funds received/paid 
*Adjusted bill fees and inputted tax checks and refund checks 
*Assisted with yearly audits and variance reports

If you or anyone you know is interested in hearing more about one of the above candidates, please reach out to me directly at dwest@brilliantfs.com or call me at 847-805-5093!

author: Nolwazi Marcia Dladla
author_info: Internal Communications Specialist l  BA Hons in Strategic Brand Comms (Vega) l  IIG Co-Opt Council Member: Marketing
content:
So after almost 9 Years I celebrate a beautiful milestone and soon bid farewell to Munich Re of Africa ❤️

Picture: Mogomotsi Phage captured a beautiful painting by one of the schools MRoA sponsored. It’s a clear depiction of Ubuntu and for me personally, an understanding that together, when an organisation moves with compassion and humility, colleagues and everyone who engages with it can only flourish! 

Allow me to elaborate… 

This amazing company on Empire has looked after me and groomed my career. Here, I completed numerous qualifications and took on two of the best roles! I’ve been able to engage with the industry through the Insurance Institute of Gauteng where my understanding and love for our industry grew deeper and moulded me into a well rounded Communications,Marketing & Branding specialist. 

Thank you to the phenomenal leadership at MRoA, I’ve grown immensely as a professional as well as being able to call this place home as so many of my colleagues are now family!  

For the longest time it never felt like work! I reported to the most amazing humans who happened to also be executives, actuaries, underwriters, accountants, specialist and global experts! 🙌🏾🥰
 
As I embark on a new journey in Europe, I will always remember what I’ve learnt and what it takes to bloom. 
 
Thank You Munich Re  for being the best launching pad for my career. It’s been an unforgettable journey! 🥂

See you somewhere in the world! ✌🏾

 #reinsurance #thankyou #career #love

author_info: Hiring Php Professionals to unlock their endless potential and be a Successful Nxter | Ex - Wirecard | Ex - Tech Mahindra
content:
☁️ Cloud alert! 
 
Microsoft  and Banco Santander have conducted a join study to evaluate the “cloud nativeness” of PagoNxt (a Santander company)’s plaforms against market standards: 

📋 This assessment has evaluated under: 25 criteria on 9 categories, including architecture design, ecosystem orientation, automation, orchestration and next-gem infrastructure in between others. 

The peer comparison has been conducted using benchmark data from three types of industry peers: 

➡️ 50 universal banks
➡️ 40 specialized payment providers 
➡️ 8 digital banks

The results are self-explanatory:
1️⃣ PagoNxt platforms are cloud native and has the right tech foundations to enable sustainable, inclusive business growth, as well as fast and consistent execution.

2️⃣ PagoNxt has a forward-thinking technology stack and superior capabilities to industry peers, with the resiliency, scalability and scale offered by cloud.

😎 These facts place PagoNxt at a distinctive competitive advantage against both incumbent banks and pure digital payments specialists, who on average are 40% behind in terms of cloud-native capabilities.
 
In a nutshell, we are on our little cloud!
