author: Ben Bowden
author_info: Head of Compliance and Regulatory, APAC at Currencycloud. Experienced General Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer.
content:
Moving from banking into fintech.

I spent many years at a bank. It’s great grounding for a career in inhouse legal and compliance, given the level of regulatory scrutiny banks are under and therefore the strong controls they need. 

Also I was able to move around and support different businesses, which kept me learning and growing. Eventually, though, I was bitten by the fintech bug. First it was through working with SC Ventures, Standard Chartered’s fintech accelerator. Then Assembly Payments, one of SC Ventures' companies. And now Currencycloud, a B2B2X cross-border payments specialist.

In fintech you have to move fast, but you can’t break things. I enjoy the pace and the responsibility to take risk decisions. I also enjoy being part of a tight-knit team all pulling in the same direction. 

At Currencycloud, it’s particularly fun to be taking a business that has worked in the West and building it out across APAC.

If you want to join us, check out our open roles https://bit.ly/3xvjwtu  

We’ll be hiring for some compliance roles in APAC next year.

#fintech #crossborderpayments #fx #nottoomanyhashtags #thatwouldbeannoying

author: Thomas Kurian
content:
Hi All, 
After six thrilling and happening years in NPCI, I have now moved on to a new role. I am ever grateful to my seniors, my team and colleagues at NPCI; colleagues from member banks, FSPs; Senior officials from SEBI I have interacted with during the IPO launch of UPI; officials from NSE, BSE, and many others from the capital industry who have been an integral part of this journey of innovation and learning.
 
While there were many projects and initiatives that we have worked and delivered successfully as a team in UPI, the UPI-fication of the IPO process remains the closest to my heart! 
 
I have embarked on a new journey with UN-based Better Than Cash Alliance as a Digital Payments Specialist- India & SE Asia. I am delighted that I will continue to contribute to the digital payments space and creating solutions for the next billion users. Do check out the UN Principles of Responsible Digital Payments that were launched yesterday by the Honorable Finance Minister of India. https://lnkd.in/eDsKFktv

author: AfricaNenda
content:
AfricaNenda welcomes its Technical Payment Specialist Vanessa K Umutoni starting September 1st, 2021
Ms Vanessa Umutoni is a leader in digital financial services, fintech and payment solutions, with extensive leadership experience in both private and non-profit organizations. As Technical Payment Specialist, she focuses on designing and advocating for efficient and affordable payment platforms.
Before joining AfricaNenda, Vanessa worked with the Mastercard Foundation Center for Innovative Teaching & Learning ICT, where she led a regional entrepreneurship program with companies from seven African countries, and as a senior product manager at Pivot Access, where she led the company’s fintech product portfolio. She also served as the vice-president of Girls in ICT Rwanda for seven years. She is an alumna of Carnegie Mellon University, and Mbarara University of Science and Technology.
Welcome!

author: Ruairí Conroy
content:
These are very exciting times for everyone associated with Diligent in Galway. In the space of a week we achieved the following milestones:

- Surpassed more than 200 people hired since opening 10 months ago

- Returned to the Office for the first time thanks to the PorterShed

- Welcomed our CEO Brian Stafford to Galway for the first time along with Liam Healy, Adrian Fleming & Margaret Fisher 

- Embarked on our next chapter as One Diligent with Steele, Galvanize, and Accuvio with a week long interactive global learning experience

- Attended the National University of Ireland, Galway Careers Fair where we smashed the avg. for breakout rooms (+1118%), students booking 1-1 discussions (+310%) and Applications (+128%)

- We hosted our first outdoor team social event bringing people across the site together for the very first time 

This however is only the tip of the iceberg of what awaits us over the coming months as we look forward to moving into Bonham Quay in early 2022 which will be the most impressive office space around thanks to Paddy Mc Donald Triona Barrett, Gerry Barrett and all the Unispace team Lesley Kelly Wayne McMullan Caroline Maguire support hugely by Louise Dwyer

We are continuing to grow based on the breadth and depth of talent we have been able to attract in the west of Ireland and across the country. content:
Please join us in celebrating NorCal associates Chris Kline and Lisa Andales on their recent promotions.

Chris Kline has been promoted to Center of Store Operations Specialist in District 1. He has been part of the Albertsons Companies team since 2010, when he joined Safeway as a Courtesy Clerk. Since 2017, Chris has been Store Director at stores in Rohnert Park and Santa Rosa, CA. He's a team leader and has coached Assistant Store Directors to achieve success in Center of Store operations. 		

Chris successfully launched Drive Up & Go at both of his stores and credits the opportunity to work with many great mentors throughout his years. In 2018, Chris was awarded the “Superfecta” Award for hitting sales, labor, gross profit, and EBITDA.

author: Binod Shankar, CFA
author_info: Executive Coach, Speaker, Podcaster, Guest on CNBC & Bloomberg
content:
Interesting & controversial recent piece. 🔥🔥

What I thought were the author’s TEN main points (quoted verbatim): 

1. The CFA is not a license to practice finance.
2. The CFA is just one of many factors that an employer might take into consideration in the hiring process.
3. Many back office employees take the exams in the hopes that they might advance to the front office, in search of respect and a higher paycheck. Frequently, they don’t.
4. The biggest cost associated with the decision to become a CFA is time.
5. On Wall Street, the CFA is held in much higher regard (than the MBA). 
6. The CFA program doesn’t necessarily make you a better investor.
7. None of the really interesting things that are happening in finance these days, like the study of sentiment and psychology, are covered in any detail by the CFA program.
8. I honestly don’t remember a single thing I learned from the CFA program. On the other hand, I got a great deal out of my MBA program, which was an immersive experience.
9. Whether people realize it or not, finance is a profession that requires a lot of creativity. The CFA program beats it out of people.
10. Often, the benefit is pure credentialism: you get to put the letters “CFA” after your name.

The below Reddit thread has many comments that show different perspectives. 

https://lnkd.in/dBaGdtu8

I’m keen to hear from my connections. What’s your experience? What do you think?? 🤔😊😎

#cfaprogram #cfaexam #cfainstitute #wallstreet #assetmanagement #equityresearch #qualifications

author: Lora Cecere
content:
Supply chain planning--once a promising technology-struggles to drive innovation. Why? I believe that the design requires a step-change in thinking. Here I ask some questions:
-If HR can be self-service by the organization, why can supply chain planning be used more broadly by the organization? Why do we depend on 1% of the back office employees averaging two years of tenure to use the technology?
-Current architectures are very "model" or "engine-centric". Why are we not more focused on workflow, rules, and policy management?
-In current architectures, manufacturing, procurement, and transportation operate within silos. How do we drive bi-directional orchestration across source, make and deliver together?
-With the greater depth of NoSQL, why are we locked into relational data structures?
-As variability increases, why is there no central repository to help sense and respond to variation in lead times and conversion rates? 

As we build planning outside-in, some of these gaps are easier to close. For more on my thoughts, check out my podcast for the week.




https://lnkd.in/d-A9NiP

author: Waleed Alazki MBA - CIPD
content:
الصف الأمامي والصف الخلفي من الموظفين !!!!

كثير من المؤسسات الربحية لديها صفين كما ذكرت في بداية الرسالة، ولكن الغريب في الأمر أن بعض المؤسسات تفرق بين الفريقين إذا ما أتينا وقت التكريم والتحفيز وغيرها من الأمور نرى هناك إجحاف في حق الصف الخلفي (Back office employees). 
دائماً ما أشبه موظفي المؤسسات بفريق رياضي، أي جميع أعضاء الفريق يتلقون تدريبات مكثفة كل في موقعه وعند فوز الفريق ببطولة ما فكل الفريق يحصل على نفس الجائزة ونفس التكريم ونفس الشهرة، مع العلم ان القيمة السوقية للاعب(الموظف) تختلف من لاعب(موظف) لآخر كل حسب موقعه ومهاراته، كذلك الموظفين ، بما أن كل موظف يؤدي دوره وواجباته على أكمل وجه فيحق له الحصول على ذات التكريم والتحفيز التي يحصل عليها موظف الصف الأمامي مع مراعاة بعض المفارقات البسيطة والتي لا تؤثر على نفسية موظف الصف الخلفي. 

تفاوت التفرقة بين الموظفين تؤثر سلبا على بيئة العمل وتزيد الفجوة بين الموظفين بالموظفين، والموظفين بالإدارات وقد يكون سببا في رحيل الموظفين الموهوبين وأيضآ انشاء بيئة عمل غير صحية. 

أسمعوني رأيكم 👂🏻👂🏻👂🏻


Front line & back line of the employees. 

Many of  institutions have two categories of employees ,as l mentioned at the beginning of this message. But what’s strange is  some of institutions distinguish between these two lines in honoring, motivating, and others matters, which are unfair to the right of back line (Back office employees).usually l compare employees with the sport team , in other words, both member’s team practice intensively, each in his position ,So when the team wins a championship all members getting a same award ,honor, and fame. Although the market value differ from player (employee)to another according to his/her position and skills. Whereas every employee performs his/her duties to the fullest , he or she is entitled to receive a same honor and motivation as the front line employees members, taking in consideration a small variations .
 
The disparity between employees negatively impact in working environment , and increase the gap between staff members ,as well as between employees and management , and It could be a reason for the talented employees to leave the ORG and also to create an unhealthy work environment.

Share your point of view 👂🏻👂🏻👂🏻

author: Tuli Urbach
author_info: Founder at Millennial Capital Management LLC | Private Investment Practice | Co-Founder at Jewish Sports Leagues LLC
content:
"The CFA exams were created in 1963 as a way to establish standards of proficiency in securities analysis. If you pass all three levels and earn the CFA charter, you are assumed to know things about accounting, financial statements, derivatives and portfolio theory. No such standard existed prior to the CFA, and the securities industry lacked a professional designation like the CPA, which those in the accounting profession need to practice their craft. But the CFA is not a licensure exam. CFAs and non-CFAs alike work in investment banking, investment research and trading. There is a licensure exam in finance, and it’s called the Series 7, but it’s not too difficult."

"So if the CFA is not a license to practice finance, what is it? Many take the exams to get ahead in their careers, thinking that the CFA designation might earn them a promotion or a better-paying job. In reality, the CFA is just one of many factors that an employer might take into consideration in the hiring process. I have encountered many low-level finance workers and back office employees who take the exams in the hopes that they might advance to the front office, in search of respect and a higher paycheck. Frequently, they don’t."

"The biggest cost associated with the decision to become a CFA is time. The CFA doesn’t cost much in the way of actual dollars, just a few thousand for the entire course of study. But it takes up an enormous amount of time consisting of many hundreds and even thousands of hours of studying for each level. And that’s if they pass all three exams on the first try, which only about 20% of people do. For the other 80%, it’s a commitment of four or five years, and sometimes longer. I have several friends who, once they began the CFA program, seemingly disappeared, not to be seen for three years.”

"I realized when I was studying for the exams that I wasn’t really learning the material; I was just learning how to pass a test. I honestly don’t remember a single thing I learned from the CFA program. On the other hand, I got a great deal out of my MBA program, which was an immersive experience, with in-person classes, guest lectures and study groups. My MBA is still paying dividends. The CFA Institute has, whether intentionally or not, euthanized the MBA. On Wall Street, the CFA is held in much higher regard, which is too bad because the MBA degree (or other graduate programs) produce more well-rounded and thoughtful employees."

"My biggest criticism of the CFA program is that it doesn’t necessarily make you a better investor. If there were concrete evidence that funds managed by CFA charterholders outperformed those of non-CFAs, that would be a compelling reason to take the test. But there is none —it’s all theater. And none of the really interesting things that are happening in finance these days, like the study of sentiment and psychology, are covered in any detail by the CFA program."
______
#investing #finance

content:
Mediterranean Shipping Company, thank you!

My journey at MSC will officially end at the end of this month. A huge company which is one of the engines of our modern society.

I’ve met colleagues and made friends within MSC NL and also abroad.
I wanna thank you all for this great journey!
Special thanks also to Robert B. for the fruitful collaboration the last 5 years and the trust in me. 

Also a big thanks to all for the parting gift!
I will surely enjoy it 😁

author: James M. Bass
author_info: Executive Director at Central Texas Regional Mobility Authority
content:
As I prepare to exit today & turn over the job at TxDOT to Marc Williams, I have but one thing left to say to the women & men of @TxDOT - it has been an honor & privilege to work with you for over 33 years. From a summer hire back in Ft Worth, to opening the mail in the Finance Division, to testifying at the Texas Legislature, to CFO, and then as Executive Director it has been an honor to be associated with everyone and the work at TxDOT. 

Look forward my future at CTRMA and to the future of TxDOT. 
#StaySafe
#AllTheBest
#TxDOTFamily
#ConnectingYouWithTexas

content:
"Thank you for sharing the internship list. I have been searching for internships for the past many months and I am not able to find myself one. But this list contains all the openings in different firms that I was searching for. Keep up the good work."

There are hundreds of similar texts as above in my DM and mailbox, I started this initiative thinking that I may be able to help some 100-200 people but I didn't know that this initiative would reach lakhs of people. Even, some recruiters reached out to me in search of talents and I recommended some of the people.

So, now I have decided to add more to this and try to help as many people as I can in any way possible. So, I have again compiled a list of 120+ LinkedIn posts that contains open position for intern ranging from growing startups to big giants like Intel, Urban Company, ClearTax, Cisco, EY, Big Basket, Cars24, PwC, Forbes and many more. 

If you want to get access to the list and benefit others as well, please comment on your email address and I will be sharing the list with you over the email.

Update 15: I have sent the mail to the first 3200 people. I will be sending the emails to the remaining people as well. Thank you for your patience!

author: Dominique Pope
content:
I felt compelled to say that if you're like me, and recently decided to switch gears in your law school career path, I'M WITH YOU. Constantly waking up to silence or rejection emails. You tell yourself, "Maybe if my grades were higher, maybe if I had cooler experiences, maybe if I..." Some of us didn't get high grades during our first year because it was difficult to acclimate to law school as a first-generation student. Some of us entered into law school thinking that we had to limit ourselves to a certain sector of law due to our ethnic background. Some of us may have wanted to explore different practice areas of the law too late in the summer hiring process, and now you feel as if opportunities are scarce. Some of us have questioned if law school is the path for us with all the no's that we have been getting lately. These are all scenarios that I have definitely identified with. 

However, I'm writing this to encourage others (even myself) and let you know that you're not alone. I hope that you land the job that you truly desire because you are worthy of it! We are doing our best to balance school, extracurriculars, and our personal lives during a pandemic. Rejection will happen, but nothing that is meant for your life will pass you by. 

#firstgeneration #lawstudent

author: Neela Mollgaard
content:
Proud to share that Launch Minnesota received a National Award – SBA's "Super Connector"!  

LaunchMN submitted a proposal on behalf of our partners in the Launch Minnesota Network, specifically:
- MNSBIR Pat Dillon,CDR,USN (Ret)
-UMN Technology Commercialization Russ Straate, Mary MacCarthy, MBA & Rick Huebsch
- UMN Gary S. Holmes Center for Entrepreneurship John Stavig , Carla Pavone
- University Enterprise Laboratories (UEL) Diane Rucker
- Launch MN Hubs: Meg Steuer (she/her), Stacy Janda- Nimmo, Larry Hosch, Dave Hengel, Nicholas Wolff

The competition's goal is to encourage entrepreneurship and inclusive, sustainable growth by developing and commercializing technology to improve access to resources. This award was possible because of the great work of all our network partners and supporters across the state.👏

The U.S. Small Business Administration partnered with the National Science and Technology Council to award $330,000 in prizes in the new Lab-to-Market (L2M) Competition. It affirmed the power of working together to grow MN's startup ecosystem!

author: Chris Whittington
author_info: Supporting estate planners, financial professionals and families following a bereavement.
content:
Welcome to the penultimate day of the ZEDRA Group 12 days of Christmas.

We know that it takes a leap of faith to start referring your clients to a third party provider and thanks to those that have reached out over the last 10 days for more information. 

Referrals play a large part in building any business and we want our partnerships to flourish and go from strength to strength. As we grow, we hope that our partners business will grow.

With an existing large client bank, we will often require assistance with some of our services and this is where we will be looking to utilise the support and expertise from our partners out in the regions.
It is important that we ensure that our clients have the support they need when dealing with the inheritance due to them and we will confirm if they would some advice from our financial partners.

This could in-turn create further referral opportunities and help you to generate an extra income stream in addition to the generous fee share on offer.

Sound good ???. It would be great to have a chat and outline our vision to be the most respected Probate & Estate Administration Partner in the industry.

#willsandtrusts #probate #estateadministration #estateplanning #intergenerationalwealth #12daysofchristmas

author: Dan Bednar
author_info: Meteorologist at National Weather Service, Center Weather Service Unit
content:
I am thrilled to announce that I will be joining the National Weather Service in April. This is truly a dream job where I will apply my passion for meteorology toward a mission to protect the lives and livelihoods of Americans. To be a part of the federal government agency that is the official source of weather forecasts and warnings for the U.S. will be deeply fulfilling.
 
After 14 incredible years with WSI, The Weather Company, and IBM, I will embark on the next phase of my journey as a Meteorologist supporting Federal Aviation Administration partners at the Miami Air Route Traffic Control Center in Miami, FL. Within the Center Weather Service Unit, I will be responsible for the delivery of accurate and dependable weather products and services to air traffic managers and controllers.
 
As I look back on my career thus far, I am grateful for each colleague and client who I have had the honor and privilege to work with and for the many opportunities to learn and grow. Together we developed innovative solutions that enabled business to operate safely and efficiently in the face of disruptive weather.
 
I look forward to meeting or reconnecting with colleagues and partners to build a Weather-Ready Nation and meet the needs of 330 million Americans who rely on us to keep them safe.

author: Infineon Technologies
content:
In December NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration partnered with European Space Agency - ESA and Canadian Space Agency | Agence spatiale canadienne, is set to launch the James Webb Space Telescope, or JWST. JWST is the successor to the Hubble Telescope, with scientific goals building upon Hubble’s achievements. With #radhard components in JWST instruments such as MIRI, NIRCAM and multiple bus subsystems, Infineon and IR HiRel once again demonstrate how our #radhard technology is fundamental to #space mission success. We are proud to be part of missions like this that advance scientific discovery, benefitting all humankind. 🛰️

👉Learn more about Infineon & space at: https://bit.ly/3s1gQmX
#semiconductors #irhirel #infineon #wepowerspace #powerelectronics

author: Marianne Venø
content:
Virksomhedspraktik!

(video nederst)

Sidst jeg besluttede mig for, at jeg ville i virksomhedspraktik, kørte jeg hjemmefra ret hurtigt efter og vidste, at jeg ikke ville komme hjem igen INDEN, at jeg havde fundet et sted.

I farten glemte jeg både mobil, hævekort etc.

Så jeg var 100 % uforberedt, da jeg mødte frem de forskellige steder.

Det 5. sted, jeg spurgte, var der, hvor jeg kom i virksomhedspraktik.

Det har jeg haft MANGE glæder af siden, da det var i den lokale dagligvarebutik.

Nu har jeg besluttet mig igen, og at jeg skal have fundet et sted senest torsdag, hvor jeg kan komme og hjælpe fra 3.1.22, mandag, onsdag og fredag.

Hvad jeg skal arbejde med og hvor, aner jeg ikke endnu. Det gjorde jeg heller ikke sidst. Jeg har dog primært arbejdet med reception, administration og sagsbehandling. Jeg forsøger dog ikke at begrænse mig.

Faktisk var det min fars forslag, da jeg spiste frokost med ham på turen.

Det var også det mest åbenlyse sted, som jeg bare slet ikke selv havde tænkt på.

Så jeg har tillid til, at der nok skal være noget eller nogen, der viser mig vejen igen, hvis jeg ikke selv kan finde den 👍👍👍👍

Ha’ en fantastisk mandag.

PS: Tirsdag og torsdag arbejder jeg frivilligt i et for mig fagligt relevant arbejde hos Lejernes Landsorganisation Danmark, hvilket jeg ønsker at bibeholde, hvorimod min virksomhedspraktik kan være indenfor andre faggrupper, så jeg er åben for forslag.

PPS: Jeg søger primært i Billund, Ikast-Brande, Ringkøbing-Skjern og Herning kommuner.

Videoen kommer her - HUSK LYD: https://lnkd.in/gENNg5cb
Malene Gregaard Wilsly
Taja Maria Lund Setzke
Thomas Bigum
Maj Wismann
Christina Klitsgaard
#netværk #virksomhedspraktik #arbejde #reception #administration #sagsbehandling #video

author: Courtney Cunningham
author_info: Salesforce Certified Administrator at Talent Stacker Salesforce Career Development Program | Salesforce Administration and Business Analyst Interest | #Open to Work |  Early Childhood Educator Background
content:
This is the post I've been waiting to make for what feels like FOREVER!  I have watched so many amazing and talented members of the #Ohana start (or continue) their journeys as Salesforce Professionals and now I am ECSTATIC to share that I've joined the ranks: I am a Salesforce CERTIFIED Administrator!

In January 2021, I took the Five-Day Challenge from #TalentStacker and decided that Salesforce wasn't for me.  I did not believe that I could transition from a successful career as a teacher to someone who works in tech.  I left my teaching job in May and ventured into the unknown.  I continued to teach online classes, which were amazing and I loved keeping that connection to my students and to a field I love.  Because of some changes to the online ESL teaching company I worked for, I realized that I needed to figure out my next steps quicker than I had planned.  

Fast forward to the end of August, my husband and I were enjoying a nice walk and we started talking about #FinancialIndependence, #ChooseFI, and then #Salesforce.  In the span of a few conversations, my husband convinced me that I did have "what it takes" and my skills as a teacher would be transferable to anything new I tried.  He continued to push me and believe in me, which ultimately led me to this day.  I could not be happier to be a Salesforce Certified Administrator.  

There are so many people to thank because no one EVER does anything alone.  First, (and you might have guessed this one), thank you to my wonderful and supportive husband, Noah Farber-Jones.  If he hadn't continued to send #Salesforce and #Talentstacker information my way, I would not be sharing this post today.

Thank you to my amazing study mates, Angie Tinio and Kathy Umanzor, who kept me focused on my studying goals and made learning Salesforce even more fun!  I cannot wait to hear their success stories in the very near future!

Thank you to Caitlin Nguyen for your amazing videos on Trailhead Live that taught me about data analytics, permission sets, and validation rules!  

Thank you to Martin Gessner for the outstanding #FocusonForce practice exams.  I do not think I could have handled the pressure of the test without getting that practice in first.

Thank you to Christine Marshall for allowing me to test your new study materials and for the amazing #SalesforceBen practice exams!  Those resources were instrumental in helping me to get certified!

Last, but certainly not least, thank you to Bradley Rice and the Talent Stacker | Salesforce Career Development Program for guiding me through this process and exposing me to the amazing #Ohana.  I am filled with so much joy because I became a part of the Salesforce ecosystem and joined this giving, supportive, open-minded, and talented group of people!

While this is a great moment, which I plan to soak up, this is only the beginning!  My story is to be continued...

#awesomeadmins #certifiedatlast #salesforceadmin #ohana #talentstacker #alwaysbelearning

author: Małgorzata Góraj-Ptak
author_info: Project Manager at Sii | People Manager
content:
Last week was an incredible emotional rollercoaster. As today I returned my equipment I can now say that after 10 years and 5 months I said goodbye to the fantastic people that work at Pearson IOKI Sp. z o.o. and Pearson English. I joined IOKI back in 2011 for (what I thought) a short time, just to digitise some activities and get myself new shoes. I ended working for many years with truly amazing people, first as a Content Development Specialist and finally as a manager for the whole Poznań team. I am so grateful for everything I learned, for every meeting I had, for every good word I was told, for every coffee we had together. It is truly the team that makes the company successful. Thank you everyone for this experience, especially my fellow Senior Managers and the whole Content Team from Poznań. I am certain I have made friends for life.

Now off to new adventures!

author: Nehan Haseeb
content:
So I gave myself a #careerbreak when got married and then #blessed with Abdul Ahad Alhamdulillah.

He changed my life entirely, my priorities, my likes, dislikes and so on. I gave my entire time to his good upbringing and education but in doing this never lost myself.

I started again after 3 years of #career gap and applied in number of #organizations, appeared in multiple interviews and the one reason I was rejected was how can you manage your work when you have a baby. 

Then I tried to #workfromhome so it could be easier for me to #manage while having a baby as per suggestions and again I got rejected and the reason was same, how can you work at home while having a baby, he will not allow you to do so.

When a mother is pursuing career, she knows how to manage her baby, she knows she can give your company the time needed, she knows she has to keep balance in her work and personal life and most of all she knows she CAN!

Today, I am working as Digital Marketing Manager in D'lish - Origin Of Taste, the company which trusted my skills rather questioning them. 

Today, I completed my digital marketing and SEO trainings and ranked among the top scorers. 

My baby is my strength, my husband is my source of inspiration, my parents are my support system, they all can never be your weakness.

#proud #mother #strength #socialmedia #career #work #success #topscorer #marketingmanager #digialmarketing #seo #training #priorities

author: FC Bayern München
content:
FC Bayern mourns the passing of Gerd Müller.

The FC Bayern world is standing still today. The club and all its fans are mourning the death of Gerd Müller, who passed away on Sunday morning at the age of 75. Müller made history with Bayern and the Germany national team. He scored an incredible 566 goals in 607 competitive appearances for Bayern and still holds the record for the most goals scored in the Bundesliga with 365, as well as being top scorer seven times. He got 68 goals in 62 caps for the national team.

author: M Ayushi
author_info: Indian Institute of Management, Rohtak | IPM'25 | Founding Partner at Road To IPM | Girl Up Shine | Freelance Writing, Branding, Marketing | LinkedIn growth |1.5M post views | Speaker | Influencer Marketing
content:
Five- six colleges under Delhi University had 100% as their first cutoff this time!
( Shakespeare sobbing in silence😢)

And why not🤷 with no boards conducted, the proportion of students scoring > 95% were also on a all time high🦸

The top 1% of those scorers get their desired subjects in top colleges like SRCC, LSR💯

A just and more transparent system was no wonder necessary🔥🔥
which is why from next year onwards students' boards marks will no longer 'determine' their admission in DU anymore❌

DU will give 50% weightage to board marks, and 50% for an entrance (preferably CUCET) to take admission in any undergrad courses🤸🏃

What do you feel🤔
Will it help students? Or will it make the process more complicated❗


 #delhi #students #university #like #help #like #networkingtips #poll #linkedinpost #linkedinforcreators #linkedincoach

author: Devan Bhalla
author_info: Brand Builder & Marketer | IIM Merit Scholar | TEDx | Public Speaker | Cited Researcher | Launched over 39+ successful products | Growth & Analytics | Tune in on #DBytes on LinkedIn for more
content:
She went from being a 45 percent scorer in middle school to being the Chief Economist at International Monetary Fund. A middle-class upbringing and a love for sports, the journey of Gita Gopinath is 🙏

A Gold medalist in Economics from Lady Shri Ram College For Women and Delhi School of Economics, Gita went on to become a tenured professor at Harvard University.

Just like a regular student, she intended to do an #MBA and also try a hand at #UPSC CSE before making a career in #Economics. 

She initially got into the University of Washington for a 5 year Ph.D. program but such was her credibility that her mentor wrote her letters of recommendation to move to a top school. 

She completed her Ph.D. from Princeton University in 2001 and joined the University of Chicago as an Assistant Professor and then to #Harvard. 

She worked for the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston, National Bureau of Economic Research and the Federal Reserve Bank of New York as a part of her assignments before she went on to work for the #IMF. 

Her story only makes one point right - If only we put in our heart to what we do, we can achieve anything along with the support of one's family which in her case has been that of her parents and her husband and son.

Happy weekend! 



#leadership #economist #passion #SundayHistory #DBytes

author: Gauri Das
author_info: Head HR/ Mentor/ Possibilitarian/Leader- Leanin circle/ Global  Speaker / TEDx speaker
content:
Love it or hate it.... the fact remains !!!!
 
Networking is one of the most important business
skills today.
 
I recently read about 3 common models of networking
 
The Mother Teresa Model: “you need me” and I love it
 
The Godfather Model: “with strings attached”. There should
be something in return
 
The Just-in-Time Model: no time to network on a good day. Cut to bad days, a sudden surge of outreach

Networking is a way to build relationships by your authentic self and showing generosity to others. And adding value to their lives.
 
Value can be anything the other person might find useful.
 
It can be as simple as :
 
Giving helpful advice
 
Introducing them to another person
 
Guiding them with their career

A referral basis merit
 
The worst thing in networking is scorekeeping😀
 
The universe is abundant and you will get it back from
somewhere.
 
Networking is about creating possibilities.
 
What is your mantra of networking?
 
 
#possibilitarian #careers #humanresources

author: Mike R.
author_info: Cyber Security Consultant - Pro Bono work performed for NFP - Mobile 0400 747 076 - LION
content:
Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen Falsely Advertises Build Back Better in Memo to Senate. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen is carrying out a desperate, last-ditch effort to sell the increasingly unpopular Build Back Better Act before the year ends. 

Yellen sent a memo to the Senate Dec. 9 titled “Fiscal Responsibility and the Build Back Better Act.” She wanted to get ahead of major reports that delivered a one-two punch to the Democrats’ plan to increase taxes and dole it back out to friends of the party.

Despite repeated assertions of the bill being paid for, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office released a report showing that the temporary policies in the bill would increase deficit spending by $3 trillion. On top of that, inflation is hitting a 40-year high as consumer prices continue to rise because of out-of-control government spending.

As the Biden administration finds itself unable to escape the real economic consequences of its left-wing policies, Yellen in her memo swings blind with claims that are far removed from reality. Here are the following claims Yellen makes about the Build Back Better Act.

Claim 1: The Build Back Better Act is fully paid for in the first decade.

Fact Check: FALSE—The Congressional Budget Office shows that the Build Back Better Act is NOT fully paid for and will increase the deficit by nearly $400 billion.

Yellen states in her memo that the Congressional Budget Office and Joint Committee on Taxation support her claim that the Build Back Better Act would reduce deficits by $100 billion in the first decade.

However, the memo links to an older report that outright refutes that claim and estimates the bill will increase the deficit by $367 billion over 10 years. Even if potentially higher revenues that could result from additional IRS administrative funding is included (the White House-Congressional scorekeeping guidelines exclude these types of revenues because they are highly speculative), the bill would still increase deficits by $160 billion.

Yellen is basing her claim on her own Treasury Department’s unrealistic assumption that IRS funding would yield more than double the revenues projected by the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office. A nonpartisan independent analysis has rejected the Treasury Department’s biased numbers.

Furthermore, the Congressional Budget Office with the Joint Committee of Taxation, reports that the Build Back Better Act—without the smoke and mirrors of sunsetting new spending programs—would increase the deficit by $3 trillion over the first 10 years of its enactment.

Claim: The Build Back Better Act is a fully offset decade-long investment that will not add to near-term inflationary pressures.

Fact Check: FALSE—Americans are already experiencing inflationary pressures from previous deficit spending. The Build Back Better Act will only worsen existing inflationary pressures.

author: Steven Godfrey
author_info: Procurement expertise to cut costs and protect profits
content:
When I read that Julian Assange – holed up for nearly seven years in a single room in the Ecuadorian embassy - had (allegedly) started smearing his own waste onto the walls, I was both nauseated and sceptical. Particularly as he was getting visits from Pamela Anderson – most men tend to make a bit more of an effort when female visitors are expected.

However – as we near the end of yet another lockdown – although I don’t know of anyone who has reached the smearing stage, I do have a deeper understanding of how enforced isolation impacts our mental health.

Until hospitality venues are allowed to re-open, evening entertainment is either a DVD box set or a Zoom pub quiz. One small delight of pub quizzes is thinking of a hilarious team name, then giggling dementedly each time the scorekeeper is forced to repeat it. In case you need it this weekend/half-term, here is a Yorkshire Post list of the 60 funniest pub quiz team names for use during lockdown. A few are quite rude, for which I apologise – but I didn’t write the article….

Have a nice weekend.

author: HookBang
content: Mattel has been dedicated to innovating their customers’ experiences by modernizing the games that have brought joy to generations. Mattel came to HookBang to develop an innovative solution to help Scrabble players understand the rules and complexities of the game and to help bridge the gap between beginning players and Scrabble veterans. Our team developed a companion app called Scrabble® Vision: Scorekeeper+. The mobile app was built using custom machine vision algorithms trained to recognize multiple Scrabble boards and their corresponding tile sets. The robust algorithms leverage a mobile phone’s camera system to detect correctly played words, and provide accurate and updated scoring. This has dramatically improved the player experience by streamlining the traditionally cumbersome process of manual scoring. HookBang also built an AI hint system, which is capable of scanning a player’s tile rack, and providing the best hints from a variety of categories.  (Current app release is for Australia only) Check out the demo video below courtesy of our friends at Mattel Games. #augmentedreality #ar #computervision

author: For CRE Brokers
content:
Your current process of giving last year’s tax forms to your CPA likely has you missing opportunities to save taxes because many decisions must be made before the end of the tax year. 

The truth is 

CPAs work in a high-volume business and often times don’t have the appropriate time to spend with you making adjustments and changing strategy throughout the year.

To give you a better picture, let’s look at it from a sports analogy…

CPAs are scorekeepers while financial advisors are coaches on the field making game-time decisions and adjustments to the plan.

A common game time adjustment is when income comes in higher or lower than expected.

Or when their cash flow is erratic.

The bottom line is - 

The more time you are spending coordinating between two financial professionals, 

Means the less time you have for working on your business to increase revenue.

At @ForCREBrokers, we have long understood the importance of coordinating financial advice with tax planning. 

This is why our financial advisors are also tax experts.

author: Moritz Seibert
author_info: CEO/CIO, Munich Re Investment Partners and co-founder at twoquants.com
content:
Trading is hardest game in the world. It’s just you against the market and there’s no referee. 

Your bankroll is an unerring real-time scorekeeper. It goes up when you win, and down when you lose. It’s that simple.

Far from simple is the fact that you’re up against some of the sharpest minds in the world. There’s always someone who’s better than you, but that’s OK. You don’t have to be the best trader to make money. But you need to be better than the average trader, and YOU MUST SURVIVE and not blow up your account. That’s the most important thing.

“If you don’t bet, you can’t win. If you lose all your chips, you can’t bet.” (Larry Hite)

Personally, to survive the many ups and downs of the markets I need a good game plan – a plan that’s based on data and rules. And experience. That's because game plans are unlikely to work without experience.

It’s akin to a cookbook. All the rules are there, so it should work, but somehow the Paella tastes better when it’s prepared by my grandma.

Everything is easy when you know how to do it. Reaching that point and gaining experience along the way is hard, however. You can’t get there by trading in simulation-mode. It only works with real money and it’s an endless journey of learning.

What follows are some experiences of my own in our latest Two Quants blog post. Just a few, not all. Some “evergreen” observations of a quant-driven trader. 

#trading #markets

author: Scott Wood
content: I was honored to be selected to design the exhibit experience for the just opened “New York Energy Zone” for the New York Power Authority in Utica, NY. This four-year project, in a dynamic new visitor center designed by LaBella Associates adjacent to Utica’s Zoo, follows the mandate of engaging all ages in an immersive, highly interactive multimedia learning adventure on the history of electricity and the future of power generation. In its theatre, a new era in 3-D filmmaking by special effects wizard Douglass Trumbull brings electrical genius Nikola Tesla through time to a present day classroom where his life-changing innovations are discussed. Each visitor receives an RFID-enabled lanyard that encourages high touch exploration through games, scorekeeping and experience photos that they can keep. The project of a lifetime! Shoutout to Trivium Interactive for the multimedia and Capitol Museum Services for exhibit costruction.

author: Gauri Das
author_info: Head HR/ Mentor/ Possibilitarian/Leader- Leanin circle/ Global  Speaker / TEDx speaker
content:
Love it or hate it.... the fact remains !!!!
 
Networking is one of the most important business
skills today.
 
I recently read about 3 common models of networking 
 
The Mother Teresa Model: “you need me” and I love it 
 
The Godfather Model: “with strings attached”. There should
be something in return 
 
The Just-in-Time Model: no time to network in good day. Cut to bad days, sudden surge of outreach 
Networking is a way to build relationships by your authentic self and showing generosity to others. And adding value to their lives. 
 
Value can be anything the other person might find useful.
 
It can be as simple as :
 
Giving helpful advice
 
Introducing them to another person
 
Guiding them with their career
 
The worst thing in networking is scorekeeping😀
 
Universe is abundant and you will get it back from
somewhere.
 
Networking is about creating possibilities.
 
With this in mind, Team Leaders Lifting Leaders   came together for LLL SOCIAL.

It was wonderful spending some time together knowing each other  morewhich is first step of building deep
relationships. 
 
 
What is your mantra of networking?
 
 
#psygauri #possibilitexplorer

author: Gene E. Buhler
author_info: OB,OE,OD Consulting, Executive Leadership Development, HR Business Partner,Thought Leader, Influencer
content:
Thought for the Day 
	In his groundbreaking book, The Game of Work, Charles Coonradt says that scorekeeping stimulates us to create more of the positive outcomes we’re keeping track of. It actually reinforces the behavior that created these outcomes in the first place.
	Think about it. Your natural inclination is always to improve your score. If you were to keep score on the five things that would advance your personal and professional objectives the most, imagine how motivated you would be each time the number improved in your favor. You have to measure what you want more of.
	Quote found in the book The Success Principles 
	by Jack Canfield

author: Mark Reilly
author_info: Finance and Data Management at TBA
content:
Biden's speech tonight will be the most important speech of his life.  

Tonight, Tuesday December 21st, 2021 President Joe Biden will speak about the ongoing virus and how to deal with it.  The runaway Omicron variant has exploded, and a country immersed in fear and frustration needs to know who is leading the effort and what is happening to make it all go away.  
To date, the clumsily mustered efforts by public health officials and politicians is a 'whack-a-mole' strategy of lock downs, lockouts and mask mandates.  The ebb and flow of the virus seems to have caught the Biden Harris administration off guard - or so says Kamala Harris.  Dr Fauci has become a symbol of all that is wrong with the effort - public appearances sharing no new answers and contradictions of past predictions.  Isn't Fauci supposed to have the answers?  Isn't that what he is paid for?  Yet his job seems to be no more than scorekeeper for a blundering bureaucratic effort.  
If Biden blows it tonight he is finished.  Hot off the heals of a failed BBB spending defeat and a litany of immigration problems and failed foreign policy matters has got the stock market spooked and the American people left scratching their heads.  Biden needs a win to save his legacy and I have the gut wrenching feeling he is gonna swing for the bleachers and whiff.  
I hope and pray that his speech leaves us a bit more optimistic and hopeful.  That he reassures us that all will be okay.  But if he swings between whispers and yelling and mispronouncing words he will leave us wanting for more.  He needs to give answers!  He needs to restore faith!  He needs to be strong!  We will find out tonight is he is, or can do, any of those things.
#stockmarket #job #people #strategy #publichealth #administration

author: Pride Resource Partners
content:
In March 2021 we welcomed Michael “Mike” McShea to Pride as Director of Project Controls. In his role with Pride, he is responsible for leading the project controls center of excellence and for managing service delivery related to PMO and project controls across multiple client accounts. He is Pride's main point of contact for our clients as it pertains to meeting and exceeding service delivery expectations. 

Mike brings more than fourteen years of experience in all aspects of project controls for major engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) projects. Throughout his career, he has specialized in project scheduling and cost engineering, and he has been accountable for schedule development/review and performance, time-phased spread of man hours, calculation of project progress and productivity, cash flow generation, and internal financials on numerous engineering and construction projects. Mike’s progressive responsibilities have included staff management and development, interfacing with level-four progress calculation tools, invoice generation, reporting and analytics, risk analysis, coordination with satellite support offices, coordinating with third-party contractors, managing the implementation of specialty program reporting, change order management, proposal requests/clarifications, and estimate preparation. He brings a very unique and important skillset with several years’ experience building project controls standards and leading project controls teams of scheduling, cost engineering, and document control specialists for regulated utility clientele.

Please reach out to us if you want to learn more about how Mike and his team can support your organization's PMO and project controls needs. http://ow.ly/8vyB50GwB3i

author: Terri VanDeVeire
author_info: Account Recruitment Manager at PTS Advance
content:
We are currently hiring!
 
 Position: Document Control Specialists
 
 Location: Central Arizona (Local Candidates)
 
 Our client is a global EPC firm who builds critical and large scale projects in the Oil & Gas, Renewable/Alternative Energy, Chemical, and Advanced Facilities/Technical Manufacturing industries. They are hiring 2-4 Document Control Specialists to support a $2 billion project in Arizona. This person will be responsible for managing and support document controls for the Engineering and Construction portions of the project.

General Requirements:
 
Create and maintain distribution matrices.
Receive, log, and distribute engineering documents according to distribution matrix.
Receive, log, and distribute construction documents according to distribution matrix.
Receive, log, and distribute vendor documents according to distribution matrix.
Maintain electronic and hard copy files of technical documents, correspondence, and other documents as required.
Update manuals and catalogs for the assigned project.
Upload and download documents from client systems.
Ability to manage multiple priorities.
Education: High school, vocational or technical school.
 
Experience: Minimum 2-10 years of experience with Document Control with a GC or EPC Contractor. Experience supporting EPC Projects of technical high speed manufacturing facilities, aerospace manufacturing, biotech/pharma facilities, food and beverage facilities, data center, or other similar projects is ideal.
 
Other requirements: Experience with commercially available document management software, Microsoft Office, etc.
 
Interested? Contact Terri VanDeVeire on 925-363-8233 or via email at Terri.vandeveire@PTSadvance.com for a confidential discussion.
 
 To see other available roles, visit jobs.ptsadvance.com.
 
 #PTSAdvance #PTSAdvanceJobs  #Jobs #EnergyJobs #NewJobs #Hiring #hiringpost

author: Omer Alvie
content:
#Pakistan is the third #largest #contributor of personnel to United Nations Peace Keeping Force since participation began in 1960.

🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰
“No nation can ever be worthy of its existence that cannot take its women along with the men."--Quaid e Azam Muhammed Ali Jinnah
🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰🇵🇰

Continuing this proud tradition of the #Pakistani Armed Forces, the country also achieved the goal of 15pc women participation in UN peacekeeping missions in early 2019.

Pakistan Army women peacekeepers are serving as part of Female Engagement Teams (FETs) and as staff officers at various headquarters. Pakistan was also the first country to deploy female engagement teams to Congo on June 19, 2019.

Apart from two female engagement teams in Congo, a third team would commence operations from March in the Central African Republic.

So far, around 450 women peacekeepers from Pakistan have served in UN missions.

The women peacekeepers from Pakistan have won numerous accolades, including tributes at the UN and medals for exceptional performances and services rendered.

In 2019, Major Samia Rehman was awarded a certificate of appreciation by the special representative of UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres – who is due in the country on a historic visit commencing on February 16.

Source : https://lnkd.in/es_nUhk

author: The New Times (Rwanda)
content:
The United Nations Special Representative of the Secretary General to Central African Republic (CAR), Dr. Mankeur Ndiaye, on Tuesday, December 21, visited Rwanda Formed Police Unit-One (FPU 1-7) operating in Bangui under the UN Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the CAR (MINUSCA).

Head of Mission was received at the FPU-1 base camp by the contingent commander, Chief Superintendent of Police (CSP) Claude Bizimana, who briefed him on the tasks assigned, achievements as well as challenges encountered.

The SRSG also toured various facilities of the camp, observed the officers’ readiness and how they conduct their operations.

author: Justin Trudeau
author_info: Prime Minister of Canada | Premier ministre du Canada
content:
Earlier today, Navdeep Bains announced that he is stepping down as Minister of Innovation, Science and Industry to spend more time with his family. To fill the opening created by his announcement, we are making the following changes to the Canadian Ministry:
 
Minister Champagne becomes Minister of Innovation, Science and Industry. His extensive business experience will be key to creating jobs and rebuilding our economy. He’ll also be a strong voice for what rural and small-town communities need to succeed.
 
Minister Garneau becomes Minister of Foreign Affairs. From leading Canada’s efforts on the Safer Skies Initiative to his work on the Canada-US Relations Cabinet Committee, Marc will bring a great deal of experience to his new portfolio. 
 
Parliamentary Secretary Alghabra becomes Minister of Transport. With an engineering background and a history of advocating for public transit in the GTA, I know Omar will do an outstanding job in this new role. 
 
Finally, in addition to serving as Special Representative for the Prairies, Jim Carr will be returning to the Cabinet table where he’ll continue to be a strong advocate for people in the Prairies. 
 
For more on today’s Cabinet shuffle, click here:

author_info: Fire Safety Professional | ISO 45001 HSE Management | ISO 41001 Facility Management | Crowd Management | Spectator Services | Facility Handover Operations |
content:
I am very happy to be selected by the Nizami Ganjavi International Center as one of the Young Leaders of 2021. I was especially pleased to be a speaker on leadership at this prestigious event. I believe that each of our young colleagues will be represented in important places in the future by further developing their leadership skills. I express my deep gratitude to each member of the organizing team of the Nizami Ganjavi International Center especially to Rovshan Muradov and Mehri Huseynli.

Finally, I would like to briefly tell you about my participation in the Young Leader project.
The Global Young Leaders Forum organized by Nizami Ganjavi International Center is a unique gathering of about 30 to 40 diverse leading young leaders from the world’s top scholarship programs and leading industries who have tremendous potential to make positive impacts in the world.
We discussed the topic “The Role of Young Leaders and Change-makers in Much Needed Reform” together with some of the world’s emerging leaders.
The Forum had include prominent speakers such as Vaira Vike-Freiberga, President of Latvia 1999-2007, Ismail Serageldin, Vice President of the World Bank 1992-2000, Jeffrey Sachs, Special Representative of the Secretary-General of UN on SDG; Rosen Plevneliev, President of Bulgaria 2012-2017; Ameenah Gurib-Fakim, President of Mauritius 2015- 2018; Kateryna Yushchenko, Chair of the Youth Programs at NGIC, First Lady of Ukraine 2005-2010, Maria Fernanda Espinosa, 73rd President of the UN General Assembly and former Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ecuador.


My speech starts at 01:05:00 You can see it from the link below to get acquainted:
https://lnkd.in/dDvHzrjn
#leadershipskills #youngleaders #youngprofessionals

author: NATO
content:
Irene Fellin has been appointed as the new NATO Secretary General’s Special Representative for Women, Peace and Security. An Italian national, Ms. Fellin has more than 15 years of experience as an international consultant for UN agencies and other national institutions. She has also worked as a Senior Gender Adviser with WIIS Italy, the International Affairs Institute in Rome, and NATO Headquarters in Brussels.

Ms. Fellin succeeds Clare Hutchinson, who held the job since 2018.

author: Sumit Agarwal
author_info: Featured on Forbes India and Multiple Publications|Public Relations Specialist |Story Teller| Media Relations Specialist  | Helping people get Featured | Disability and Inclusion SDG Ambassador|
content:
A mission of creating 10 million local entrepreneurs in India and Africa by 2030
 
That’s the mammoth task this humble man has undertaken
 
When the pandemic brought the world to a standstill
 
And Businesses were shut off and with fixed costs dangling over them, SMEs and MSMEs were unable to handle the situation.
 
The Founder and Chairman of the GAME - Global Alliance for Mass Entrepreneurship), stepped in to the rescue
 
GAME - Global Alliance for Mass Entrepreneurship, started to create a $100 million-plus SME Stabilization Fund, through which will give low-interest working capital loans to eligible SMEs. 
 
With his guidance and support and mantra of resilience 
 
Many companies was able to get a new breath of life 
 
A great leader and a believer of team spirit, Ravi Venkatesan is UNICEF’s Special Representative for Young People & Innovation
 
Ravi is also the former Chairman of the Bank of Baroda; between 2015-18, he oversaw the turnaround of India’s second largest public sector bank. As a board member then Co-Chairman of Infosys Ltd., he helped steer the company through a challenging set of transitions.
 
 Prior to this, as Chairman of Microsoft India, Ravi helped build India into Microsoft’s second-largest presence in the world.

He was previously the Chairman of Cummins Inc. India and led its transformation into India’s leading provider of engines and power generation solutions.

Ravi has served on the boards of Harvard Business School, AB Volvo, Bunge and Thermax and is a Trustee of Rockefeller Foundation.
Ravi is the founder of Social Venture Partners India, a pan-India network of philanthropists and is a partner at impact investor Unitus Ventures.
 
He was instrumental in creating Microsoft India’s Project Shiksha, a computer literacy program which has so far trained over 40 million school children in India. He also helped establish the Cummins College of Engineering, India’s first engineering college for women, in Pune.
 
Sir, I humbly bow down to your prowess in making India a better place
 
Please consider the small tribute :)
 
Thank you for inspiring millions of young minds like me :)
 
#asksumit
 
#entrepreneurship #inspiration #motivation #India #leadership #entrepreneurs #innovation #education4all

content:
“The wars of adults have taken away the childhood of millions of boys and girls again in 2020."

-- UN Special Representative on Children and Armed Conflict Virginia Gamba said on Monday, as a report entitled "A Stolen Childhood and a Future to Repair: Vulnerability of Girls & Boys in Armed Conflict Exacerbated by COVID-19 Pandemic" was released. 

More than 19,300 children affected by war last year were victims of grave violations, such as killing, maiming or rape, and the #COVID19 has further exacerbated the vulnerability of boys and girls.

author: Omer Alvie
content:
#Pakistan is the third #largest #contributor of personnel to United Nations Peace Keeping Force since participation began in 1960.

Continuing this proud tradition of the #Pakistani Armed Forces, the country also achieved the goal of 15pc women participation in UN peacekeeping missions in early 2019.

Pakistan Army women peacekeepers are serving as part of Female Engagement Teams (FETs) and as staff officers at various headquarters. Pakistan was also the first country to deploy female engagement teams to Congo on June 19, 2019.

Apart from two female engagement teams in Congo, a third team would commence operations from March in the Central African Republic.

So far, around 450 women peacekeepers from Pakistan have served in UN missions.

The women peacekeepers from Pakistan have won numerous accolades, including tributes at the UN and medals for exceptional performances and services rendered.

In 2019, Major Samia Rehman was awarded a certificate of appreciation by the special representative of UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres – who is due in the country on a historic visit commencing on February 16.

Source : https://lnkd.in/es_nUhk

content:
This story on online sports betting is my last contracted story for Crain's Detroit Business/Modern Healthcare. It was a good 24-year plus run with Crain's in Detroit and Chicago, and I left a lot of good friends. journalists and sources when we moved to hometown of Sarasota in late May. Happy holidays for all and like I always used to sign off on my emails, Be Healthy!

author: STAFFER
content:
CONGRATULATIONS, Ambassador Chris Lu, on your confirmation to be Representative of the United States of America to the United Nations for U.N. Management and Reform.

Chris Lu joined Jim Papa on STAFFER (03.11.21) - https://lnkd.in/drDCrkJ - and shared stories about getting his start in government and what it was like being Chief Operating Officer of a 17,000 employee agency.

Chris Lu has served in all three branches of the government, including as the Deputy Secretary of Labor in the Obama Administration. 

Chris Lu started his career in August 1991, as Law Clerk for the Honorable Robert E. Cowen in the US Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit. A year later, he joined Sidley Austin LLP as a Litigation Associate -- a role he was in for the next five years.

From March 1997 to February 2005, he worked as Deputy Chief Counsel for Democratic Staff for the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform, during which time he also took a three month position as Special Communications Advisor for the Kerry/Edwards Presidential Campaign. In February 2005, Chris became the Legislative Director (and then-Acting Chief of Staff) for then-Senator Barack Obama, a role he held until Obama was elected to his first term as President, at which point Chris, too, moved to the White House, filling the role of White House Cabinet Secretary. He worked in this role until February 2013.

Throughout 2013 and 2014, Chris was a Fellow at the Institute of Politics at University of Chicago, as well as at the Georgetown University McCourt School of Public Policy and was a Senior Fellow at the Center for the Study of the Presidency & Congress (CSPC). In April 2014, Chris once again joined the Obama White House, becoming Deputy Secretary of the U.S. Department of Labor.

From February 2017 to present, Chris has worked as both a Senior Fellow at the University of Virginia Miller Center and as a Senior Strategy Advisor for FiscalNote. After President Biden's 2020 election win, Chris also briefly worked as the Lead of the Department of Labor Agency Review Team for the Biden-Harris Presidential Transition.

author: IPO Central Markets
content:
A Guide To Stagflation Investing

A lot is going on in the market right now, and you're not alone if you're confused about what Stagflation investing is. Here's an explanation of this investing strategy.

What is Stagflation?
Recession-inflation is another term for Stagflation. This is a period of growing high inflation, high unemployment rates, and a sluggish economy. The phrase "stagflation" was originally used in the 1960s by a UK politician to represent the combination of employment stagnation and price inflation.

Historically, increasing inflation and high unemployment have had a detrimental influence on economic growth in major economies, which has harmed investors. Stagflation occurs when people earn less while spending more on items and services that have increased due to excessive inflation.

What is Stagflation investing?
Stagflation investing is a strategy used by investors to protect their portfolios against high inflation and low unemployment hazards.
During the Stagflation of the 1970s, investors quickly understood that relying only on US stocks would not allow them to handle inflation concerns. As a result, investors realized the need to diversify their investment portfolios.

What stocks should I invest in during a stagflation period?
Value stocks, which are characterized by higher current cash flows, have historically thrived in high-inflation settings, making them ideal equities to purchase during Stagflation. Value stocks include AbbVie (NYSE: ABBV), PulteGroup (NYSE: PHM), and NRG Energy (NYSE: NRG).

Identify high-performing stocks during a period of Stagflation
Every country, and every business, was affected differently by the pandemic. Retail, media, and healthcare were all put under a lot of stress during the health emergency. Meanwhile, as consumers turned to technology for pleasure and to help them work remotely, sales of tech giants Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL), Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN), Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX), and Facebook (NASDAQ: FB) soared.

During times of stagflation, investors should conduct risk assessments on their holdings to stay ahead of the curve. You should be able to weather the storm if you invest in a diverse mix of growth and value stocks.
#investing 
Remember that these times may also be an excellent time to acquire growth stocks at a bargain price, while your value stock can help you get through periods of Stagflation.

author: Scholarship Track
content:
NASA internships and fellowships leverage NASA’s unique missions and programs to enhance and increase the capability, diversity and size of the nation’s future science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) workforce. 
Internships are available from high school to graduate level. Internships provide students with the opportunity to participate in either research or other experiential learning, under the guidance of a mentor at NASA.

NASA Internships are competitive awards to support educational opportunities that provide unique NASA-related research and operational experiences for high school, undergraduate, and graduate students, as well as educators.
 These opportunities serve students by integrating interns with career professionals emphasizing mentor-directed, degree-related tasks, while contributing to the operation of a NASA facility or the advancement of NASA's missions.


For the link, comment your email address and tag someone who you think would find this useful, so that the post reaches a wider audience. The link will be mailed to you.

#science #education #opportunities #stemeducation #stem #diversity #learning #scholarshiptrack #students #highereducation #technology #undergraduate #intern #internship #engineering #mentoring #mathematics

1)Identifying the site facilities that will be required.

3)Establishing the inter-relationships between the facilities.
4)Optimising the layout of the facilities on the site.

author: Sharad Nawalgaria
author_info: Founder@ Olivecloud Tech | Digital Marketer | Entrepreneur | Business Consultant | Zoho Authorized Partner | I Help Businesses To Make Them Future Ready By Streamlining Their Strategy, SOP, IT And Computing  Practices
content:
Is Remote Working Better Than Office Work?


Is remote working just a trend? Or is it here to stay? That is the biggest debate among people, with offices opening up all around the world.

Some would prefer to continue working from the comfort of their home, while some can't wait to get back to the physical office.

With advantages like better work-life balance and increased productivity, there are also disadvantages like decreased focus and frequent burnouts.

While opinions might vary about the best way of working, the pandemic has certainly proved that remote working is more than just a fleeting work culture. It is a new and somewhat improved way of working for most people.

What are your opinions on this?

#remoteworking #officeworking #workculture #pandemic #productivity #workfromhome #olivecloud #olivecloudtech

author: Sai Srinivas Dhulipala, FIAI, FIA
content:
Glad to inform you all that we are moving to our own office, on this auspicious occasion of Navratri. Own office is like a dream come true for me and team. That too, in less than three years of starting the consultancy.
Does it make economic sense? Not sure. But nothing can be fancier than having your own office. We weren’t thinking of own office initially. We went for a co-working space. It was easy and quick. But it had its share of problems. There was no parking space available. We as a team opted for a closed room of our own. But any addition to the team had issues. Since a bigger room was not available, the new person had to sit in a remote place, away from the team, till a bigger room was found. 
While we were grappling with these issues, Covid 19 hit the world. So started the work from home. Initially, I was very happy. No waste of time in traveling to office and no business travel. But the reality started dawning on us soon. No discipline and no control on working hours, in either direction. With all the family members doing online classes, I was their IT guy, admn person, courier boy, pantry boy and spare resource available for free use. I could get to my work when all these roles were completed, and had to sit till late evening as I started late (well, started early but not MY office work).
Post lock-down, the co-working places were closed. We looked for a rented office. There were no plug-n-play offices in our preferred location. Lot of money was required for interior which would warrant a longer stay in that place. But longer stay depends on various factors.
After experiencing all options, we finally settled for our own office. Of course, all those issues with various options always have a solution (not sure of issues with work from home, though). But own office gives a sense of stability and achievement. Let’s hope that this is a new beginning for a bigger growth. Seeking your best wishes, as always.
Happy Navratri.
VenkataKrishna N Nitin R. Rituraj Bhattacharjee

author: IMD Global Family Business Center
content:
NEW TEAM MEMBER: Mario Marconi Archinto Marconi who holds an MBA from IMD Business School is coming back to IMD and joining the IMD Global Family Business Center as Executive in Residence! 

Mario advises enterprising families globally on strategies for long-term success, governance, succession transitions, wealth regeneration, wealth transfer, family office, impact investing, and family philanthropy. With a background in wealth management, investment banking, and sustainable philanthropy, his focus is helping families with their financial strategies, be it for their private wealth or business needs. His work aims at establishing the best financial strategies for families in order to reach their long-term objectives as well as supporting them in designing the right wealth structure and setup. He also advises family offices, working with families to review and design their existing or desired structure.
Mario is also a senior advisor and partner at Cambridge Family Enterprise Group (CFEG) Advisors to Family Enterprise, a highly specialized international advisory firm serving family enterprises. 

Mario speaks and advises on the topics of sustainability and philanthropy, and advises a number of ventures in the philanthropic and impact investing space.

author: Paul Seimann
author_info: Success is a journey, not a destination | Head of Sales | Executive MBA
content:
Back in 2015 I started my research for a MBA program. When I finished my short-list, Stockholm School of Economics was on top of it. In October 2015 I flew to Stockholm to visit the SSE MBA open-house event where I had a 30min chat with the advisor and admission team. 30minutes that should change my life. I realized quickly that this is next step in my development path I have to take. Back home in Austria I wrote down "SSE Executive MBA" on a Post-it note to put in my bedroom and one to put on my desk at work. So I saw it daily when I got up (or went to bed) and when I was in the office working. I visualized my next big goal. I focused on my next big goal. I dreamed about my next big goal. For 3 years...
Three years later I felt ready and applied. It all worked out and the admission board accepted my application and I had my first program week in January 2019. 

That road led me out of my comfort zone from day one. A road that forced me to re-prioritize my whole life to make room for 20h/week on-top studying & exams beside my full-time job, which I started as a newbie in Jan/2019. A new job, MBA abroad, no vacation for 2 yrs, limited time for family/friends/sports and yourself. A challenge I was afraid of. Sure, life is good in the comfort zone but outside is where the magic happens they said. And it's true. During this two hypergrowth years I met so many amazing people, learned so much within the variouse moduls - and most important - about MYSELF.

This story simply shows that if you want to achieve something, work for it. Put in all the hard work, sleepless nights, frustration, happiness, fear, laughter, the aha moments,... Don't wait for something to happen, make it happen. No one will do it for you. Life is too short to wait. Don't expect life to always be easy. Stop talking, start doing. Meet the people you want to meet. Move your body to support your lifestyle. Communicate what you think and feel. Invest in yourself. Leave toxic stuff behind. Don't settle, aim for more. YOUR ONLY LIMIT IS YOU!

A couple of weeks ago I finally had the chance to travel to Stockholm and attend my MBA graduation ceremony. Due to Covid19 we had to wait almost one year to finish this important chapter! We gathered and had an amazing night where we shared stories about the past, the current and the future. I was honored to give a small commencement speech in front of the cohort. A once in a lifetime opportunity I enjoyed very much. Words cannot describe what this MBA was for me, for us. I just can say that you shouldn't wait for something to happen. Go and get it! 
I want to thank Stockholm School of Economics faculty and all participants in the SSE MBA cohort of 2019 for this amazing journey. 

#SSEMBA
Thanks to Karin Wistrom Johan Berglund Ann-Kristin Bjurström Eija Sarikka for the support and guidance during this 18+ months including a pandemic situation no one ever experienced before. With an immediate switch to hybrid teaching solution we were able to finish

author: Robert Clark
content:
On Dec 2, I officially retired!!!

After 30+ years in public education, I put down my chalk.  I loved teaching, and being a site principal, and had an absolute blast being a Chief Business Officer for 14+ years.  I worked in many school districts, and experienced both great leadership and not so great leadership, and I learned from both.  

Thanks to all the many mentors, guides, advisors, and the many relationships, both professional and personal, I have developed. 

A few standouts: 
...Nancy G - my first teaching position after a 5-minute interview
...Courtney P - my teaching partner....I love me some Ms. Harley Davidson
...Judy B - gave me strength to be me
...Kitty M - provided encouragement and confidence in my growth
...Nancy F - a great friend and supported my goals
...Sonny D - my first AP job, my first Principal job and my first CBO job - I owe my career to you
...Maggie O - I've spent 22 years asking myself, "what would Maggie O do?"  You were the best boss!
...Edwina S - your counsel was unbeatable
...Deanna G - from our first meeting, best friends and never ending support
...Stacie J - helping a first year principal survive
...Suzanne H - what a joy to learn from your patience and stability
...Liz G - the ability to laugh and keep going
...RT/JF/SG/LF/CY-DTA - you can work and work hard, and still have fun
...BA/SL/SD - my compadres through a very dark time
...Terena M - taking a chance on seasoned candidate and ignoring rumors
...SMCSD - perspective and the real purpose of education and teaching the whole child, and providing growth opportunities for this white privileged male.

My one regret was that I was not 'out' when I was teaching and a site principal. Colleagues and some parents knew, but I was never honest when it came to the kids.  Back then...1991...1998...2002...it was a different time.  I encourage all LGBTQIA2+ folks to be honest about your lives.  I was not strong enough to do it, to be a role model for that struggling student, to show it can get better, and I regret that.  2021 is a different world, building on the shoulders of previous generations.  

My one piece of advice: your job does not care about you.  They will replace you in a heartbeat.  My last job, due to extenuating circumstances, I was working 70-80 hours a week, every week for months.   My last day in the office, I left the office mid morning.  By lunchtime, my replacement had thrown my office desk in the trash.  

Should you work hard?  Of course!  Hard work is good for the soul.  Overworking?  No!  Your job does not care how hard you work and the number of hours you work, but your family sure does.  Those days/events/moments will never come again and your family will never forget you weren't there, but they will remember you were in the office working.  It is time that can never be regained.

Now it is time to spend the next 30 years finding new passions with my husband at my side, and exploring a new world of adventures without an alarm clock.  ;)
