author: Steve Moss
content:
I am pleased to announce that Lisa Zell has joined the Executive Springboard, LLC network of mentors.
 
After getting her J.D. with Honors from the Drake University Law School, Lisa clerked for the Honorable Judge Harlington Wood, Jr in the Seventh Circuit of the U.S. Court of Appeals. She began in private practice before moving to corporate law at Fingerhut Companies.
 
Lisa spent the following 18 years at CHS Inc., a Fortune 100 global agribusiness cooperative. As CHS’s General Counsel, she was responsible for Legal, Compliance and Government Affairs functions, where she led international M&A efforts, established the first company-wide compliance function and tripled the size of Government Affairs and its Political Action Committee. As the EVP of Business Solutions, Lisa had P&L responsibility through several professional service businesses, such as financing, hedging, insurance, consulting and, in addition, she was responsible for the enterprise marketing & communications function. She created the first formal year-long mentoring program, co-created a work-from-home eligibility program and co-founded Women in Leadership, a professional networking and personal development group.  While in her executive role at CHS, Lisa pursued an MBA from the University of Minnesota - Carlson School of Management, graduating in 2018.
 
Lisa now serves as General Counsel and Corporate Secretary for the Midwest Reliability Organization, which ensures compliance with mandatory electric reliability standards for owners and operators of the bulk power system for the central Canadian provinces and U.S. states. In this role, she also heads up Communications and Enforcement functions and is the executive liaison for MRO Board of Directors’ Governance and Personnel Committees.
 
Please join me in welcoming Lisa to Executive Springboard.

author: California Association of Healthcare Leaders
content:
Our next Senior Careerist Healthcare Executive Award winner is Tracey L. Taylor MPH, FACHE!

Tracey Lewis Taylor has over 20 years of operational and leadership experience and currently serves as the Chief Operating Officer of Stanford Health Care - ValleyCare in Pleasanton California.

She has demonstrated excellent leadership in her professional role as well in her community, especially around Justice, Equity, Diversity & Inclusion. Some examples of this are: she has served as the executive sponsor within the hospital structure as well as the executive liaison for cross - campus / system-wide governance during the COVID-19 response.

This includes establishing a consistent level of care to all patient types and activation of community programs that were open to all patients / community residents, and not limited to those directly of Stanford HealthCare or Stanford HealthCare - ValleyCare. These programs included a widespread inpatient and outpatient COVID testing program, activation of therapeutic clinical trials, and activation of a local and community vaccination site. This latter initiative served over 40,000 individuals.

Congratulations!

author: Kinchit Shah
author_info: Director, Supply Chain Design and Total Cost Optimization at Flipkart
content:
We have a Opening for Specialist-End to End Supply Chain Design at Flipkart. You may refer the below JD and send in your profiles to santhosh.kalidasan@flipkart.com if interested. 

About the role
Lead End to end Supply Chain Design projects which involves working with , Planning, Product, Engineering and Operations execution teams comprising Functional experts from FC, Transportation and City Logistics by analyzing & developing innovative supply chain solutions and standardizing operating processes to achieve consistent business results.

About the team
End to End (E2E) Supply Chain Design team charter is to design new services/capabilities which help improve Supply Chain Speed, Cost, Reliability, Consistency. This role will support the end to end Supply Chain Design team and work with cross functional teams from Planning, Product, Engineering and Operations execution comprising of Functional experts from FC, Transportation and City Logistics.

What you'll do
- Work on services / solutions that help improve the Supply Chain Speed, Cost, Reliability, Consistency.
- Evaluate the End to End Supply chain processes to understand challenges and design scalable solutions
- Lead cross functional team through the project life cycle (Ideation to Execution)
- Liaison with multiple design / product / tech / category teams and external stakeholders for project execution and alignment
-Support monitoring of business matrices to identify any deviations from design and provide solutions for said problem(s)

Competencies
- Translating Business Services need into scalable design needs
- Understands process linkages across Supply Chain and their implications on Supply Chain and can design processes for scale for fulfillment of services within an asset/across assets
- Leverage Operations Research and other decision sciences to design a scalable and cost effective solution
- Understands data deeply and leverages around Design choices. - --Can work in an ambiguous environment where data may not be available. 
- Understands financial implications for the design choices and able to use that for making decisions. 
- Work collaboratively with a variety of teams and capture their inputs into SC Design
- Ability to work within Ambiguity and Unstructured Environment

Qualification / Experience
- MBA from premier institutes with 4+ years of experience
- Exposure to Business Process Re-engineering, Lean/6 Sigma, QMS etc will be added bonus
- Experience working in E-Commerce organization or E-Commerce consulting projects will be a plus
- Problem solving Skills, Good knowledge of Data Analysis tools

author: Lee Bodenmiller
author_info: Passionately serving our military service members and their families
content:
For the past 13 years I have passionately served the retired military community and their surviving family members. I have worked with many amazing people along the way who have shown me the value of working together to accomplish big things.

Recently, I accepted a position to join the staff at the Office of the DFAS Client Executive Liaison to the Department of the Navy. I look forward to working with the team there and learning more about how we can support all of our military service members, active, reserve, and retired. This new position will mean stepping away from a decade of retired pay knowledge, which was a very difficult decision. But it will put my skills to the test in ways that will challenge me and help me grow professionally.

I will always carry with me the retirees who have given at least 20 years of their life in service to this Country, or those who retired due to the physical sacrifices they made. They are not forgotten, and I will never forget them or their families as I continue in my public service career. I also hope to keep the friendships made working with so many talented people in Retired and Annuitant Pay.

-Support monitoring of business matrices to identify any deviations from design and provide solutions for said problem(s)

Competencies
- Translating Business Services need into scalable design needs
- Understands process linkages across Supply Chain and their implications on Supply Chain and can design processes for scale for fulfillment of services within an asset/across assets
- Leverage Operations Research and other decision sciences to design a scalable and cost effective solution
- Understands data deeply and leverages around Design choices. - --Can work in an ambiguous environment where data may not be available.
- Understands financial implications for the design choices and able to use that for making decisions. 
- Work collaboratively with a variety of teams and capture their inputs into SC Design
- Ability to work within Ambiguity and Unstructured Environment

Qualification / Experience
- MBA with 4+ years of experience
- Exposure to Business Process Re-engineering, Lean/6 Sigma, QMS etc will be added bonus
- Experience working in E-Commerce organization or E-Commerce consulting projects will be a plus
- Problem solving Skills, Good knowledge of Data Analysis tools

author: Amazon Science
content:
In January, Amazon and the University of Southern California announced a collaboration to create a research center focused on privacy and security issues related to machine learning and artificial intelligence. Today, the two organizations announced they have selected five initial research projects to be funded in the first year. 

“We are delighted by the quality and diversity of the proposals from the faculty at USC. It is exciting to see this collaboration gather momentum and we look forward to the advances that these research efforts will generate,” says Prem Natarajan, PhD, Alexa AI vice president, and executive liaison for the center.

author: Pascale MOUKOKO
author_info: Rédactrice Web 📄💡|| Communication et Marketing digital 🖱|| Blogging💻 || Développement personnel✅
content:
POUR UN AVENIR MEILLEUR ET UNE CARRIERE BRILLANTE.

Partie I: Là où tout à commencé!

6 ans aujourd'hui que j'ai débuté mon parcours professionnel et jusqu'ici, il a été très riche. Un début de parcours qui donne un aperçu sur une carrière brillante. 

Je débute en 2015 à la CRTV Cameroon Radio Television Littoral pendant mon année de DUT en Réseaux et Télécommunications à l'IUT DOUALA de Douala qui m’a proposé à la CRTV. Là-bas je participe à l'enregistrement des émissions radio à la cabine technique, je m'assurai que les émissions sont bien enregistrées et bien transmises. Mon instrument de travail c'était une console de mixage audio numérique. J'ai été marquée par les enregistrements des émissions en direct, c'était autant stressant qu'excitant.

En 2016, je suis en licence, grâce à une recommandation, j'obtiens un stage académique chez Matrix Télécoms S A à Douala, ou je passe 3 mois à configurer des routeurs Microtik, et à assister les clients dans la résolution de problèmes liés à internet. Dans la même année, j'intègre l'équipe INTELCIA où je passe plus de 1 an en tant que conseillère technique. J'ai eu le plaisir d'assister par téléphone des clients qui rencontraient des problèmes avec les technologies ADSL et Fibre qui leur donnent accès à la TOIP, VOIP, TVIP, Data. J'ai développé le gout du travail bien fait car l'un des plus grands défis était de garantir la satisfaction client. Pour être parmi les meilleurs et obtenir la prime quasi tous les mois, j'ai dû maitriser et manipuler plusieurs outils, apprendre à comprendre et à gérer les émotions, ainsi que les conflits, à côté j'ai obtenu ma licence.

2 ans après en 2018, je rejoins l'équipe Philjohn Technologies grâce à ma participation à un événement en tant qu'hôtesse. J'ai eu l'occasion de m'entretenir avec les administrateurs qui ils m'ont donné ma chance. Pendant 7 mois, j'ai assuré le poste de IT Officer Junior Manager en tant que stagiaire, dans une équipe de jeunes dynamiques. Là-bas j'ai administré le système d'information, assuré la maintenance préventive et curative matérielle et logicielle, j'ai également eu l'occasion de participer à un Survey très enrichissant. Cette année-là, j'obtiens mon master I en Réseaux et Télécoms à l'ENSET de Douala.

Mon stage s'étant achevé, en attendant la prochaine rentrée, j'ai essayé de retrouver à nouveau un stage mais en vain. Je décide donc de me lancer dans une activité de vente en ligne des sous-vêtements hommes et la lingerie pour femme : l’e-commerce. Pour vendre et me faire de l'argent, j'ai mis en place une stratégie après avoir bien défini mon business. De manière autodidacte je crée, je configure et administre des pages professionnels sur les réseaux sociaux https://bit.ly/3EclHUA (La boutique de Pascale).

Du réseau au Marketing et la communication, je vous livrerai tout de mon parcours, dans un autre post . En attendant, je vous souhaite excellente semaine.

#opentowork #marketingsurlesmdiassociaux #marketingdigital #redactionweb

author: Lucinda Nicholls
content:
*Amazing Person Alert!*

This evening, I found out that someone who once started off as an office junior, is now being named in Chambers & Partners and Legal 500 as a top family clerk in 30 Park Place ,  Cardiff. 

This person used to keep us all sane in the welsh valley town of Merthyr Tydfil, when I worked as part of a large legal aid criminal defence team that was absolutely crazy busy. At this point, she was a ‘junior receptionist’. 

This person used to make me laugh pretty much every day when I walked back into the office after dealing with back to back cases in Court. At this point she was ‘legal support staff.’

This person has the funniest of videos on her phone of all of us in the office that get shared on birthdays to make sure everyone else is laughing! At this point she was everyone’s PA!

Inside and outside of work, Sadie Davies will always make you smile, make you laugh, and has a great way of influencing you into having that shot at the bar for bants! She will also always have your back & be there no matter what, when you need that help most. 

She’s a star and genuinely worth every single ounce of her weight in gold. It seems the clients know this too! 

Congratulations Sadie Annwen!!! We love you so flipping much! Well deserved you epic lady! You’ve shown huge loyalty, passion & intelligence in being where you are today! Long may you continue to grow in your career! (Just look how amazing she is in the quotes!)

 #legal #work #career #lawfirm #lawyer #barrister #clerks #chambersandpartners #friends

author: Mark McKeown
author_info: Chair Of The Board Of Directors HSBC Bank Taiwan, Commissioner HSBC Bank Indonesia at HSBC
content:
After a wonderful 45 year career with HSBC, yesterday was my last day in the office, marking my move into retirement.  My journey started in 1976 as an office junior at St Luke’s Branch of Midland Bank in Liverpool and ended as GGM CRO of Asia Pacific and Global Chief Credit Officer/Head of WMR.  I would like to thank my family for their unwavering support and colleagues who have contributed to my development with support, education, challenge, counsel and setting the right example.  

My main learnings during this time have been the importance of being your authentic self, that the start point of all decisions is the customer and that, over the course of a career, you should aim to give more than you receive.

HSBC is a great company and the opportunities it offers employees who are prepared to strive to give their best are limitless.  I have been very proud to work for HSBC for this period and will continue to contribute as a Non Executive Director and Advisor.

Thanks again to all who have helped me along the way.

author: Barry Loughran FCiM
content: It's time to draw the curtain on a 42 year career in financial services. Time really has flown. There are contacts on my profile that fall into a number of categories including - 'don't knows', 'worked with briefly',  colleagues', 'known for donkeys' and good friends. I wish you all the very best of luck and good health. As for advice from an old timer - work hard, be kind and show the office junior at least as much respect as the CEO.  Fare Thee Well.

author: Chris Lee
author_info: Ex Director, Head of Travel and Professional Sports at Barclays Corporate Bank
content:
I am retiring from banking today. 
40 years ago I joined Barclays straight from school as an office junior at a local branch. Over the decades I never felt a desire to leave. I am very grateful to Barclays for the opportunities it has given me, and I am proud of forming and leading the Barclays Travel and Professional Sports Teams for all these years. A dream role for me with my passion for travel and sport. I never dreamt on my first day that I would have visited over 80 countries or watched a football match at all 92 league grounds.
2 of my clients who own different large travel companies reminded me last week that they were 29 and 30 years old respectively when I first won their business and became their bank manager. Now 18 years on they are 47 and 48 without them ever having to get a new manager- until now!
I have made a host of friends for life. Thank you to my network for all your support and help on my journey. I look forward to catching up with many of you over the Summer and beyond.

author: Eli Albrecht
content:
I observe Shabbat. I have tried to hide at different times but never compromised and it makes me a better lawyer, father, husband, and human. For 26 hours beginning sundown on Friday I turn off my phone and computer, I don’t use electronics and I don’t drive. 

What I do is affirmatively focus on self-growth. I lean in and nurture my relationship with my kids and beautiful wife. I let my mind rest and allow it to grapple with the challenges of the week in a more creative and innovative way than when I’m in the trenches. I let my perspective zoom out and think about big-picture issues and even do a bit of naval-gazing philosophizing with family and friends.

Most importantly, I evaluate whether I was the kind of lawyer, co-worker, father, and husband that I wanted to be this past week and how I can do better this coming week. 

Throughout my career I was told that to do M&A (especially PE), I would have to compromise my Shabbat observance. A partner told me last year, “you may be the best attorney in the world, but unfortunately, if we get an LOI on Friday night, I need you to turn it back to the client by Saturday night. If you can’t do that, I just can’t work with you. Have you considered Tax?” While I would have loved to work with that person, I am not willing to compromise Shabbat. 

Shabbat is designed to reinforce that our value is not the sum of our productivity or what we produce. Our value goes beyond our work and beyond the economic value we create. When all the ringing and pinging is gone for 26 hours, you realize that your worth is independent of your work. 

Joe Lieberman was an early role model of mine, in part because he observed Shabbat. He was a U.S. Senator and did not compromise Shabbat observance. Not only did he make it work, but it made him a better Senator, a better father, and a better human. He wrote a beautiful book about Shabbat and how everyone (of all faiths or no faith) can benefit by integrating Shabbat into their daily lives by taking moments to self-reflect and discuss deep topics (The Gift of Rest). We had an enjoyable discussion about Shabbat when we met a “few” years ago (picture in the Comments). 

As we celebrate the holidays with friends and family and move into a new year, we would be well served to integrate a bit of Shabbat into our own lives, to take time to shut off the electronics and be present with our loved ones. These are the moments that have real meaning, these are the moments our children and spouses remember; I would not trade those moments for anything.

While I recognize that Shabbat observance could result in a detriment to my career or winning certain clients, the gains to my mental health, peace of mind, creativity, innovation, closeness to family, and overall wellbeing are absolutely priceless. 

To those that celebrate Christmas, wishing you a truly meaningful and peaceful holiday with your loved ones. 

Shabbat shalom to all.

#privateequity #law #shabbatshalom

author: The American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA)
content:
ASHA is excited to announce Vicki R. Deal-Williams, MA, CCC-SLP, FASAE, CAE, as the next ASHA CEO! She will succeed Arlene A. Pietranton, PhD, CAE, who has been CEO since 2004 and will retire at the end of this year.

An ASHA-certified speech-language pathologist and ASHA Fellow, Deal-Williams has been a member of ASHA’s executive leadership team for nearly 25 years in the role of Chief Staff Officer for Multicultural Affairs. During that time, she has continually provided visionary, innovative, and impactful leadership in numerous areas, including member engagement; diversity, equity, and inclusion; strategic and change management; budgeting and resource allocation; and professional development.

“ASHA members and staff are among the most committed, caring, and creative individuals I know. I am confident that working together, we will adapt and forge new paths forward to help those we serve achieve their goals and improve their quality of life, moving ASHA closer to realizing our vision of making effective communication, a human right, accessible and achievable for all,” Deal-Williams said.

Deal-Williams will become the fourth CEO in ASHA’s 96-year history on January 1, 2022. Join us in congratulating her! To read the entire press release, visit: https://lnkd.in/gm_zZdA4

author: Luciano Arena
author_info: Chief Electrical Engineer new building  presso Silversea Cruises
content:
How long does it take to be a chief ETO in a cruise ship? Which are the different positions of ETO?

It depends on a lot of factors like company policy, size of ships, attrition rate, competence, people’s skills, nationality etc. On a small cruise ship / yacht maybe there are 2 ETOs and 3–4 assistants, while the biggest class (Oasis) of cruise ship in the world has a compliment of 12 ETOs, 3 Electronic Engineers and 15 assistants. There’s a high probability that if you don’t have the necessary credentials or are unwilling for promotion then you may remain in the same rank throughout your career. Many people do that. It’s difficult to say how many years but 7–15 years would be a good guess. It may be faster on a small cruise ship.
The various positions are : Chief / Staff ETO, Electronic Engineer, 1st ETO, 2nd / 3rd ETO, 4th ETO (optional), ETO cadet (optional). Then you have Electrical assistants who also have a rank structure like 1st / 2nd / 3rd Electrical assistants. Different companies may have different setups.

author: Daron K. Roberts, J.D.
author_info: #1 LinkedIn Top Voice in Sports | Partner (Notley Ventures) | Lecturer  (UT-Austin) | Keynote Speaker | Status Quo Warrior
content:
This Is Not About Sports.

Stay humble...

The date is August 23, 2007.

I had just endured my first training camp during which I did everything from pick up people from the airport to hold clipboards during practice.

I was the grunt.

In this picture, I am handing out keypads to players.

Three months prior, Dean Elena Kagan handed a juris doctor diploma to me before I drove my 2002 Tahoe from Cambridge, Massachusetts to Kansas City, Missouri.

Nobody on the Kansas City Chiefs staff gave a damn that I had graduated from Harvard Law School.

They just wanted to see me work.

Key Takeaway: Put in the work. 

I don't care what degrees hang on your wall or how many "__ Under __" lists you're on.

Just put in the damn work.

Stay In The Deep End.
#thisisnotaboutsports

author: Kevin Schmiegel
author_info: President and Founder, KMS Strategies LLC
content:
Recognizing #27 of 100 Heroes who Honor Heroes, US Navy Rear Admiral Nancy Lacore  

Nancy is a fellow College of the Holy Cross alumni and the first woman to achieve the rank of Admiral from the NROTC program there. 

She is currently serving as Director of the Maritime Partnership Program, U.S. Naval Forces Europeand vice commander of U.S. 6th Fleet in Naples, Italy.

Her 31 years in the Navy as a helicopter pilot Included flying tours with Helicopter Combat Support Squadrons 8 in Norfolk, VA and 3 in San Diego, CA as well as Commander, Helicopter Tactical Wing Pacific. 

In 2011-2012 Nancy was mobilized and deployed to Kabul Afghanistan to serve as the chief of Key Leader Engagement at Headquarters, International Security Assistance Force. 

She served multiple command tours and as the Navy Reserve chief staff officer at U.S. Fleet Forces in 2017, from which she mobilized to serve as the commanding officer, Camp Lemonnier, Djibouti.

Nancy gives back out of uniform too. In 2014, she established ‘Valor Knows No Gender: Run to Remember’: a 160-mile run, in 160 hours, for the 160 female veterans who died while serving in Iraq & Afghanistan.

Wife to a Navy Veteran, Mother to 6 kids, Naval Officer for 3 decades achieving a rank that so many only aspire to, Rockstar, Hero!

content:
#ThrowbackThursday: Five years ago today on September 30, 2016, Gen. Dennis Via relinquished command of U.S. Army Materiel Command to Gen. Gus Perna. General Via was the first signal officer to achieve four-star rank since Henry "Hap" Arnold. He retired from the US Army at a ceremony held at Joint Base Myer Henderson Hall six days later.

#Leadership #OTD

author_info: Head of Cloud Operations Center Sofia, Technology & Innovation at SAP
content:
People say: "You know, you have to find an assistant, someone to do the stupid work...". I was amazed by the proposal...is there stupid work? What about the disrespect we show for these administrative/management assistant colleagues? If it was stupid, why not automate it then? The answer is...just because someone doesn't like it, doesn't mean it's stupid. And you can't automate it as you need a human being behind, who thinks, feels, and take decisions.

I say: People who like this kind of work, who want to develop themselves, work in a happy, respectful, and trustful environment, and want to work shoulder to shoulder with the management team of our organization, come to us and kick off the next phase of your career. 

Apply here: https://lnkd.in/eGa7jji

author: Army University
content:
The Army Management Staff College welcomes two new members to the AMSC team.

The Department of Organizational Leadership welcomes Ms. Sandra Mingdoyle to the faculty. Sandra joined AMSC earlier this year from Army University, where she worked as a Curriculum Developer with a focus on the Captains Career Course and Warrant Officer Career Course. Sandra facilitated instruction at the Command and General Staff College and completed her MBA at Texas A&M (formerly Tarleton University). Sandra enjoys traveling, reading, and participating in the half-marathon a few times a year. She’s an incredible member of the AMSC team, brings a wealth of experience, and we couldn’t be more excited to have her on board.

The Department of Academic Support welcomes Ms. Olga Escobedo to the team as a Management Support Specialist. Olga previously worked as an Education Technician at both the Command and General Staff College and the Army Management Staff College. She has additional experience as an Administrative Assistant in the Visitor and Ceremonies Office and FMWR and has worked on Fort Leavenworth for the past 17 years. Olga enjoys spending time with her children and grandchildren, and her hobbies include camping and sewing. Welcome back, Olga!

#EducateToWin #TeamArmyU #ArmyUPeople
US Army TRADOC | U.S. Army Combined Arms Center

author: Evan Farha
author_info: Strategic Account Manager at Johnson Controls, Government Technologies Group
content:
Farewell
 
After 10+ years at the Johnson Controls and Tyco family, this is my final week with the organization. I am honored to have started my career at a place that values their employees like JCI does, and it has been awesome to see the business grow as an industry leader. 
 
There are so many people to thank, from the technicians in the field to the program and project managers, support specialists, and operational leaders. Your support over the years has been unwavering and greatly appreciated. 
 
Special thanks to Jason Rabbino, John Gaydos, and Larry O'Steen for taking a chance on a "green" college graduate, to Tim Kowtko and Jeff Walleck for their constant mentorship and encouragement, and to Jason Cotaling and Garrett Golubin for their strong partnership and friendship. 
 
Over the last decade, I have been exposed to a wide range of opportunities as the business has evolved and the role has changed. But, one thing has remained a constant. Being able to wake up every day with the ability to serve customers and help them achieve their vision and goals is what brings me the most professional enjoyment. I am beyond grateful for the commitment and loyalty that our customers have shown us over the years. 
 
My wife Nikki Edson Farha and I plan to spend the next six months on a sabbatical, traveling in Asia and enjoying some R&R before embarking on the next stage of our lives. We plan to relocate to the Phoenix, Arizona market in mid-2022, and we are eager to start a new chapter in the southwest. 
 
I look forward to the upcoming adventure and next professional challenge. 
 
Happy Holidays!
 
Cheers,
Evan

author: Shay ☀️ Rowbottom
author_info: I help businesses create engaging video for social media that brings them followers, leads, and sales. WITHOUT breaking the bank, or sucking up too much time. DM me to learn more. | LinkedIn Marketing | Organic Video
content:
I used to hate the holidays.

This year, I have a surprise...

My first ever LinkedIn Holiday Card. Where I break down some of my best personal & business highlights from 2021! 😃

But really, to me, this is so much more than just a Holiday Card. 

This is a symbol of perseverance, gratitude, safety & family. 

Things I haven't felt in a very long time.

Being estranged from relatives makes the holiday season challenging for some of us. 

Where most people travel to see Mom & Dad, catch up with old cousins & friends in their hometown... and do all that traditional stuff like eat turkey, set up the tree, and open presents-

I opted for spending holidays alone, working. 

Taking the day off, or at the best getting an invite to hang out with friends. 

I never complained about it, but deep down I was sad. 

This year, finally...

it feels like my life could be normal. 

It feels like I do have a family. 

Thank you Jonathan Palmar for encouraging me to get a tree, and for pulling me out of my shell to do all the "normal" Xmas festivities this year. 🥰

You're a true healer of that little grinch in me! 

I am feeling so grateful.

Enjoy this 2021 year in review! It's a project, and a year, I'm really quite proud of.

& as always...

Thank you to all of my connections, followers, & community for getting me here. It means the world to me to have the support of LinkedIn and the many amazing, talented, generous souls on this platform. 🙏🏻

Being able to express myself and grow a business here has been a God-send to say the least. 

Thank you LinkedIn, for raising me right. 

Thank you for being my family. 

May this season bring you joy, connection, and happy memories to last a lifetime! 🎄

If you have your own Holiday card, please drop the photo below and share with us too, any highlights you'd like to give thanks for from this past year. ☺️👇

Thank you, God, for a beautiful transformation. 

For a beautiful healing. 

For a wonderful life. ❤️

Merry Christmas & Happy Holidays everyone! 

Beaming you love. All the best, 

#Shayshine ☀️

author: Sherif Hazem Nour Eldin
author_info: Sub-Governor Cyber Security at Central Bank of Egypt
content:
I was honored to be one of the few worldwide appointed to become a member of the Privacy and Security Subcommittee of the International Task Force for the revision of the worldwide Computer Science Curricula (known colloquially as “CS 202X Task Force”). The CS 202X Task Force is responsible for revising the last model curriculum that was completed at international scale in 2013 and codified in “Computer Science Curricula 2013: Curriculum Guidelines for Undergraduate Degree Programs in Computer Science,” published by the ACM and IEEE Computer Society. 

This task force contains a group of the world’s most reputable and knowledgeable professors that I am so appreciative to join them. Although I am so proud of this honorable selection, I feel overwhelmed and anxious from the great responsibility placed on my shoulders.

author: Christian Ikechukwu Agu
author_info: Communications & Software Engineer in View || Event Planner || TEDx Organiser || Critical Thinker || Global Excellence
content:
GOD DID IT!!!

THE FIRST ENGINEERING GRADUATE IN MY HOME!

After my Dad's accident in 2011 that led to the dropout of my 2 elder siblings, I was traumatized if going to school was achievable. As a young boy in Junior Secondary school, I witnessed a transition from Abundance to lack as all our properties were sold to save Dad's life. 

After Secondary school, I knew I wanted to attend the best Engineering University in Nigeria, the vision was clear even when the money was not there, I took 2 years off. I worked as a primary school teacher during the day (7am-2pm) and retired to the car wash during the evening hours(5pm-7pm). My weekends were the busiest, I worked in a car wash from 7am-7pm (Saturdays & Sundays), each time I wash these cars, I remind myself that I don't belong here, I cried many times due to the scorching sun, cuts on my hand, getting underpaid and I told God to help me. 


Fortunately, I was admitted to study Electrical Electronics Engineering at the Federal University of Technology Owerri (FUTO) in 2015. My parents and siblings were so happy for me but life didn't get easier, I did part-time jobs to cope. Each semester break, I go home continue washing cars. I did this even 3 years as an undergraduate and it was tough. My colleagues (who didn't go to school) at the Car wash mocked me, they said I'm deceiving them that I was in the university, they told my customers that I lied and I'm a bad boy, they even nicknamed me "I dey school", It was terrible, I was utterly broken, I was discriminated. With the cuts on my hands and the pain of the salty sweat entering my eyes, I cried to God to help me complete my undergraduate degree.

Today, I'm happy that I'm an Engineering Graduate, the first in my home, I've made my family and friends super proud. I can gladly go to that Car wash and tell my colleagues that I'm done with school and my God is not Dead.

I finished with a Second Class Honors (upper division) and while in the university,  I led over 11 teams, built an Event Company from scratch, established a Charity Foundation (Did Food Drive programs because I know what it means to have nothing), bagged 10 Awards, Won competitions and Prizes, Organized a TEDx event that trended in my school, volunteered in over 18 organizations, passed 80 examinations and got featured thrice in a newspaper.

Take a look at my picture and see the smile on my face, it's a smile of victory, I pray this gown unlocks future degrees and celebrations.

You see, God didn't fail me, I know he won't fail you too. This story is to inspire you to focus on your dreams and stay True to God. 

God kept to His words.

author: Tangipahoa Parish Government
content:
NEWS RELEASE

BATON ROUGE, La. – If you are repairing or rebuilding your home over the holidays, you can get expert advice from FEMA mitigation specialists at local hardware stores in Chauvin and Morgan City. Disaster survivors doing work on their homes after Hurricane Ida can talk with FEMA mitigation specialists about their damage and discuss how to best reduce risk in future disasters.

From Monday through Thursday, Dec. 20 – 23, mitigation advisors will give tips about rebuilding and protecting homes from future disaster-related damage such as high winds and water. They will also have information about selecting contractors, flood insurance, roof repair, and other topics. No appointment is needed.

In Chauvin, FEMA Mitigation Specialists will be available from 7 a.m. – 4:30 p.m. at:
📍Chauvin Brothers
5573 LA-56 Chauvin, LA 70344

Specialists are available in Morgan City from 8 a.m. – 6:30 p.m. at:
📍Scott's Ace Hardware
1101 Highway 90 E Morgan City, LA 70380

If you need to discuss your particular case with someone, call the Helpline at 800-621-3362 to speak to a FEMA individual assistance specialist. Hazard mitigation outreach specialists offer general rebuilding tips and will not be able to discuss specific details of individual cases.

Read more: https://lnkd.in/dAfcv5Qc

author: Priyank Ahuja
author_info: ISB | NUS | Product Management | Digital Transformation | Marketing Strategy Consultant | Mentor | Speaker | 229 Talks |
content:
Wishing Everyone Merry Christmas.
Praying for every job seeker to get their dream role in 2022.
Succeed in the scariest kind of interview: The Telephonic Interview

The thing is
- 55% of impressions rely on Body Communication.
- 38% on the tone.
- 7% on words.

Now that "Body Communication" is gone.

Everything depends on your tone and words.

Follow these 9 tips to ace your next phone interview:

1) Pick a spot where there is no distraction — no pets, no children, no distracting sounds.

2) Keep your resume, job description, and notes in front of you.  Keep water with you. (Take advantage of the situation)

3)  Dress properly even if nobody is looking. 

4) Listen carefully. Let them finish before you start speaking.

5) While speaking, moderate your tone. Don't speak too fast or too slow. Take pauses. Keep it conversational. 

6) Use the STAR/SOAR approach while answering.

7) Convey your smile and expressions. 
You might not know it but recruiters can hear your smile and expressions over the call. 

8) Avoid sarcasm. The recruiter might misinterpret it.

9) Always pick the phone yourself.
If you can't talk at the moment, apologize and ask to reschedule.

"Sorry, I'm caught up with some errands and won't be able to give the desired attention this call deserves. When can I call back?"

Now, go and kill it at your next interview!

In case you need assistance on resume review, career guidance, and interview preparation, book a 1:1 session (Refer link in the first comment).

#jobseeker #job #careers

#GHGSat pioneered high-resolution greenhouse gas emissions sensing technology from space. author: Cone Health
content: "I started working at Cone Health during my senior year at the University of North Carolina Greensboro. As I was approaching graduation, my financial aid ran out and I just couldn’t take out any more loans. I was so disappointed because my bachelor’s degree was just out of reach. “Oh well,” I thought, “guess I’ll have to put that dream aside for now.” Then while working a shift at Alamance Regional, one of my teammates informed me about Cone Health’s tuition reimbursement program. I had assumed it required years of service to be eligible. Turns out, you can qualify after only six months. Thanks to Cone, I earned that bachelor’s degree without needing to take out additional loans. I am so thankful for the trust and faith that I’ve been shown. My optimism has been fully restored. I plan to continue my career and personal development here. I am also seriously considering going back to school for an advanced degree. I know firsthand what it means to have Cone Health right here with you." - Karina Sequeira, Patient Access Registration Specialist #RightHereWithYou #GrowthOpportunity

author: Michael Gioffre
author_info: Helping companies increase productivity & profitability through enhanced workflow, print processes & document management
content:
Document Management More time to do the work that matters!!!!!!
It’s a familiar scene. You need some info to do your work, and you can’t find the right document or email! We want to rid you of this frustration, so you can use your time to grow the business and give customers the service they expect on the spot
We connect content such as documents, emails, customer details, order numbers, and project info, even if it is saved in different archives or systems.
All contracts expiring, all documents for a given project, all correspondence with a customer. You get the full picture on the topic you are interested in.
Forget duplicates, we store one copy for each document instead. Never again will you have to wonder if you are working with the most recent version.
We make sure documents go through their workflows, follow appropriate retention policy, and are accessed only by those with the right permission. 
Mitronics The Technology Company Document Management Specialists Enquire www.mitronics.com.au or phone 1300 207 122
 Mitronics Corporation

author: Altaf Ahmed, MBA
content:
ARCHIVING

“Archiving is the safe-keeping of all important, historical documents and records which preserves and provides valuable information about our history, tradition and culture for our future generation” Altaf Ahmed MBA, COA.

Archiving can be done for:
	Document Management
	Historical Records and Information

Document Management and Archiving:

A Document Management Specialist is an administrative professional who is responsible for management of company documents. Their job is to catalogue and archive, store and retrieve files and ensuring all team members have access to necessary information as and when required.

Archiving is important for legal reasons too. Many businesses accidentally dispose of documents that they legally should be keeping. This helps to mitigate delays, loss and litigations.

Historical Records and Information:

An Archivist is the Information Specialist who analyzes, assesses, collects, organizes and preserves this Information which is determined to have long-term value by Archiving.

Archiving is the process by which old, obsolete, inactive information in any formats are safely and securely stored for longer periods of time for future reference and research.

Effectively an archive is a kind of collection of materials that are stored for a very particular reason. Since they provide first-hand information about our history, they are valuable wealth of information to researchers, scholars, students and for our future generation.

Membership: https://lnkd.in/dHt-Qyy

author: Sofie Meincke Sussemiehl
author_info: Marketing Employee at Tabellae and Cand.mag. in Communication
content:
Så blev det alligevel jul i år... 🎄 Fordi i dag var julemanden – aka Tabellae - Document Management Specialists CEO Lennart Garbarsch – forbi min hoveddør med julegave og andre julegodter   🎅🎁

Grundet dårlige knæ har jeg arbejdet hjemmefra siden midten af oktober – oven i det sluttede jeg lige december af med en omgang Corona og isolation. Jeg har derfor ikke haft mulighed for at tage ud på vores kontor for at hente firmajulegave, julekalender, gløgg og alle de andre julegodter, som jeg har fået af min arbejdsgiver.

Det skulle dog ikke stoppe vores direktør for at køre forbi Islands Brygge, bære en masse gaver op til 4. sal (uden elevator) og bringe en julehilsen gennem en lukket dør 🎅🎁

Tak for den fine julegave! Jeg er utrolig glad for at være en del af en arbejdsplads, der virkelig kerer sig om deres medarbejdere.

Rigtig glædelig jul herfra 🎄
#MerryChristmas

author: EBM
content:
We are hiring!

Position: Admin Executive
Location: Karachi
Employment Type: Permanent
Department: Administration
Qualification: Minimum Graduation in Business Administration.
Experience: At least 3 years of relevant experience, FMCG preferred

Roles & Responsibilities:

•	To be responsible for daily inspection of all the buildings in the facility to resolve any concern regarding the paint, flooring, carpeting and plumbing.
•	To manage all the supervisors (Paint Supervisor, Plumbing Supervisor, Mason Supervisor,) and follow up with them on daily basis on the update regarding the tasks assigned to them  
•	To ensure repair and maintenance on daily basis of concerned areas
•	To manage and plan out day to day tasks and responsibilities for contractual employees
•	To coordinate and negotiate with the contractors to ensure all activities are carried out timely under due diligence
•	To ensure daily inspection and spot checks to maintain discipline in the production area and ensure that employees are working according to the safety and hygiene standards (checking their caps, use of banned items etc.)
•	To manage In house and contractual employees who are allocated tasks for building management activities.
•	To ensure standards are maintained and requirements are fulfilled in the cleaning process for production floor and process area
•	To ensure hygiene through proper disposal and maintenance in sanitation
•	To coordinate with the sanitation supervisor for daily updates of all the activities performed with respect to the sanitation within the premises and outside of the facility too
•	To inspect that chemicals used are as per the safety standards for cleaning purpose in all areas.
•	To ensure daily spot checks for pest control at all the major areas in the facility including all the buildings, production nd process areas
•	To ensure monitoring of contractors and coordinate with them on daily basis
•	To ensure weekly fumigation of the facility and as per the shutdown of the production and process area
•	To ensure daily spray across the facility covering all the areas to control pest attacks anywhere
•	To inspect that chemicals used for pest control are as per the safety standards in all areas
•	To ensure daily coordination with the pest supervisor for updates and allocation of the tasks to be carried out for pest control
•	To resolve pest concerns timely in all the departments.
•	To ensure daily visits to worker canteen to check the food is as per the safety standards and the area is kept clean to ensure hygiene
•	To manage plantation and gardening and ensure monthly cutting and trimming of the plants
•	To ensure quarterly visits to employee cafeteria and daily visit to the kitchen for spot checks and maintaining quality standards

To Apply:
Interested candidates must send their CVs to career@ebm.com.pk and mention subject title with city name " Admin Executive " in the subject line.

author: Dr. Chioma Mary (OD)
author_info: Senior Optometrist at Clinique Ophthalmologique Lumière Divine
content:
A NEW CHALLENGE, A NEW TERRITORY 

Yesterday, I started a new exciting career journey in a country I used to be very conversant with. 

It was very significant for me too as women all over the world were celebrated and implored #choosetochallege  the status quo, cultural limitations and all stereotypes.

I joined the biggest eye hospital in Togo @Clinique Ophtalmologique Lumière Divine (COLD), Togo as a Senior Optometrist cum Department Administrator. 

I will oversee the affairs of the Department in the hospital in collaboration with other renowned Ophthalmologists led by Dr. Abram Wodome.

Ophtalmologique Lumière Divine (COLD) is the premier private clinic for cataract surgeries in West Africa, performing more than 750 cataract surgeries each year.

This new phase excites me and I look forward to learning, unlearning and relearning from my renowned colleagues while contributing my quota to the growth of my clinic.

I pray that God grants me the grace, wisdom and energy for this exciting challenge.

author: Afzal Badshah, PhD
content: At the end of the 18th century, Education 1.0 commenced where students were passive in classrooms and teachers were the centre of education. The blackboard and pens were used as teaching aids. At the turn of the 20th century, Education 2.0 started, where teachers played a guiding role in classrooms and students were active. Computers of the first generation were also used in education. At the end of the 20th century, Education 3.0 was initiated where teachers worked as collaborators and students were active and independent. The computer and the Internet have been used as enabling technology. At present, Education 4.0 is underway, where the role of the teacher is the mentor and the students are active in the classrooms. The courses are completely student-centric and technologies similar to the Internet of Things (IoT) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) is used as a catalyst. Institutions, education departments, administrations, teachers, parents and students must keep themselves familiar with the recent educational trends to step with the world.

author: Darren Gerard - PLANDEVX
author_info: Deputy Director, Planning & Development Dept. at Maricopa County
content:
Subject: Finance Manager

If you are interested or know someone who might be, please click here to apply.
 
 
    

 
 MARICOPA COUNTY
 invites applications for the position of:
 Finance Manager
 
 An Equal Opportunity Employer
  
      OPENING DATE:
 12/20/21
    
   CLOSING DATE:
 12/27/21 11:59 PM
    
   DEPARTMENT:
 Planning and Development
    
   JOB TYPE:
 Unclassified/Full-Time
    
   LOCATION:
 Phoenix, Arizona
    
   SALARY:
 $75,088.00 - $92,830.40 Annually
    
   POSITION OVERVIEW:
   
About the Position
 Do you consider yourself a financial whiz who likes to challenge your way of thinking? Then keep reading to learn about an exciting opportunity with Maricopa County! Come crunch numbers as a Finance Manager with the Planning and Development Department. In this role, you will manage the budget and financial operations of special revenue fund departments and provide budgetary, financial, and administrative support to the Department Administrator and other department management so that they can better plan, organize, and control the other operations of the Department.
 
 About the Department of Planning and Development
 Maricopa County is GROWING. At the Maricopa County Planning and Development Department, we want you to join us in making that growth possible! With our wide range of services from land-use planning to building inspections and permit review, we have positions that allow professionals in the planning, construction, engineering, and trade fields to shape the future of the built environment. If you are interested in being a change-maker and behind-the-scenes expert in the growth of Maricopa County, we have the job for you!
    
   POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:
   We recognize your time is valuable, so please apply if you meet the following required qualifications.
 
 Education 
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, Economics, Finance, or a closely related field
Experience 
Four years of professional-level finance experience 
OR  
Master's degree or higher in a related field may substitute for up to two years of the professional experience requirement 
Our Preferred Candidate has 
Experience with the development of financial reports, statistical analysis, budget administration, auditing, accounting, and/or public sector accounting
Lead and/or supervisory experience 
Master's degree in Accounting, Business, or a related field

author: Kyra Schwartzman
author_info: Project Coordinator at Brigham and Women's Hospital
content:
Extremely excited to share that I have accepted an offer to join Atrius Health July as their 2022-2023 Administrative Fellow. I am thrilled to be joining such an innovative organization that is dedicated to providing patient-centered and quality care to every patient they serve. I cannot wait to begin this incredible opportunity to work with and learn from Atrius Health leadership!
 
This would not have been possible without the support from my family, friends, peers and mentors. I want to say a special thank you to my Program Director Chris Louis, Ph.D., my graduate Practicum Advisor Emily Hildrey, MPH, Department Administrator at Brigham and Womens Hospital, including John Mcgillivray, MBA and colleague Bridget Thompson, MMS for all of their support throughout the process. Thank you for your guidance, consistent words of encouragement, and for all the lessons learned. A special thank you to Susannah Rogers, MPH who guided me through the interview process with Atrius and who were so willing to share her Fellowship experiences. This process introduced me to some of amazing healthcare professionals and leaders and I am so grateful to have had the opportunity to get to know and learn from so many people.

author: MICHAEL SUGRUE
author_info: National Speaker | Author | U.S. Air Force SF Veteran | Retired Police Sergeant | Mental Health Advocate |                                                                    37,350+ Connections
content:
Three years ago today……… I received this in the mail.  Unfortunately, there was no type of last day ceremony or traditional “walk out”mentioned or ever offered. 

When you “medically retire” you are treated like a second class person.  The many years of sacrifice and dedicated service become meaningless in the eyes of a police department administration.  That is when you truly realize it isn’t a “family” and that you were just a number filling a position…….

So much more must be done to honor our wounded Heroes who put their lives on the line day in and day out for complete strangers. 

I assure you my experience is not at all unique……. The fact is the way I was treated is more often than not the norm.   I’ve meet countless First Responders from across the Country who have experienced the same.   

To be a true family we need to take care of our own……. Especially when they need it most!

MICHAEL SUGRUE
City of Walnut Creek
#airforce #usaf #securityforces #sf #sfraven #veteran #captain #lawenforcement #lawenforcementofficer #policeofficer #cop #leo #firstresponder #leader #defender #defensorfortis #keynotespeaker #ptsisurvivor #advocate #bluelivesmatter #smashthestigma #resiliency #recoveryispossible #sacrifice #service #backtheblue #thinblueline #makeadifference #iwilllisten #michaelsugrue

author: Jude Prince Onuh
author_info: Commonwealth Scholar' 21 || NNPC/TEPNG Scholar' 14 || Biotech Enthusiast || Researcher || Co-founder, Scholars' Forum
content:
After submitting my Commonwealth Shared Scholarship, WHAT NEXT?

1. If you have conditional offers at UK universities, you want to start getting every document needed (official transcripts, IELTS, etc.) to get an unconditional offer.

2. Your referees are crucial players if you must clinch the Scholarship. I remember countless sad experiences scholars have had with references. Trust me, you don't want that.

MY ADVICE: 
* Start contacting your referees. Keep an active communication line from NOW. In fact, send them Christmas and new year wishes.

3. Pray, Trust God, and Don't worry!

If I have missed anything, I invite my bosses to share in the comment section.
Samuel Eneojo AKOR, Chibuzo Nwokafor, George Tsitati,  Elfrida Igbikiowubo,  Kendra Jumbo, Eziama Ngozi Melisa, Mercy Ojetunde, Wisdom Okoh, Chinedum Chukwuemeka Udekwu

author: Rosemary Augustine
author_info: PhD Student and Graduate Teaching Assistant at Michigan State University
content:
#AppreciationPost
I am excited to share that I landed safely and I arrived in the USA on the 5th of August 2021 to start my PhD in Chemistry on a fully-funded scholarship at Michigan State University💃💃 Also, I would be working as a Graduate Teaching Assistant in the Department of Chemistry. I believe that all would go well🙏 and I am pleased to make good use of this opportunity.

Being the first and only female to graduate with a First Class degree in Chemistry from Nasarawa State University, Keffi, since the inception of the university in the year 2000-till date, I couldn't be prouder/happier to be in the country of my dreams🥰

I am grateful to God Almighty for everything...I owe it all to him🙌 It was not easy to figure out what I wanted to do next after graduation but thanks to my mentor/lecturer (Dr C.C. Orji), who indeed is a father I never had. He stood by me every step of the way and made this dream of mine a reality. Thank you so much, sir, for everything you have done for me. I am still amazed by your selflessness🥺🥺 God bless you and your family🙏🙏

Thank you, my irreplaceable mother, for believing in me more than I do and sending me to school😫, I know you are proud of your daughter. Thank you, my amazing siblings❤ I love y'all. To my referees, Prof. A.C. Etonihu, Dr C.C. Orji, and Mr Samuel Adeleye; thank you for not giving up on me and submitting LORs to all the 15 schools I applied to🙇♂️🙏

Thank you, Aunt Shade Adebayo, my wonderful friends/LinkedIn fam for all your support @Maryam, @Stephen, Opeyemi, @Alex, Eddy Attang, Chidiogo, Mr. Nonso Odebeatu, Kelechukwu, ✍🏽Raheemat, Dare E., @Micheal, Ijuptil  K., Justin,  @Nathaniel, Temitope, Faith T., James, First Class Leaders Network (FCLN) and everyone who contributed to my success story that prefers to be anonymous...I am grateful; God bless y'all🙏🙏

Your dreams are VALID, don't give up yet hunnays❤❤

#Goddidit💯
#Hardworkpaysoff
#SpartansWill #MSU
#HappyWeekendfam

author: Adeola Bamisaiye
author_info: MSc IHTM Student at Oxford University| ExxonMobil Scholar| Pharmacist|Antimicrobial Resistance| Infectious Diseases| Global Health
content:
Guess who got into Oxford?!?!?!

I am soooo thrilled, to be starting my Masters in International Health and Tropical Medicine at the University of Oxford. I was awarded the ExxonMobil Scholarship by the Centre for Tropical Medicine and Global Health at the University of Oxford. The scholarship covers tuition, stipend, health immigration surcharge, travel and visa cost.

I got admission offers into the 5 UK schools I applied to, and I was also nominated for the Commonwealth Shared Scholarship by the University of Bristol.

I am so grateful to God, who consistently performed all the million “little” miracles, to get me here. I am also grateful to everyone that has contributed to my journey.

My parents – whose shoulders I stand on, to reach success.

My referees – Prof. Iruka Okeke, Oladapo Adetunji  and Dr. O. S. Alabi (one of my referees submitted a reference letter for me on Christmas day! I am truly blessed to have kind lecturers). I am grateful to Prof. Odeku as well (former dean, Faculty of Pharmacy, UI), who responded swiftly to my requests, and the Acting Vice-Chancellor of the University of Ibadan, who sent me a congratulatory letter.

Those who reviewed my essay - Segun Afolaranmi , Omotayo Olaoye , Aniekan Ekpenyong,  Michael Ojo, DVM. Cynthia Amakiri, Victor Oyebanji DVM, MVSc  and Mr. Onwen.

Special thanks to GetIn Education Consulting  I paid and attended the graduate school Bootcamp they organized in 2020 and learnt how to write winning essays, we had practical classes on how to revamp your statement of purpose and CV from average to one that stands out, mistakes to avoid e.t.c. By the time I was done, I knew what a winning application should look like and I started working towards that.

Putting together my application cost me so much time (about 4 months) and mental energy. It was a very intense period for me, because within those months, I was also studying online with the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine for the Postgraduate certificate in Global Health (which is quite demanding), preparing for my Pharmacists Pre-registration Exam and I also had to take the IELTS.  But I am super glad it paid off. I’m grateful for this opportunity, and I look forward to paying it back by using the knowledge and skills I’ll gain from this course, to contribute solutions to health problems, particularly in the field of Infectious Diseases and Antimicrobial Resistance #amr 

I have written extensively about my journey to Oxford here https://lnkd.in/eGVzA-22 and I included tips on applying to graduate school at the end.

#MScIHTMOxford
#OxfordScholar
#oxforduniversity
#AdeolaAtOxford
#IbadanToTheWorld

author: David Chandler OAM
author_info: NSW Building Commissioner at NSW Department of Customer Service
content:
I am very happy to announce that the Office of the Building Commissioner is launching a new Construction Industry Doctorate Program (CIDP), in partnership with University of Technology Sydney, Western Sydney University and University of Wollongong.

This is a vocational PhD program that aims to deliver pioneering industry-facing research by matching mid-career industry thought leaders with universities – combining invaluable industry knowledge with world-class research, expertise and resources. 

It is a fantastic opportunity for experienced construction professionals (and their organisations) to deliver research that challenges old institutional models and practices, transforms traditional ways of thinking and imagines pathways to create a more trustworthy-built world.

The CIDP forms an important part of the Construct NSW reformation strategy – to rebuild industry capability through education and research and delivering a more customer focussed, ethical, sustainable, innovative and digitally-enabled construction industry.

Key information:
- 2-3 year part-time study 
- Program to commence mid-2022 
- Candidates for the CIDP have two options to participate in the program:
    1. Their employer can sponsor them; or
    2. They can apply for a scholarship from another sponsoring company.

Candidate requirements:
- Australian citizens and NSW residents only
- Minimum 10-years construction industry experience
- Masters or Bachelors degree or other demonstrated suitability
- Industry referees

At this stage we are looking for proposals under the following research areas only:
1. Innovative construction technologies and industry transformation
2. Sustainable design and construction 
3. Construction Business Processes and supply chain management, and
4. Industry reform

To express your interest, please complete the form in the link below. We will be in contact with successful applicants in due course:

https://lnkd.in/gzPdWn5J 

UTS’s course brochure is available online here (https://lnkd.in/gf3DpBfs), and the other participating universities will publish information on their programs soon.

author: John Stephenson
author_info: * Transition Coach * Veterans * CV Craft * Network * Elevation * Financial * Pre-Interview * CPD Alignment Ambassador *
content:
The Forces Transition Group - The problem with POLICY!

Yesterday many of us witnessed two tackles in the Spurs Vs Liverpool game.

💥Tackle 1 - Kane running full momentum (13 stone), leaves the ground and full studs Robertsons ankle.

🐺In my opinion this could have ended a career. Kane received a YELLOW!

💥Tackle 2 - Robertson lashes out from a standing position, so no impact as no momentum was not there on the Spurs right back.

🐺In my opinion this was reckless but did not endanger the player in question. Robertson received a RED!

The issue here is POLICY and its confusion, the referee is in a place he didn't understand, it simply isn't clear.

So, the issue here is one player and club suffers. 

Added to this was it personality driven, Kane is England captain 🤔. 

The same happens with service leavers.

💥Policy apparently states a military unit cannot have anyone on barracks talking about Resettlement or Transition.

🐺In my opinion this is incorrect and regardless of a contract, service leavers should be afforded every opportunity possible to them if the unit has the ability to do so. 

The issue here is nobody reads JSP 100 or JSP 534 on barracks, so it is not understood, it is very easy to listen to chinese whispers, I think, mmm i believe it is etc. 

Added to this is it personality driven, does the RAO, QM, Education Officer just say so 🤔. 

So, the same issue arises, there is confusion and what is left is, the service leaver suffers. 

Now, the thing about both instances is, nothing will be done about it, we will continue to see the same failure in policy as simply its not understood. 

To end, what is policy? 

Is it a guide, is it definitive, is it the final answer or is it best being understood and then left to every individual to actually make a decision? 

I will let you answer and I would be very interested in your thoughts. 

Serve Well, Leave Well and Flourish!

author: Clare Ezeakacha
author_info: Director (Clare Cares Foundation) | Savvy Fellow | Kid mentor| Media Production| Content Provider| Community Service| Counseling | Film maker / Voice artist / Rotary Public image chair
content:
Never judge anyone for any reason whatsoever. People go through pain, neglect, sickness, frustration, etc. Those you tag “heroes”, “stars” are humans and also go through difficulties. It is advisable you say a prayer when you see someone who used to be lively and cheerful become totally different, either by their appearance or attitude. One thing you should know- we all have different ways of handling situations. I could be smiling outwardly and dying inside.
Mind your words!
Mind your utterances!
If it’s so difficult to do the above then simply - Mind your business.
God bless you as we all try to be our brother’s keeper.
Have a blessed week ahead.

author: Ed Davidson
author_info: Director Health, Safety & Environmental Compliance at Long Foundation Drilling Co.
content:
Yep...
There ya have it folks...

The lid is off the box America...
It's time to rise to soaring new heights...

President John F. Kennedy wrote to the Audubon Society: 
The Founding Fathers made an appropriate choice when they selected the bald eagle as the emblem of the nation. The fierce beauty and proud independence of this great bird aptly symbolizes the strength and freedom of America. But as latter-day citizens we shall fail our trust if we permit the eagle to disappear.

The bald eagle has been the national bird of the United States since 1782, when it was placed with outspread wings on the Great Seal of our country. It appears in many government institutions and on official documents, making it the most pictured bird in all of America. The eagle appears on the president’s flag, the mace of the House of Representatives, military insignia, and billions of one-dollar bills.

The bald eagle first appeared as an American symbol on Massachusetts copper cent coined in 1776. Since then it has appeared on the reverse side of many U.S. coins, notably the silver dollar, halfdollar and quarter, as well as the gold coins which were christened the eagle, half eagle, quarter eagle, and double eagle. 

For six years, the members of Congress held a bitter dispute over what the national emblem should be. 

It wasn’t until 1789 that the bald eagle was finally chosen to represent the new nation.

Some eagles have become notable in American history. “Old Abe,” the mascot of a Wisconsin regiment during the Civil War, was a constant target of enemy riflemen, but 
survived 42 battle engagements relatively unscathed. 

Today, the American bald eagle is protected under the National Emblem Act of 1940. 

Although once plentiful throughout the continental United States, the bald eagle population has greatly declined in recent times. Farmers and fishermen have killed many eagles for getting too close to their poultry or fishing nets; game keepers have captured them for falconry; and pesticides have killed many eagles. 

Most of the bald eagle population can now be found in northern regions of North America and Florida breeding sanctuaries.

 #beauty # #military #society #dollar #civil #eddavidson #safedy #thereyahaveit

content:
Keepers of the Quaich 🥃 

Last night following 12 years of service to the Scotch Whisky industry I was ‘Keepered’ at the Keepers of the Quaich installation dinner at Blair Castle.

The Keepers of the Quaich is an exclusive and international society that recognises those that have shown outstanding commitment to the Scotch Whisky industry. It brings together people from all four corners of the globe who are dedicated to the creation, advertising and promotion of Scotch Whisky.

It was an honour to be welcomed into the society - and I endeavor, as always, to use this as an opportunity to help others on their whisky career journey - just like some have done for me 🥃

author: Dr. Kushal Sanghvi
content:
IT HAPPENS ONLY IN INDIA : SASARAM IN BIHAR

For two hours every morning-evening, both the platforms 1 and 2 of a railway station turn into a study class for young aspirants of the civil services: The Indian Administrative Service, entry to the IITs and IIMs etc

It all began in 2002 when a small group of students started coming to Sasaram railway station to study. 
Now the Sasaram railway station study groups have become an institution. Senior students, both those who have been successful and those who have not, come to the station to coach younger boys in what has become a ritual.

The reason: Sasaram station has electricity 24X7. Mostly, the boys are from Rohtas, the district in Bihar that is hit by Left wing insurgency. In the village there is no power. These boys see a government job as the end of their struggles or #education as a stepping stone in their journey 

The station has been acknowledged in its role in shaping careers; has actually issued 500 identity cards to the boys to enable them to come and go freely, using the platform as temporary open classrooms

Some boys don’t go home at all, opting to sleep there at night while studying too 

It is a good example of cooperative #learning, the state of our villages and United Nations can be noted too

#sundaystories

author: Bhaduri SaravanaKumar
author_info: Co-Founder, Shevolve | Former Director of Customer Success @ PayPal | Femtech | Social Entrepreneur | Heartfulness
content:
From a floor cleaner to a deputy collector, what an incredible journey!

A 40-year old mother dreamt of becoming an IAS officer.

Asha Kandara is a mother of two kids.
 
She got separated from her husband eight years ago.
 
Despite having no financial support, she had to raise her children alone.
 
Alongside, she managed to complete her graduation.
 
She appeared for her Rajasthan Administrative Services exam.

However, the world got stuck with COVID at that time.
And, the results got delayed due to the pandemic.
 
Results were announced in July 2021.

Due to the delay in the results, she had to find another source of income.

She had no choice but to work as a sweeper for the Jodhpur Municipal Corporation.
 
The results of the Rajasthan Administrative Service examination got declared on July 13.

Her hard work finally paid off.

She will be joining the administrative services as a Deputy Collector.

Asha is a true inspiration to all mothers across the globe.

She didn't let society come in between her goals.
 
You shouldn't let anyone else come in between your dreams.

I'm inspired by her, she brilliantly demonstrated motherly instinct to do a job against all the odds.
 
What's stopping you from achieving your goals?

---

We are building Shevolve - a platform to empower women along their career path to grow. It's worth following it.

In this age of Data Science and AI/ ML, do you want to start programming and be at par? - https://bit.ly/2WuuCRB

author: Jukta Basu Mallik
author_info: Wharton MBA | Harvard Kennedy School MPA | Associate @ McKinsey & Co | IIM Kozhikode | TAS
content:
"Congratulations! You have made it to Harvard."

I am excited to share that I joined Harvard University to pursue a dual degree in Master of Public Administration concurrently with Master of Business Administration from The Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.

I feel humbled by the acceptance from the two most prestigious universities in the world and share this milestone with everyone who has helped and inspired me. ❤

Success is made of sweat and blood. For me, quite literally so. Post my father's demise, I witnessed my mother use every crumb we had to pay for my education. We were like two Amazonian warriors fighting against the world to keep afloat, constantly believing in #HoraceMann's vision of education being the "great equalizer" and the tool for social mobility. 📚

We did make it, but very few #firstgeneration students like me do. The lack of economic and social capital does not ONLY impact success; it stunts the very dreams we chase. I intend to work at the intersection of public and private sectors to improve access to higher education and make the world a more equal place.

I am incredibly grateful to my alma mater Indian Institute of Management, Kozhikode, my work-school Tata Administrative Services, and Titan Company Limited for being the wind beneath my wings. 

Thank you to my mentors and recommenders, Harish Bhat, #ProfMathews, Ayan Deb, and Javed KM, for their faith in me. 

It took a village, and I shall be forever grateful to friends and seniors who supported me for over 3 years through countless application essays, GMAT preparations, mock interviews, and for inspiring me to be as awesome as themselves Nishant Dey Purkayastha, Ruchi Singh, Sarmed Rashid, Rahul Srinivasan, Prasad Ganorkar, Priyanka Krishnamoorthy, Tat Sarkar, Akshay Sukthankar, Charanya Kannan.




Harvard Kennedy School #HarvardUniversity #firstgeneration #highereducation

author: Pankaj Gupta
author_info: Head- HR & Administration at MPCL Industries Ltd.
content:
Administration:
 
In Corporate World, #Administration is generally considered a low profile job which requires lesser intelligence and abilities. It is generally referred as "admin work". People working in Administration department also try to give themselves other Fancy titles such as Facility Management, Office Management etc. to avoid being called as Admin people. 
 
But if we see in government set up in India, The highest ranking officer belong to “Indian Administrative Services (IAS)”. Even MBA (Masters of Business Administration) degree has word Administration. 
 
In my view, Administration requires lot of coordination and is equally important than other departments in Corporates. Administration is also not an easy job to perform. Their work is generally not valued as household work done by #women. Without that work, it would be difficult for employees to even start the day. 
 
Never underestimate the value of ADMINISTRATION!

#management #adminsupport #equality #people #mba #culture #leadership #administrativeservices #intelligence #householdduties #change #governance

(Update : These days, Young aspirants are studying together because of the high success rate through group studying, quizzes and societal encouragement. Electricity, no longer, is a big problem. In 2017, Patna superintendent of Rail police Jitendra Mishra noticed this dedicated effort of students towards clearing the exams of Railways, Banks, Staff Selection Commission and other Govt departments. He provided identity cards to more than 500 youngsters)

The #resoluteYoungIndia
#SasaramJunction #Bihar #SasaramStudyGroups
#RailwayPlatformCumCoachingCentre

(Content from Business Standard 2018)
For two hours every morning and evening, both the platforms 1 and 2 of the railway station turn into a #coachingclass for young people who are aspirants for the #civilservices: The Indian Administrative Service, the state civil service, multiple bank examinations, even entry to the IITs and IIMs. It all began in 2002-03 when a small group of students started coming to Sasaram railway station to study. Now the Sasaram railway station study groups have become an institution.
 
Senior students — both those who have been successful and those who have not — come to the station to coach younger boys in what has become a ritual over the years. 

The reason is : Sasaram station has electricity 24X7. And the power never goes. Mostly, the boys are from Rohtas, the district in Bihar that is hit by Left wing insurgency. In many villages, either there is no power or the electricity is only intermittent. These boys see a government job as the end of their struggles and take advantage of the well lit station to sit under the lamp-post to study. The station has acknowledged its role in shaping careers and has actually issued 500 identity cards to the boys to enable them to come and go freely, using the platform as temporary open classrooms. Some boys don’t go home at all, opting to sleep there at night. They use the platform to take lessons and tips from seniors: Not just for the written examinations but also for interviews. The coaching involves sets of questions on a variety of subjects: Current affairs, mathematics, reasoning and language.

====== Cut to Now ========
It is, no longer, the lack of electricity that brings hundreds of aspirants here, but the high success rate. Students recall how even passengers would become emotional seeing the young boys concentrating in the din and would make sure that the students were not disturbed.

author: Richard Rehme
author_info: Live Receptionists ♦ Appointment Scheduling ♦ Office & Meeting Spaces ♦ Professional Address
content:
Intelligent Office phone support services can help business owners: 

1. Sound more professional. 
2. Save the business owner valuable time by avoiding answering and screening telemarketing calls, or 
3. Grow the business by capturing some additional business prospects that may have hung up and called a competitor if their calls were sent straight to VM. 

However, for some business there is still another great benefit. If a CPA, Counselor or Attorney tries to answer their own calls, invariably they will get the “let me ask you one quick question”. Translation, "I want some of your valuable expertise for free". We simply tell these callers, I’m sorry I’m not an attorney/CPA/counselor but I would be happy to schedule some time for you to speak with them.  

For the past 20+ years we’ve provided this conduit to for professionals to monetize their skills with callers. We’re a great referral for your CPA friend who doesn’t want to sound rude when people ask for free advice. We’ll answer all their calls and schedule future consultation calls on their calendar for around $2.00/hr.

#business #CPA #businessowners

author: Sambandan Prabhakar
author_info: Head of Episodic Animation Technicolor India.
content:
Absolutely Brilliant and Hilarious dialog😀😀😀..sharing it as received.
#fun 

Imagine Ordering a Pizza in 2022 ! 

CALLER:
    Is this Pizza Hut?
 
GOOGLE:    
No sir, it's Google Pizza.
 
CALLER:  
I must have dialed a wrong number, sorry.
 
GOOGLE:  
No sir, Google bought Pizza Hut last month.
 
CALLER:  
OK. I would like to order a pizza.
 
GOOGLE:  
Do you want your usual, sir?
 
CALLER:
My usual? You know me?
 
GOOGLE:
According to our caller ID data sheet, the last 12 times you called you ordered an extra-large pizza with three cheeses, sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms and meatballs on a thick crust.
 
CALLER:  
Super! That’s what I’ll have.
 
GOOGLE:
May I suggest that this time you order a pizza with ricotta, arugula, sun-dried tomatoes and olives on a whole wheat gluten-free thin crust?
 
CALLER:  
What? I don’t want a vegetarian pizza!
 
GOOGLE:  
Your cholesterol is not good, sir.
 
CALLER:  
How the hell do you know that?
 
GOOGLE:
Well, we cross-referenced your home phone number with your medical records. We have the result of your blood tests for the last 7 years.
 
CALLER:
Okay, but I do not want your rotten vegetarian pizza!  I already take medication for my cholesterol.
 
GOOGLE:
Excuse me sir, but you have not taken your medication regularly.  According to our database, you purchased only a box of 30 cholesterol tablets once at Lloyds Pharmacy, 4 months ago.
 
CALLER:  
I bought more from another Pharmacy.
 
GOOGLE:  
That doesn’t show on your credit card statement.
 
CALLER: 
I paid in cash.
 
GOOGLE:  
But you did not withdraw enough cash according to your bank statement.
 
CALLER:  
I have other sources of cash.
 
GOOGLE:
That doesn’t show on your latest tax returns, unless you bought them using an undeclared income source, which is against the law!
 
CALLER:    
WHAT THE HELL!
 
GOOGLE:  
I'm sorry sir, we use such information only with the sole intention of helping you.
 
CALLER:  
Enough already!  I'm sick to death of Google, Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp and all the others.  I'm going to an island without the internet, TV, where there is no phone service and no one to watch me or spy on me.
 
GOOGLE:      
I understand sir, but you need to renew your passport first. It expired 6 weeks ago...

Welcome to the future

Have a good day 🙂
