author: Taiwo Babatunde
author_info: Digital Content Writer|| Social Media Manager|| Public Speaker|| Affiliate Marketing Enthusiast| Networker| I teach🔥🔥
content:
My Facebook account almost got hacked yesterday and this was how I was able to salvage the situation.

What happened to me yesterday was so funny that I began to think how naive users fall prey easily to online hackers.

Two days ago, while loads of birthday wishes was bombarding my phone, I noticed something strange.

At first, I didn't pay close attention to it.

That day, I had many missed calls because I woke up a bit late.

Among the callers, there was a specific unknown number that called more than 5 times consecutively.

I ignored my observation to reply the birthday messages.

As I scrolled through my Facebook unread messages, I remember how a guy had earlier requested for my contact number so he can send me a birthday gift - that his P.A would call me.

Airtime... I assumed.

Out of innocence, I gave it out since I felt it isn't a big deal to give my followers chances to call and wish me a hearty birthday - at least for once.

I never knew I was dancing to his tune. A trap!

Before that day ended, that same number called again, told me he was the P.A to the guy who requested for my contact number on Facebook.

Then he said...

"Hello, young lady, a 6 digit number was sent to you, check your SMS inbox to confirm and send it to me right away!".

I was taken aback but for a few seconds.

Of a truth, I saw the 6 digits but I told him point blank that I haven't received any message of such.

He persisted for about 3mins, but when I wasn't succumbing, he hung up.

-------------------------------------------------------------

At exactly 7:45am yesterday, he called back and now with a new tactics.

He requested for the digits again, I lied again and he was like "Ah, ah you mean you haven't gotten it even till now?"

Called again 3:30pm yesterday.

This was where I began to become suspicious.

Me wey no dey dull myself.

At this point, I was curious but I didn't make it obvious.

"Even if the 6digits was sent to me, what will you do with it?" - I inquired.

He responded "It will serve as an evidence to my boss that the 20k birthday gift has been sent to you".

A link as a confirmation? 20k from a total stranger? I was flabbergasted.

I uttered a word and it was as though I had just stepped on the tail of a roaring lion.

"Chill, if I..."

Hey, go tell your Papa to chill" - He blasted!

Instantly, I knew it was an hacker desperate to steal my account for his nefarious business.

I hung up and blocked his number without thinking twice.

What baffled me most is that the other guy who earlier messaged me on Facebook in guise of sending a birthday gift had already blocked me on Facebook. Quite funny!

I'm telling you this so you don't fall victim to his accomplice out there.

Not only will your account be hacked, they will ruin your reputation, extort huge money from your followers especially if you've a large audience like me.

Caution: Investigate thoroughly before sending out a link or digits to unknown persons. Festive season is here.


Beware.

author: Marili Vihmann
content:
THIS TEAM REALLY ROCKS! ✌️ 

I don't have words to describe the emotions of the last week of sTARTUp Day. But I have words to describe this amazing team in the picture. sTARTUp Day connects people. We have this bond that holds us together and gives us some magical strength to go through anything. And we really did go through everything. 

It's time for a mic drop my friends after more than 5 years of organizing this amazing event that I grow up with. I had the time of my life with you! 🖤 And for that, I am so thankful for: 

💛 My awesome core team

Jana - an angel and queen of marketing, I just adore you! 
Triin - the kick-ass woman behind the program of main stages, the biggest inspiration
Ermo - the biggest support for me and to the whole sTARTUp community
Maarja - queen of our blogs, articles, PR, and just the cutest person
Mart - boss of sTARTUp Night, my cool side-kick for a long time
Lauri - event production & the reason why I joined the team of sTARTUp Day 

Andres Kuusik & Rein Lemberpuu - sTARTUp Day board members, awesome advice-givers, and support for the team 

💛 Co-organizers - tartu teaduspark & Swedbank (Merje Klopets) & Contriber & Smart City Tartu & University of Tartu & Tartu Biotehnoloogia Park & Ärinõuandla & Tartu loomemajanduskeskus 

+ more than 50 partners contributing to sTARTUp Day! Thank you all, you know who you are! 

And my awesome team leads and volunteers who are the bestEST out there and to whom I am the most grateful for: 

Otto Stalde & Marten Vainult (the most awesome registration managers - I can't thank you enough), Merily Heinalo (queen of seminars), Heli Malm (queen of demo area), Siim Hovintalo (king of matchmaking), Helle Haavala (queen of speed dating), Marii Ingriin Saaremäe (queen of creativness), Liis Järvamägi (queen of youth program), Killu Kolsar, Alice Gorobets (power women behind side-events), Hanna-Liis Remmelg (queen of sTARTUp Pitching and just the coolest person), Uku Kangur, Vaido Mikheim (king of pitching and great at everything), Kadri Arrak (queen of everything related to sTARTUp TARTU, you crazy), Laura Raudsepp (star of volunteers, love that let's do it attitude), Sigrid Mölder (solving people's problems), Rainer Eluri (logistics), Anett Klaanberg, Signe Aarla, Alice Veedla, Tejas Shah (Triin's awesome speaker team), Saskia Jõers (awesome festival studio program), Kadri Kristelle Karu, Sille Keller (Starlight, Spotlight managers), Saskia Rosimannus, Jakob Päll, Karl Kuusik, Mait Lättekivi (Jana's marketing team), Rene Rumberg, Artur Kamberg, Kristel Kont, Anette Tiitus, Jaanika Niinepuu (Maarja's awesome coms team), Teele Sikka + Acento (environmental friendly event), Maiken Austin & co (creative Pallas), Peeter Randväli, Hando Jaksi (RGB) + so many other people and partners to thank for. Sorry, I can't name everyone, but you know who you are! 

Thank you, thank you, thank you! And don't worry, we will sleep and then celebrate the work that has been done. Get ready!

author: Zambia Development Agency
content:
HAPPENING NOW: WEBINAR ON POLICY INTERPRETATION ON CHINESE FOOD SAFETY MANAGEMENT REGULATIONS
The webinar will focus on the following
1. Policy interpretation on the Administrative Measures on Import and Export Food Safety of the People’s Republic of China (GAC Order No. 249) and the Administrative Provisions on the Registration of Overseas Food Producers in the People's Republic of China (GAC Order No. 248) 
2. Explanation of the questions raised by African food producers.
(English and Chinese interpretation would be provided to ensure the accurate transmission of information at the meeting) 
Date: 20th December 2021
Time: 09:00 Zambian time (15:00 Beijing time).
Zoom meeting link: https://lnkd.in/dJVNgRCE
#Background
International Trade Centre (ITC) initiated a new project, Partnership for enhancing export capacity of Africa to China (PEECAC), in September 2021. 
This 3-year project aims to promote economic and trade cooperation between China and Africa, primarily through participation in the China-Africa Economic and Trade Expo (CAETE) and the Distribution, Trading and Processing Centre (DTPC) Hunan Province, China. It will support Ethiopia, Kenya, Madagascar, Mauritius, Mozambique, Rwanda, Uganda and Zambia to increase agricultural and food products export to China and attract Chinese sustainable investment in these countries.  
To strengthen the registration management of overseas food producers, China will implement the "Administrative Provisions on the Registration of Overseas Food Producers" from 1st January 2022. At that time, the General Administration of Customs of China (GACC) will give registration numbers to the overseas producers of imported food that meet the requirements.

author: Timothy Lawn, M.A.
author_info: United States Army Sergeant Major / USMC - Grunt - Infantry.  " Afghanistan - Proudly Served - Never Forget!
content:
A CITY THAT PRODUCES ITS OWN POWER - This city produces its own power for a cleaner environment and budget savings - for the past few years, the city has been an energy producer, generating solar power through large panel farms in order to save budget money and raise revenue by selling it to residents, local businesses. 
  - At first, only municipal buildings were outfitted with LCE power, saving the city a small amount of money. 
  - Later, LCE began to sell power to local residents and businesses, generating revenue for the city and saving households about 3% every year compared to power provided by the local utility. 
  - Just as important for some Lancaster residents and officials is the clean-energy aspect of the initiative. The city became one of the first “zero net energy” cities in the world in 2019, meaning it “procures or produces more energy via renewable sources than is consumed within city limits,” according to city literature. 
  - By charging some city overhead to the revenue-producing LCE, they can also save taxpayers money: $640,000 in 2021, out of a roughly $234 million budget.  

 - #BIEDSociety

author: Eli Albrecht
content:
I observe Shabbat. I have tried to hide at different times but never compromised and it makes me a better lawyer, father, husband, and human. For 26 hours beginning sundown on Friday I turn off my phone and computer, I don’t use electronics and I don’t drive. 

What I do is affirmatively focus on self-growth. I lean in and nurture my relationship with my kids and beautiful wife. I let my mind rest and allow it to grapple with the challenges of the week in a more creative and innovative way than when I’m in the trenches. I let my perspective zoom out and think about big-picture issues and even do a bit of naval-gazing philosophizing with family and friends.

Most importantly, I evaluate whether I was the kind of lawyer, co-worker, father, and husband that I wanted to be this past week and how I can do better this coming week. 

Throughout my career I was told that to do M&A (especially PE), I would have to compromise my Shabbat observance. A partner told me last year, “you may be the best attorney in the world, but unfortunately, if we get an LOI on Friday night, I need you to turn it back to the client by Saturday night. If you can’t do that, I just can’t work with you. Have you considered Tax?” While I would have loved to work with that person, I am not willing to compromise Shabbat. 

Shabbat is designed to reinforce that our value is not the sum of our productivity or what we produce. Our value goes beyond our work and beyond the economic value we create. When all the ringing and pinging is gone for 26 hours, you realize that your worth is independent of your work. 

Joe Lieberman was an early role model of mine, in part because he observed Shabbat. He was a U.S. Senator and did not compromise Shabbat observance. Not only did he make it work, but it made him a better Senator, a better father, and a better human. He wrote a beautiful book about Shabbat and how everyone (of all faiths or no faith) can benefit by integrating Shabbat into their daily lives by taking moments to self-reflect and discuss deep topics (The Gift of Rest). We had an enjoyable discussion about Shabbat when we met a “few” years ago (picture in the Comments). 

As we celebrate the holidays with friends and family and move into a new year, we would be well served to integrate a bit of Shabbat into our own lives, to take time to shut off the electronics and be present with our loved ones. These are the moments that have real meaning, these are the moments our children and spouses remember; I would not trade those moments for anything.

While I recognize that Shabbat observance could result in a detriment to my career or winning certain clients, the gains to my mental health, peace of mind, creativity, innovation, closeness to family, and overall wellbeing are absolutely priceless. 

To those that celebrate Christmas, wishing you a truly meaningful and peaceful holiday with your loved ones. 

Shabbat shalom to all.

#privateequity #law #shabbatshalom

author: Shira S.
content:
“ Humanity Is the foundation of any image.  Then comes the journalism aspect, and then the photography.  

Like It or not, a photograph Is an art form, regardless of subject or style. One of the reasons I can make this generalisation Is that as with anything artistic, its not a definitive thing; it means different things to different viewers and Is totally subjective. To one viewer It may be crap, to another It may be superb. Just like music, sculpture, painting, the written word or film, It stirs up a different feeling and thought within anyone who looks at a picture. Its not finite like a mathematical formula but totally infinite in its communication.

Its not your story, It belongs to your subject. You must never forget that.”


- Edmond Terakopian - 
London-based freelance press photographer.

The Daily Mirror newspaper named Him  as the author of one of the world's most iconic photographs, referring to His photograph from the July 7th terrorist bombings in London. One of these photographs was also selected for "100 Photos of the 21st Century: Editions de la Martiniere". Alongside a third place award in the prestigious World Press Photo awards and being bestowed the title of Photographer Of The Year in the British Press Awards, He has also served as the British Prime Minister's official photographer, as a member of a three photographer team, working directly for the British Prime Minister Tony Blair's office . He Has participated in several group and solo exhibitions, having His work exhibited . He also been published in numerous books. his main areas of work are portraiture, PR, the arts, documentary, news, fashion, commercial and advertising photography, alongside documenting daily life on the streets, capturing candid and natural moments, building a picture of our time.

I usually write about photographers who are not among the living.  For photographers who have left a priceless legacy.  That influenced me.  Who left a mark on me.  I have written very little about photographers while they are still alive.  But this Is one of the pulse-pounding photographers and I am very attached to his work.  A brave connection of a viewer In front of the work of the photographer - It’s a special bond .  Edmond Is one of them.  The seam between photojournalist and artistic photography - He symbolizes for me.  Beyond being a photographer of supreme grace he Is also a wonderful human .  Photographers show us the world, through the lenses of their eyes.  I have a real and sincere fondness for observing the subject Of the world through the lenses of Edmond’s special eye .

Photography as a language, of all visual languages, Is known to be the most intuitive, completely unmediated and speaks directly to the brain. There Is a factor In photography that evokes the almost physiological response of the word / sound - wow.  The wow factor - I found In his work . 

Photo: ©Opera singer Ida Ränzlöv,
About the photo In the first Comment 
Edmond Terakopian 🖤

author: Shira S.
content:
“ Who am I to spout about life, love, happiness? 
About whether all's right with the world, or whether it's just a vale of tears... I think it's unbelievable, fabulous, this life of ours… everything, the birds and the bees, the deer and the antelope, the spacious skies, the foggy dew, the rockabye babies… My wife's embrace, a landing on the moon, space, time, eternity. 
I don't understand one damn thing about any of it, except that it's enough to keep me In a constant delirium of delight, surprise, enthusiasm, despair, enough to keep me roaming, stumbling, faltering, cursing, adoring, hating the destruction, the violence In myself and others.

I'm not a journalist, an objective reporter. I am a man with likes and dislikes.

I can only do something that I want to do myself. I can only act on my own impulses.

I started taking photos as a reflex...as a kind of diary notation.

This Is the setting of my film. My hunting ground.

I am so often, very often, actually extremely happy. 
Why? What is this happiness? What Is happiness? What does 'being happy' mean?

I would love to have a little camera surgically installed In my head. 
With a mini microphone, highly sensitive, so I could observe and record and look with precision, so I can capture everything I want, all day long. It's a ridiculous idea, of
course, but that's what I would love. There's so much I want to capture and comment on.

I celebrate life. 
I'm no more complex than that. And this means I celebrate everything: love, courage, beauty, but also rage, blood, sweat and tears.

Show the world who you are."



- Eduard van der Elsken - 
was a Dutch photographer and filmmaker.

His imagery provides quotidian, intimate and autobiographic perspectives on the European zeitgeist spanning the period of the Second World War into the nineteen-seventies in the realms of love, sex, art, music (particularly jazz), and alternative culture. He described his camera as 'infatuated' . His style is subjective and emphases the seer over the seen; a photographic equivalent of first-person speech.

At the suggestion of Dutch photographer Emmy Andriesse he moved in 1950 to Paris. He was employed in the darkrooms of the Magnum photography agency, printing for Henri Cartier- Bresson (who was impressed with his street photography), Robert Capa and Ernst Haas. There he met (and in 1954 married) fellow photographer Ata Kandó , twelve years his senior, living with her three children among the 'ruffians' and bohemians  of Paris .

A unique figure, Van der Elsken was renowned as a street photographer, and Is recognised as the most important Dutch photographer of the 20th century.
In his work, he developed a bold, unconventional and personal style. Van der Elsken's presence resonates throughout his work: he cared about making a personal connection with the people he photographed and, like a playful art director, often staged situations, too.

About this Iconic photo and few nots In the first comments.

author: Michael Ishigaki
author_info: Design Manager of Nazare Interfaces at Meta
content:
I am excited to publicly announce that I am leading the Nazare Interfaces design org at Meta (previously known as Facebook).
 
Nazare is the codename of our immersive consumer AR Glasses product. The Nazare Interfaces org is composed of: the Shell team, the Interaction Model team, the Design System team, and the "App" Model team. 

We are building the foundational experiences of AR Glasses.
 
AND I'M SUPER EXCITED TO ANNOUNCE THAT WE ARE HIRING!
 

* Nazare Design System: Design Manager *
 
What does the future look and feel like? What is the design system for a 3D-first computing platform like? How does Meta's brand get expressed in AR glasses? How do we build a platformized, extensible, and adaptable design system to inspire the next generation of creators and app developers?
 
I am hiring a seasoned Design Manager who can lead and manage the extremely talented Design System team. This is a 0-1 opportunity that will need to grow and scale in really big ways as the product matures.
 

* Nazare Interaction Model: Designer-prototyper “hybrids” *
 
Nazare is a product with a completely novel interaction model. How do we make Nazare the most intuitive computing platform ever? How do we ensure using AR glasses is socially acceptable? How do we make interaction with this device delightful, comfortable, and effective?
 
I am hiring designer-prototyper “hybrids” who design in-prototype and are excited about inputs and interactions.
 

* Nazare “App” Model: Designer-prototyper “hybrids” *
 
Apps, widgets, and notifications – along with the way these constructs interact – make up the “App Model” of the smartphone. What are the core constructs that make up the experiences on AR Glasses, and how do they interact with each other?
 
I am hiring designer-prototyper “hybrids” who design in-prototype and are excited about the foundational elements of the future of computing.
 

* Nazare Shell: Designer-prototyper “hybrids” *
 
Nazare's Shell is the user experience of the system itself. How do we connect users to the experiences, controls, notifications, and other things they want to use? What’s the interface for content that’s augmented in the world? How do we enable contextual help, curated discovery, and content management? How do we set a standard of excellence for design by which all future experiences will be measured?
 
I am hiring a designer-prototyper “hybrids” who design in-prototype and are excited about Nazare's shell experience.
 

Contact me if you are interested in any of these opportunities!

author: Help Musicians
content:
We’re very grateful to Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport (DCMS) and Arts Council England for supporting our 2022 Hardship Funding. 
 
The fast-changing landscape means musicians are once again left with uncertain careers, leaving them vulnerable to financial insecurity and impacting their mental health. 
 
We will be assessing how we can provide the most effective safety net needed for self-employed and unemployed professional musicians in January, but the size of funds needed could be vast. Help Musicians will be adding to this Hardship Fund from our own reserves and would welcome contributions from all corporates and music lovers who can afford to make a donation. Freelance musicians need as much support as possible right now.

Today is my birthday and I’ve been receiving flowers and congratulations all day. What an amazing feeling it is to know that there are so many beautiful and loving people in my life ❤️

It was a great party, btw. - a gift for me from me. I organized a personal concert for myself with 3 groups of talented musicians - an incredible indie band I found performing on a street, a virtuoso guitarist and a legendary Estonian band I have loved since I was a teenager.

I didn’t take almost any pictures on Friday, but it’s all in my heart ☺️

author: François Fragnière, EMBA
author_info: Head of Pursuits & Markets Financial Services (Western Switzerland) chez KPMG Switzerland
content:
Like a musician who has learned a lot of theory, I feel it is now time to play music. 

These last 16 months have been intense: countless assignments, lots of short nights and very busy week-ends. But most importantly, these months allowed me to meet new friends, to have meaningful discussions and to make new experiences. Last friday, I got my Executive MBA from HEC Lausanne, a very nice Christmas gift. 

A huge "thank you to my wife Jessica for her patience and continued support! An EMBA is clearly family decision. 
My gratitude goes also to KPMG for the contribution and the very positive attitude towards the executive education. 
And thank you also Jeffrey, the professors, coaches and admin team who did an amazing work to make our life easier. 

Et maintenant, en avant la musique!

content:
DAY 11: Throughout HCA Healthcare’s #12DaysOfCaring, we’ve shined a light on our commitment to provide healthcare that puts people first. We stand for accessible, high-quality healthcare, delivered with compassion, integrity and kindness. This next moment underscores the impact that caring for the whole person can make. 

Archie has been a patient at HCA Healthcare affiliate Methodist Hospital in San Antonio, Texas for 43 days. It's always been a lifelong dream of his to sing "Oh Holy Night" with the Musicians of the San Antonio Symphony. This past week his dream came true. 

Thank you to our friends at Hearts Need Art for partnering with us to spread the holiday spirit, making meaningful moments like these possible – and to the musicians of the San Antonio Symphony for volunteering your time.

author: Jesse Cooke
content:
75 years ago on December 20, 1946, ‘It's a Wonderful Life’ was previewed in a charity showing at New York City's Globe Theatre (now The Lunt-Fontanne Theatre at 205 West 46th Street in Manhattan), the day before the film's official debut. The movie stars James Stewart as George Bailey, a frustrated businessman with unfulfilled dreams who decides to end his life when an angel intervenes.

Reviews of the film were mixed, with the New York Times calling it "weak," and initially it was a financial failure. In the 1970s, the film began showing up on TV during Christmastime and quickly became a family favorite. In a particularly romantic scene, George tells Mary about how he is going to lasso the moon for her after the pair walk home from a dance together singing:

Buffalo gals, won't you come out tonight?
Come out tonight, come out tonight?
Buffalo gals, won't you come out tonight,
And dance by the light of the moon?

The song was written in 1844 about the girls in the red light district around the Erie Canal in Buffalo, NY, the site of the canal’s western terminus and where crewmen and other canal workers collected their wages. Musicians changed the words depending on where they were performing (e.g. Boston Gals, Charleston Gals, New York Gals, etc.), but the Buffalo version was the most popular. 

Screenwriter Frank Capra, and the movie's stars Donna Reed and Jimmy Stewart have all cited It’s a Wonderful Life as their favorite movie. In his autobiography, Capra took that praise one step further: “I thought it was the greatest film I ever made. Better yet, I thought it was the greatest film anybody ever made.”

author: Rhett Ayers Butler
author_info: Founder of Mongabay, a conservation and environmental science news platform
content:
I am happy to announce that Mongabay is establishing new positions to grow our visual storytelling capabilities. 

These roles will bring new skills and talents to scale up our video production, data visualization, and web development efforts. These positions will work directly with our editorial teams to expand Mongabay's ability to deliver news and inspiration from Nature's frontline.

The new positions include:

- Graphics Specialist (Global bureau) to produce data visualizations and designs that improve the quality and visual appeal of Mongabay’s journalism.

- Video Production Coordinator (Global bureau) to create, coordinate, organize, and systematize original video content sourced from a global network of videographers inspired by conservation and environmental science.

- Web Developer (South Asia bureau) to build and support websites, databases, and digital workflows.

We also have two other new positions in the South Asia bureau:

- Staff Writer – Bangladesh to report on conservation and environmental issues from the country.

- Staff Writer – Nepal to report on conservation and environmental issues from the country.

More details on these positions and the application process can be found at mongabay.org

author: Zachary Boswell
author_info: Cultural Heritage and e-Learning Translation/Transcreation Arabic>US_English...Multiple First Prize Winning Spoken Word Poet
content:
I'd like to share something here about myself. My passion projects include Poetry and Music. Every other day I post a Haiku or Long Form poem on Facebook.

I have been performing on my guitar with vocals on a platform called www.sessionslive.com for a while now. Mainly to an audience in Indonesia with some Americans mixed in.

Yeah, I know I test the character limit with my recent posts on LinkedIn with the subject matter I have been studying for years. I may speak with assumed authority, but yes, even though key players in the industries I have posted on call on me and recognize me as a knowledgeable source, I have a bit of Peter-pan syndrome mixed in as I have mainly been surrounded by young children in my personal sphere as a father of four young children who create a world of magic in my home. It's hard not to see the world through their eyes.

I have worked/studied from home for eleven years, and I have depended on my musical and poetic abilities to make up for lost time with my friends and family and communicate to them that despite my dedication to my personal professional and educational pursuits that I am here for them and very much trying to remain reachable. 

But I draw inspiration from fellow artists who have "duel-classed" an artistic inclination with their professional pursuits and have mentioned them online on LinkedIN

So tonight, I am posting from my personal life.

I have studied Haiku for 15 years both in Western Academia and under a man referred to as a master in the Japanese styles on Shenro Haiku whom I have mentioned in a previous post regarding #professionaltranslation.

If you are interested in learning more about Haiku, this man asked me to begin teaching my personal style in 2014. 

This is the Haiku I wrote this morning and posted online.

~
Tunnel Vision, Haiku

I've burned some bridges
Hoping to rebuild new ones
From wood to concrete
~Zachary

~

I am also posting something I have not seen someone do in the 5 years I have been posting on LinkedIn. 

This is one of the videos I started making for my children since I have a medical condition with my arms and hands that has developed when I play guitar which creates a certain degree of pain. 

*Please understand that I am not trying to use LinkedIn to promote my music professionally on this platform.

Folks. If you've been following my posts over the last few months and want to know who I am, I can't think of any better time that I feel like myself than when I'm playing my gee-tar and singing for my friends and family and recently online.

Feel very free to use the comments section below to share a bit about yourself and your hobbies/passion projects that help you find that work/life balance and decompression. I would love to see it!


*For folks not interested in this sort of context as you scroll thinking of the daily grind, please disregard. :) 

~Zack
(OK, getting back to business now)
#share #poetrycommunity #musiclife #haiku
https://lnkd.in/ekXYRhKW

author: InceptionU Ltd.
content:
Meet Samsudeen Naina of Cohort 5! 

A native of Sri Lanka with an extensive background in Data and Performance Analysis, Samsudeen jumped at the opportunity to join EvolveU to upgrade his development skills. A team player and collaborator at heart, Samsudeen is passionate about solving problems and the idea of fixing bugs gets him excited! He is currently putting that passion into practice with his project team, as they are developing an app where music professionals can create audio visualizations and export video. 

As the program nears completion, Samsudeen is looking forward to working for a local Calgary start up where his responsibilities and skills will always been evolving. Continuous learning and variety are really important to Samsudeen. 

For future learners, Samsudeen states "Don't stop learning. Industry is changing so fast that constantly learning and absorbing new things all the time is so important." 

Samsudeen's kind heart, empathetic spirit, and creativity will no doubt be a SCORE for the company lucky enough to hire him!

P.S. Samsudeen is a soccer coach with Calgary Minor Soccer Association!

Reach out and connect with Samsudeen!

author: Sonya Askew
author_info: Management & Development of Memberships & Academic Partnerships Initiatives/Excellent Entertainment Industry Contacts & Networks/Career Advice Blogger
content:
This week I started a new job at Music Business Association as the Memberships & Academic Partnerships Director. After many years in the music industry, I am blessed to have had the opportunity to pivot my career into working for a not-for-profit organization like Music Biz https://musicbiz.org/.

Some of you may still refer to Music Biz as NARM. But I must tell you that Music Biz is WAY more than what NARM used to be. It supports the music industry well beyond the yearly conference.

Offerings like webinar series, daily email feeds, virtual suite events, action committee gatherings addressing timely industry issues are offered to members throughout the year. And academic partnerships have also been one of the pillars of Music Biz which is especially appealing to me due to my own personal crusade to mentor the next wave of young music professionals.

So, yea I’m pretty hyped. I’m reinvigorated about being a part of this crazy, fun, always-changing industry. Get ready I’ll be hitting up many of you about the benefits of becoming a member or becoming a more engaged member. Don’t even try to ghost me! #musicbiz2022, #nextgenu

author: Company23creative
content:
Learn more about what we do:
Company 23 is a place where you will find more than just a music school. It’s a brand new concept which aims to provide high-quality musical training combined with something much needed in the musical community: a sense of fun.

Company 23 is a haven for pupils of all ages and abilities. It offers myriad skills-enhancing courses that are practical in their teaching, yet imaginative in their application.

We offer exceptional music and theatre activities throughout the UK, 1-2-1, groups and online courses.

At Company 23, we believe in the raw power of music to connect with our students. We’re passionate about teaching them to sing and perform with confidence, how to be creative and free thinking, how to find their voices.

Led by music professional, award winning singer and songwriter Jazmine Lily Heath, Company 23 provides a unique music syllabus experience in which students learn through performing, creating and recording.

Inspired by her commercial music industry profession and teaching music and English within Tokyo, Japan, Jazmine has created Company 23 to inspire creativity, joy and confidence in our next generation.

Everyone at Company 23 is a team who all have the same vision. That vision is to inspire the whole generation to become musically creative.

Our method involves singing, music writing, production and theatre activities and takes place in a friendly environment.

Students are not judged or put under pressure; they are encouraged and allowed to be expressive, enjoy themselves, make friends and have fun as they venture into a world of imagination through music.

We have lessons which cover all roles needed for commercial music industry & performing arts theatre productions as well as incredible recording studio opportunities where students can produce their own music.

So, if you’re looking to learn singing, start up a career in theatre or music production, or even just try your hand at making music with your kids, check out this amazing company and see how we can help you reach your dreams.

#school #students #teaching #music #musicindustry #community #company23creative #company23

author: Patrick A. Koller
content:
Two years ago, I wanted to learn to play cello. I was looking for private cello lessons that would fit into my busy schedule. There was no platform to find the right teacher. And music schools didn't offer the level of flexibility and choice I needed. The vision was then born to build a digital marketplace that offers easier access for everyone to take music lessons and enable talented and passionate music teachers to turn their talent into their profession - part-time or full-time.

This morning, I took my first cello lesson after enjoying breakfast with my family. The lesson took place live-online in my home office with one of our talented cello teachers on Matchspace, the platform to find music lessons when, where and with whom you want. 

Since our launch last summer, Matchspace has attracted more than 100 talented and passionate music professionals. From piano, guitar or singing to didgeridoo, bagpipes, or electronic music production, Matchspace offers maximum choice and flexibility to take music lessons. 

Thank you Olivier Kipfer Fabian Felix Weber Bobby Leu Julian Weber Lhatul Wangmo and the entire Selise team for all your efforts, dedication and support. I feel honored and grateful to work with such great people.

app.matchspace.com
#Matchspace #passiondrivenlearning

author: Brenda Narvaez Leenderts
author_info: Junior Conference Curator bij Amsterdam Dance Event
content:
Guess who's back! 
After years of being involved with Amsterdam Dance Event in all sorts of ways (volunteer, intern, short-term freelancer), this summer I finally got to start working on the development and creation side of things as Junior Conference Curator.  Together with my lovely colleague and Senior Jesler Amarins, I'm currently curating and creating the program for ADE Lab which is ADE its talent development conference for (aspiring-) DJs, producers and the next generation music professionals. 
Even though times are fickle, I'm very glad to be back at the office surrounded by an amazing, passionate and warm team. 

Also, I'd like to write a short word of gratitude to both Jesler and Karsten ter Hoeven for believing in my creative abilities and eagerness to learn ever since I showed up as a young intern, and helping me grow into the position and person I am now :)

author: Mary Ellen Clausen
content:
I love this picture of me – It captures the joy I feel in my happy place, Cafe at 407.  Recently my husband and I were getting ready to make a pretty big move in our lives, and every day up to that move seemed to get shorter and shorter. Yet, I decided that capturing those feelings of joy in photos was a top priority. And as my luck would have it, the stars aligned, Alice Patterson was available as was my “stylist” aka my niece Shauna.   
I wondered why in the midst of everything that was going on at the time why this was so important to me. And then I realized the Café grounds me. It’s hard to believe but this little Café With a Cause turned 12 this month, and over the past 12 years the Café has been a safe landing, for not only those seeking services and the community, but for me– It’s been my exhale.  
I started Ophelia’s Place almost 20 years ago. I “retired” almost 10 years ago, realized I didn’t have a succession plan in place for said retirement, returned, and yes I’m still here. All of my focus since has been on long term sustainability. Café at 407 began as a way to raise awareness about the cause, create a revenue stream for OP, and feel a little less alone in the world. The Café is our way of being responsible to funding the work of OP. And if I’m being fully transparent, that work is hard and funding that work is even harder...

author: Michel-Edouard Leclerc
content:
C'est officiel, ça fait plaisir à Inès notre super bienveillante influenceuse et c'est une belle reconnaissance pour nos 150 acheteurs stylistes et passionné(e)s de tissus : E.Leclerc est devenu le premier distributeur de textiles en France (6,5%) devant Kiabi (3,7%) et Carrefour (3,4%).

Bien sûr, on ne parle pas là de vêtements de luxe ou de marques hyper-spécialisées. Notre offre couvre les besoins familiaux, scolaires et sportifs, avec comme marque leader Tissaia qui s'est fait une sacrée place dans la notoriété des marques textiles. Et, au total, un volume d'affaires de 1,3 milliard: jupes, pulls, chaussant, dessus, par-dessus et dessous... 🙌😄 Pas mal pour des anciens épiciers !

A l'origine de l'histoire des centres E.Leclerc, mes parents jugeaient important de se différencier des collègues alimentaires en présentant une gamme accessible de linges de maison, de vêtements pour enfants et un peu de chaussures. 

Une initiative très réussie des groupes Monoprix et Prisunic avait crée un réel engouement pour ce marché grand public. Passionnées, autour de ma mère Hélène Leclerc, des dizaines de femmes adhérentes de notre mouvement ont d'abord tenté d'obtenir le droit de vendre des grandes marques moins chères. 

Mais même si Daniel Hechter avait concédé livrer quelques pulls, vestes et pantalons, les fabricants ont préféré investir dans les chaines spécialisées en faisant fabriquer en Asie. 

Du coup, les Leclerc ont lancé  leur marque : Tissaia est devenu un vrai repère des achats familiaux et a même eu un joli succès dans la mode. 

C'est 40% des ventes aujourd'hui et ce secteur textile permet à l'enseigne de se diversifier énormément en province par rapport à Lidl, Aldi, Netto, Intermarché qui surenchérissent en ce moment sur le réveillon. Bon, nous aussi, mais pour faire un cadeau au copain ou à madame : un petit bijou du Manège, un joli pull ou un parfum "Une heure pour soi", on va chez E.Leclerc. 👍

On doit cette performance textile à l'obstination d'une centaine d'adhérentes et de collaboratrices qui, animées par Fabienne Poilbout, s'appellent Dolly, Marianne, Christèle, Sadia, Olivia, Marie, Sarah, Quentin et Valérie.  

NB : à l'occasion, j'invite à aller visiter la formidable exposition présentée aux Arts Déco à Paris pour découvrir le rôle immensément préconisateur des collections Monoprix, à une époque où la distribution ne se satisfaisait pas de faire du benchmark. 🙌🙌🙌. A nous d'innover aujourd'hui ! 👌

author: Bevin Niemann
content:
I am so exhausted by people in STEM fields telling creatives that they need to turn their back on what they love, because it’s a ‘wasted’ degree. Get a tech job, so you won’t be starving on your parents couch, is their wounding advice.

Of note: you wouldn’t have been able to binge watch your favorite movies without writers, videographers, graphic artists, costume designers, set designers, audio specialists, producers and actors - all people who chose the creative path. Or, have access to the myriad of musicians you jam to on Spotify.

Perhaps the fact that STEM is more valued and highly paid than the arts is the problem, not what college major someone chooses…

 #writers #creatives #graphicartists #actors #dancers #musicians #designers #respect

author: Mourad B.
content:
I'm honored to be part of this panel on Sound in immersive spaces hosted by IMERSA next friday. We'll talk about some of the challenges in workflows and formats we've encountered, especially working in the Société des arts technologiques [SAT] art space.

"Sound in Immersive Spaces: An Exploration of Immersive Audio Design 
Over the past few years the field of immersive audio has exploded. With the popularization of VR, AR, and XR new production tools, techniques, and workflows to address the evolving nature of immersive experiences have been introduced into the industry. On December 3rd join IMERSA and a panel of immersive audio specialists to do a deep dive into discussions around the differences and similarities of creative and technical practices for developing immersive audio content to be distributed across VR, AR, and Fulldome platforms."

content:
We always ensure that every project we complete looks absolutely stunning, however, it’s the unseen areas that hold everything together.

It isn’t always pretty working with technology, and often we come across projects that are impossible to figure out due to disorganised infrastructure. We believe that keeping everything tidy and organised, from the wiring to the positioning of technology, will enable the most efficient and user friendly system to be produced. Not only does organised infrastructure perform better, but it also looks fantastic. Just because it’s not seen as regularly doesn’t mean it can’t look great.

For more information about getting infrastructure installed or redesigned, contact us: https://bit.ly/3DYZWrV

author: Sajid Chowdhury
author_info: Managing Director, Big Blue | Digital projects for international development organisations
content:
I recently spoke in an online discussion on use of animation in international development and research. Summary:

Research and data are often complex and technical. Well-produced animation simplifies and creates connections.

Much of an animation project is not visualisation. It is audience analysis, plain language, emotional buy-in, and good sound. Visualisation often comes surprisingly late in the process.

It's a team effort. See the visual below. A production may involve a writer, storyboarder, narrator, animator(s), audio specialist(s), and promoters. And of course, there is the researcher with the important data, too.

Average reading age level in the UK = 9. Many people (and especially researchers and technical specialists!) over-estimate this number. Aim low and easy. Plain language is not dumb language. Visuals help a lot.

10% of the UK population is dyslexic. 1 in 5 people have a disability that may be motor, cognitive, visual, or hearing-related. Audiences' ability to understand your research can be affected by attention, physical disability, emotional hardship, injury, language barriers, learning disability, low literacy, nutrition insecurity, time restrictions, and unfamiliarity with technology. Animations, visuals, and sound can enable more audiences to connect with your research.

Well-planned animation, visuals, and sound are excellent vehicles for research and knowledge. This concept is not new or ground-breaking. But it is still under-utilised.

Animation goes where cameras cannot. It can communicate the abstract and also the technical. When it is done well, it can really change the way people see things.

content:
In the early decades of the twentieth century, Russian artists and architects generated some extraordinary work that fired up the imagination of architects across the globe. But what is happening in the early decades of the 21st century? Is there a new form of post-soviet Avant-Garde emerging? This session brings together some of the most radical computational designers, activists and thinkers in Russia today.
Speakers:
Vadim Smakhtin - creative engineer and urbanist, Maria Kuptsova - architect, interdisciplinary artist and researcher, Max Malein - architect, computer-aided design specialist, Masha Slavnova - architect and researcher in the field of urban ecology and design, Ksenia Ermoshina - internet freedom activist and anarcheologist, Nikolay Smirnov - geographist, artist and curator

author: Romain Palmieri
content:
2021 has been an amazing and game-changing year for Groover! 🙏

Music production and distribution are easier than ever (from 20 000 songs released per day in 2018 to 400 000 in 2025 🤯) .... but music promotion and curation remain the main challenge. We are highly focused on this! 

Our goal is to provide independent artists with the best music promotion platform and services globally. 

Some great highlights about this year at Groover: 

🎸 We now have 73 000 artists subscribed on Groover in more than 100 countries, and a community of 1 500 active music curators who provided 1 000 000 feedback trough Groover. Artists got visibility, partnerships, labels signatures, sharing on social media, live opportunities, playlist addition thanks to us! 

🤖 We now have a working recommandation system that helps artists to connect with music curators that are more likely to enjoy their music. It improve their chance to success, and simplify curation process for music pros! 

⭕️ We launched Groover Obsessions, the first artist accelerator towards success that will continue to accelerate the most promising artists detected on Groover, already 50 artists signed to this new amazing program. 

🦾 We acquired Soonvibes, a music platform in the electronic scene that helped us to offer more opportunities for techno and house artists. 

👩🎤 It was the year of our first NFT drops with our friends at Pianity! For some of the artists who got great results on Groover, it was a new way to raise funds and get new fans. 

🌈 Creator Economy was definitely trendier this year than we started Groover in 2018 :) It is great, because our vision (and positioning) has always been to address the music promotion vertical in the space (music artists still are the most numerous creators in release volume!). Having more awareness, partners and people interest in the space opened opportunities for collaborations. 

🌎 Our community of artists is growing in very different countries: in Europe, in the US, in Brazil, in Canada ... as well as our community of curators. 

🇺🇸 We developed a lot our growth in the US and we are about to launch an office there. More partnerships and cool news to come. 

🎤 Events were back and our showcase at La Marbrerie in Montreuil was full in December to celebrate the 1 year anniversary of Groover Obsessions! What a great moment to see curators, artists and the team for this live event (Dorian Rafael) 

🚀 We raised a round of $7m with great investors who support our long term vision. Thanks so much Partech (🙏 Alison) and Bpifrance (🙏 Guillaume), as well as all the investors who helped us for the support. 

Thanks a lot to the team for this amazing year! Dorian Rafael Sara Santiago Lorenzo Timothée Louise Marguerite Anthony Emma Ambre Antoine Thiago Mathilde Maxime Achraf Michael Jonas

We are looking for more people to join us in Q1 with some great offers in HR, in Marketing, in Curators Partnerships and in Tech 😎 More about our offers below 👇

author: Shailesh Jaiswal
author_info: MA Psychology, Delhi University | Author | #1 National Research Awardee | GATE AIR 100 (XH - Psychology)
content:
𝟒𝟑 𝐃𝐚𝐲𝐬 𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐥 𝐏𝐬𝐲𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐲 𝐆𝐀𝐓𝐄 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟐 𝐄𝐱𝐚𝐦!

A few months ago Smridhi Seth and I had shared a curated guide to help you crack Psychology GATE 2022 exam preparation.

author: Robert Berry
author_info: I help auditors ask better questions ➟ Corporate & Audit Trainer | Business Consultant | 🎤 International Speaker
content:
HAPPY HOLIDAY & HOLIDAY HAPPINESS 

The movies, the ads, the perfectly curated Instagram pictures of decorations, beautifully wrapped presents, and matching family pajamas all fuel this idea of what we think the holidays should look like. 

But does it really reflect our real-life experiences? Do you feel the pressure of having the 'picture perfect' Xmas? Is it easy to feel happy during the Holidays - especially after 2 years of pandemic?

Join us - Robert and  Darine - on Saturday December 25 as we celebrate but also have a real talk about all of this.

NEXT STEPS:
Click "Attend" (so you don't miss it)
Share your thoughts in the comments

#goodmorninglinkedin #linkedinlivestreamers

author: Endika Tri Yunialdi
author_info: Fresh Graduate | Electrical Engineering | Electrical Machine Maintenance
content:
Saya Endika Tri Yunialdi fresh graduate dari Institut Teknologi PLN Sarjana Teknik Elektro yang berfokus pada sistem tenaga. Saya aktif mengikuti organisasi Himpunan Mahasiswa Elektro FKET IT-PLN dan mengikuti beberapa kegiatan kepanitiaan. Selain itu, saya mengikuti pelatihan soft skill & hard skill untuk menunjang kemampuan saya. Saya juga memiliki pengalaman magang sebagai teknisi listrik dibeberapa perusahaan BUMN. Saya juga sering melakukan pekerjaan freelancer untuk melatih skill yang saya miliki. 
Pengalaman saya dalam berorganisasi, saya memberikan dukungan dalam pengembangan pengetahuan yang dimiliki oleh mahasiswa. Kemampuan berkomunikasi dan hubungan masyarakat dapat digunakan untuk mengatur tim agar efektif dalam bekerja. Saya mampu bekerja di bawah tekanan, bekerja secara individu atau dengan tim, dan pekerja keras. Saya mampu mengoperasikan beberapa rekayasa perangkat lunak. Untuk lebih jelasnya, silakan lihat CV saya.

Saya mencari pekerjaan yang sesuai dengan latar belakang saya yaitu Teknik Elektro. Saya tertarik pada sistem tenaga listrik,  drafter, rewinding mesin listrik dan instalasi listrik bangunan serta panel. Namun, saya tidak menutup kemungkinan menerima kesempatan untuk bekerja di luar bidang ini. Karena saya terbuka untuk mempelajari hal-hal baru untuk memperkaya pengalaman dan mengembangkan keterampilan saya.

Silakan hubungi saya melalui DM LinkedIn atau 
email : (endikayuni0306@gmail.com)
WhatsApp : 081293265715

Itu saja yang bisa saya katakan, semoga ini adalah awal dari kesuksesan kita dan menjadikan kita pribadi yang lebih baik. Terima kasih.

author: Matthew Karakoulakis
author_info: Founder and Principal Lawyer at AMK Law
content:
👏🏽 The First Nations Business sector is growing in a range of exciting ways 

This kind rapid growth means direct results and positive impacts are empowering our Indigenous communities, even in remote areas. 

There are now more than “2,800 verified Indigenous businesses on Indigenous Business Direct”, says Supply Nation's website and new sectors are opening up like fashion, specialist services, traditional cuisine and more!!

With this level of growth and new industry participation, the ability to BUY BLAK is easier now than ever before 

With so much quality and variety available corporate and government organisations can be a great way of being a part of enabling sustainability and development of the Indigenous business economy.
👣 👣 
👣 
For Indigenous business owners, one of the very first legal requirements to start thinking about is having your well written Product Supply and Service Agreement in place for providing your products and services to your customers with clear terms about payment, warranties, protections and any unique parts of the supply.

If you are looking for corporate gifts perhaps now is the right time to check out the kind of Indigenous business that can service your gifting needs right before Christmas 🎅🏽 🎄

author: Gethin Nadin
author_info: Award-winning Psychologist • 2x HR Author • Inspiring Leader 2021 • 2x Top Global EX Influencer • 4x HR Influencer • Director at Benefex • Wellbeing Consultant & Employee Experience Expert • FRSA •
content:
This is how you run a business. Nottingham based retailer Games Workshop/Warhammer praises staff for ‘exceptional performance’ during pandemic after sales rose more than a third. We are so used to profitable businesses keeping the money for shareholders, spreading the wealth and doing the right thing stands out so much these days. 

- Games Workshop is handing its shop workers, model makers, designers and support staff a £5,000 bonus each
- on top of a £2.6m profit share
- Senior managers will share an extra £1.1m bonus pot, up from £300,000 the year before
- The company has also cancelled business rates relief and other pandemic financial support from the government.

Doing the right thing continues to pay off for Games Workshop. It is now valued ahead of Marks & Spencer and on a par with online fashion specialist ASOS.

author: Ethan Atherstone
content:
Aston Carter is hiring a Fashion Specialist for one of the largest Ecommerce companies in the world located in Seattle * FULLY REMOTE*

Do you love fashion? Do your friends come to you for styling advice? Are you passionate about delivering a great customer experience? Are you interested in both fashion and technology industries? If so, you have found the right match! One of the largest companies in the world is seeking an experienced fashion professional to help curate fashion data to drive machine learning and computer vision development, and provide real-time feedback that power various internal Fashion products, launches, and features.
In this role you will closely work with our internal customers to help them launch new products and features while supporting them throughout the entire lifecycle. We provide high-quality human-annotated services to support Fashion initiatives such as, Outfit Recommendations and Automated Collections on Detail Page.
The Fashion Specialist will need to come up to speed very quickly using internal tools, and will need to be able to evaluate a large number of garment images and define/optimize processes along the way. The ideal candidate should have a solid understanding of fashion knowledge and trends as well as what items of clothing work well together so that one can make the appropriate styling and outfit assessments.

Responsibilities:
• Review a queue of garment images and provide a thoughtful assessment of pieces to build an outfit
• Audits machine learning to ensure relevant styling and fashion knowledge
• Manages time between varying machine learning tasks and short term side projects, in alignment with business priorities and monthly allocation
• Own and track personal contributions to meet daily/weekly/monthly team productivity goals
• Possess flexibility to quickly adapt to business needs/changes
• Execute tasks in a timely manner and to a high degree of quality
• Identify opportunities for efficiency and automation, and help implement those improvements
• Operate as a self-starter to stay focused on repetitive tasks for long periods of time
Skills:
office suite
styling, fashion
fashion merchandising
Fashion specialist

personal stylist
Additional Skills & Qualifications:
Required Qualifications:
• 2+ years Fashion industry experience in fashion styling, merchandising, marketing, retail, design, or editorial work.
• Excellent written and oral communication skills
• Ability to stay focused on repetitive tasks for long periods of time.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelors or Associate degree in fashion or journalism, or equivalent experience.
• Experience in writing (i.e. copy writing, content editing or fashion blogging)
• Experience working cross-functionally in a fast-paced and results-driven environment
• Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills
Experience Level:
Entry Level

author: Mina Biancucci
content:
CANADA GETS NEW ANIMAL CRUELTY INVESTIGATION UNIT…

Canada’s first Animal Cruelty Investigation unit has been created with the job of investigating and punishing forms of animal cruelty.

The unit has been 2 years in the making and has been assisted by several animal specialists. Its aim is to prioritize and crack down on all cases of animal cruelty. This type of unit is new to Canada, despite the fact that many other parts of the world use a similar system, including the US. 

Staff Sgt. Anna Sinclair said, “Research has shown there in an unequivocal link between animal cruelty, domestic violence, child and elder abuse investigations. Offenders who abuse animals are likely to commit other violent crimes causing harm to persons and society in general.”

More than 400 cases of animal cruelty were investigated last year, showing just how urgent the need is to create a specific unit for dealing with animal cruelty. 

Canadian law enforcement was more eager to assist in creating the special unit when animal cruelty was clearly linked to other forms of abuse and violence. Const. Ilka Cunningham said, “It started with our love for animals, and then we realized there’s a much bigger picture here, and we quickly recognized the link to child abuse, domestic violence. It’s rarely ever just animal abuse. It always affected humans in a way as well.” 

This is amazing news for animal lovers everywhere as it shows just one more area of the world that is taking animal cruelty seriously. With the cases growing by the year, it is more urgent than ever for animal abuse to be dealt with.

BVSc FANZCVS (SAS) Registered Specialist in Small Animal Surgery
Ricky has 15 years of experience in specialist referral practice. As a specialist surgeon, he enjoys all areas of orthopaedic, soft tissue, oncologic, and neurosurgery.
Ricky received his veterinary degree from The University of Melbourne in 2005. Following a year in general practice, he completed a rotating internship at the Queens Veterinary School Hospital University of Cambridge (UK), surgical internship at the Veterinary Specialist Centre and surgical residency at Australia’s largest referral centre, the Small Animal Specialist Hospital (SASH) in Sydney. Ricky is a Fellow of the Australian New Zealand College of Veterinary Scientists in Small Animal Surgery and a Registered Small Animal Surgical Specialist. author: Anthony Sar
author_info: Hong Kong FinTech Week | FINNOVASIA | FinTech Club | Shaperz
content:
It feels surreal, but we made it. Seeing thousands of you in person at the Hong Kong FinTech Week venue, while streaming to over half a million people online. Thank you, everyone, who helped us to make this event another big success.

Asia's first large scale #hybrid event, Hong Kong FinTech Week is over. We managed to bring the industry under one roof for the first time after two years of pandemic, both in person and online. Together we were able to prove to the world that Hong Kong stays resilient and strong. 

On behalf of FINNOVASIA, I cant express enough gratitude to all our partners, speakers, attendees and sponsors. 

Espcially to Invest Hong Kong, Financial Services and the Treasury Bureau (FSTB) and Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA), Securities and Futures Commission and Insurance Authority.

Your trust and support allowed us to make this event happen. Thank you!

Personally I am grateful to my co-founder Vila Wong and everyone in FINNOVASIA. The team has been working tirelessly over the last few months behind the scene. You made this work despite all the challenges and uncertainty we faced. I am proud of each of you. This is your moment and your success!

I am also feeling very happy that the conference allowed many event industry professionals to get back to work after months out of business. 

Congratulations to over 300 on-site crew and support staff behind the stage, sound, light and video engineers, stage managers, computer animation specialists, technicians, designers, construction crews, volunteers and interns, customer service, stage MCs, production agencies, security personal, venue assistants, video streaming team, app developers and many many more.

Hope to see you in 2022!

content:
Dr. Ricky Cashmore
BVSc FANZCVS (SAS) Registered Specialist in Small Animal Surgery
Ricky has 15 years of experience in specialist referral practice. As a specialist surgeon, he enjoys all areas of orthopaedic, soft tissue, oncologic, and neurosurgery.
Ricky received his veterinary degree from The University of Melbourne in 2005. Following a year in general practice, he completed a rotating internship at the Queens Veterinary School Hospital University of Cambridge (UK), surgical internship at the Veterinary Specialist Centre and surgical residency at Australia’s largest referral centre, the Small Animal Specialist Hospital (SASH) in Sydney. Ricky also completed additional training at Murdoch University, Sydney University, University of California, and Gulf Coast Veterinary Specialists.
Ricky is a Fellow of the Australian New Zealand College of Veterinary Scientists in Small Animal Surgery and a Registered Small Animal Surgical Specialist. He has published widely and is a regular guest lecturer both nationally and internationally. Ricky is also a consultant to several Specialist Hospitals around Australia and Orthopaedic companies both nationally and internationally.

author: Vejay Anand S
content:
ANIMAL SPECIALIST - Orbit White
The 1st teeth whitening chewing gum to be launched in India was Orbit White by Wrigleys in the early 2000s. It was unheard-of, & it did not help that whitening toothpaste as a category had flopped

People want white teeth, but will not take the extra effort! 

The launch did not have a large budget. Internationally, Orbit had a successful property called pH Balance in the mouth, post eating food. Consumption was driven by the build-up of plaque & the need to balance pH

Initially, that was used in India too, not very successfully
 
Naresh Gupta was leading strategy at Grey & pushed the client to look at Orbit White as an indulgence & not as a health product

Naresh says “We were clear: white teeth have to be the drama, we could have the usual 'whiteness is attractive' story, but we wouldn't have succeeded in making a mark”

So the team started with dirty yellow teeth, leading to a cow who chews cud. Sandipan Bhattacharya then wrote scripts with the Animal Specialist & his Volunteer Cow

The commercial was made by Pushpendra Mishra on a shoestring budget

A photocopying machine operator became the lead actor (it was his 1st TVC) & his unpolished dialogue is the way he normally spoke

300% increase in sales!

FOR MORE VISIT MY BLOG - link in comments

author: Eli Albrecht
content:
I observe Shabbat. I have tried to hide at different times but never compromised and it makes me a better lawyer, father, husband, and human. For 26 hours beginning sundown on Friday I turn off my phone and computer, I don’t use electronics and I don’t drive. 

What I do is affirmatively focus on self-growth. I lean in and nurture my relationship with my kids and beautiful wife. I let my mind rest and allow it to grapple with the challenges of the week in a more creative and innovative way than when I’m in the trenches. I let my perspective zoom out and think about big-picture issues and even do a bit of naval-gazing philosophizing with family and friends.

Most importantly, I evaluate whether I was the kind of lawyer, co-worker, father, and husband that I wanted to be this past week and how I can do better this coming week. 

Throughout my career I was told that to do M&A (especially PE), I would have to compromise my Shabbat observance. A partner told me last year, “you may be the best attorney in the world, but unfortunately, if we get an LOI on Friday night, I need you to turn it back to the client by Saturday night. If you can’t do that, I just can’t work with you. Have you considered Tax?” While I would have loved to work with that person, I am not willing to compromise Shabbat. 

Shabbat is designed to reinforce that our value is not the sum of our productivity or what we produce. Our value goes beyond our work and beyond the economic value we create. When all the ringing and pinging is gone for 26 hours, you realize that your worth is independent of your work. 

Joe Lieberman was an early role model of mine, in part because he observed Shabbat. He was a U.S. Senator and did not compromise Shabbat observance. Not only did he make it work, but it made him a better Senator, a better father, and a better human. He wrote a beautiful book about Shabbat and how everyone (of all faiths or no faith) can benefit by integrating Shabbat into their daily lives by taking moments to self-reflect and discuss deep topics (The Gift of Rest). We had an enjoyable discussion about Shabbat when we met a “few” years ago (picture in the Comments). 

As we celebrate the holidays with friends and family and move into a new year, we would be well served to integrate a bit of Shabbat into our own lives, to take time to shut off the electronics and be present with our loved ones. These are the moments that have real meaning, these are the moments our children and spouses remember; I would not trade those moments for anything.

While I recognize that Shabbat observance could result in a detriment to my career or winning certain clients, the gains to my mental health, peace of mind, creativity, innovation, closeness to family, and overall wellbeing are absolutely priceless. 

To those that celebrate Christmas, wishing you a truly meaningful and peaceful holiday with your loved ones. 

Shabbat shalom to all.

#privateequity #law #shabbatshalom

author: LA MAISON by Sénioréo
content:
L’ #habitat participatif, un modèle encore balbutiant en France... Les projets d’habitat participatif sont encore minoritaires en France.
SUITEO Résidences Services  développe le concept LA MAISON by SENIOREO  : un Coliving senior qui répond à la définition de l’habitat inclusif et participatif !

Alternative aux Maisons de retraite et #Ehpad, il s’adresse à des Seniors autonomes ou semi-dépendants qui recherchent un domicile adapté et accompagné.
Si le concept d’habitat participatif est régulièrement associé aux soixante-huitards, cette tendance touche différentes catégories sociales d’âges divers même si «on note une forte prédominance du public sénior dans cette forme d’habitat: entre 50 et 60% de séniors, proches de la retraite ou à la retraite qui se demandent comment vais-je vivre plus tard? Ils recherchent des habitats moins grands maintenant que leurs enfants sont partis du foyer familial et cherchent à lutter contre l’isolement. C’est une alternative aux Ehpad qui permet de monter des projets intergénérationnels», explique Ludovic Parenty. C’est le cas de Pierre-Yves, 66 ans, qui a souhaité anticiper la question du vieillissement: «Je vivais dans un appartement avec un escalier. Mes besoins changent donc je change d’habitat», avance-t-il.


#Habitat #logement #hébergement #domicile #Senior #Aînés #innovation #immobilier #senioreo #suiteo #colivingSenior #HabitatInclusif #immobilier #silvereconomie

author: Eduardo Petazze
content:
A humanized mouse model with chronic disease caused by the virus #SARSCoV2

Humanized mice exhibited more severe lung disease compared to infected normal mice.

In the first, pulmonary pathology followed the three stages described in human patients with #COVID19:
          exudative
          organizing and
          fibrotic phases

On the fourth day after infection, the lungs entered the organizing phase, highlighted by infiltration of the alveolar spaces by lymphocytes, macrophages, and fibroblasts.

Between day 14 and day 28 after infection, the lungs of humanized mice showed infiltration of the interalveolar spaces.

Between 28 and 35 days, the replacement of normal alveolar architecture by dilated cystic spaces, separated by thick bands of interstitial tissue, was observed.

My comment:

This model confirms everything already observed in human patients, including the results of histopathological analyzes and responses to conventional treatments, allowing a better characterization of the effects of the patient's antibodies, the identification of sources of immunopathologies, including the aberrant response. macrophages. .

They have found that genetic variability between different cohorts can result in differences in cellular infection and / or the strength of the inflammatory response, which could also explain the variable outcome observed in disease outcome in human #SARSCoV2 infection. .

However, regardless of such heterogeneity, the sustained response to interferon shaped both the early innate antiviral response and the late adaptive immune response.

I believe that the work deserves an in-depth study to determine the drivers (beyond biomarkers) that determine the variability of the behavior of individuals in the face of infection.

If we could understand why aberrant behavior occurs in certain individuals (without previous pathologies) and not in others (the vast majority), a gigantic step would have been taken and not only for this viral infection.

author: Sales Reinvented Podcast
content:
https://bit.ly/32cIClX B2B Pricing Models & Strategies [+ Pros and Cons of Each]
Pricing the products or services you’re selling to another business can be challenging.

Saying “Ok I’m going to charge $5 for this is nice” sounds nice, but you don’t want to lose out on valuable revenue, especially since you’ve likely put hard work and time into creating what you sell. When selling B2B, it’s critical to understand the characteristics of the business you’re selling to, and also what’s most important to your business based on what you’re selling.

In this post, discover what B2B pricing is, the different models that will help you with your pricing process, and the pricing strategies that will help you establish a final cost.

author: Lisa Welchman
author_info: Digital Governance Consultant & Coach; Co-host, Surfacing podcast
content:
So. 2021 is almost a wrap. How did it go? This year was a year that offered a lot of surprises for me--and a lot of poignancy. It was both joyful and challenging.

Whatever the year brought to you, I hope things were positive on balance. And if that wasn't always possible, I hope that you found pockets of rest and reprieve now and again.

One of the joys of this year for me was starting the Surfacing podcast with Andy Vitale. An added pleasure was that our audio producer is my son, Rhys. He's also the announcer AND wrote the theme music. So Andy and I thought it would be fun to have Rhys on as a guest for a year-end deep dive.

We talk about many things. Andy and I touched on how the podcast is going and some changes for next year. Rhys talks about how what he learns while editing Surfacing influences him as a band tour manager--and what it's like to be back out on the road in a pandemic. And to honor Andy's unquenchable thirst for holiday "stuff" (any and all holidays), I recorded a version of In the Bleak Midwinter for your ambient listening pleasure. So, grab a cup of peppermint hot chocolate and enjoy this year-end episode of Surfacing.

https://lnkd.in/ddD9dpS3
#yearend #teamleadership #holidaymusic

author: Doug Melville
author_info: Global Head of D&I, Richemont | 4x TEDx Speaker | Leader | Tuskegee Airmen Advocate
content: When I was 21 years old, I was introduced to Britney Spears. I was hired to be an Asst. Tour Manager on her "Hit me...One More Time/Drive Me Crazy" Tour. Throughout 40 States, we spent the Summer months together laughing, joking, and going city-to-city on the tour buses (then private jets!). Years later, she brought me back to launch her fragrance 'Fantasy' and then market the 'Onyx Hotel Tour'. In Dec 2008, right before her conservatory - we spent her final 'free' Birthday together in Bel Air. It was very hard for me to hear her statement today in court. She was an incredible person - who believed in me even before I believed in myself. She taught me so much about the power of music, art and dance.  Below are three of my favorite pictures of us together - my favorite is on the left during our first trip to LA together. I always wished we could meet up again - and maybe today we are one day closer.  #FreeBritney #Britney #britneyspears #mentalhealthmatters #mentalhealth #diversity

author: Doug Wilson
author_info: Artist Management Associate at Six Shooter Records
content:
After more than 12 years on the road, and 15 working in live production, I am delighted to say that I have accepted the position of artist management associate at Six Shooter Records and that today is my first day on the job! Tour Management will always have a special place in my heart, and I managed to fit a lifetime's worth of experiences into my time on tour, but I am very much looking forward to a new challenge and testing myself in this new role.

Six Shooter is a company that I have had the pleasure of working with as a client for several years now and I could not be more delighted to be joining such a progressive, inclusive and supportive team. I will still be consulting on a number of touring and non-touring projects moving forward, and may even dust off the production case from time to time, so I hope to see each and every one of you out there at festival catering sooner rather than later, but in the meantime I'm looking forward to more quality time at home (and on my bike!).

author: Surojit Mahato
author_info: Digital Marketing Consultant & Trainer | LinkedIn Coach | Career Advisor | Personal Branding Strategist | Content Marketer | Blogger | Co-Founder@ GrowthDish Marketing | Telegram @surojitmahatofficial
content:
Spoke to my neighbor yesterday for an hour. He told me he was earning more than 1.5 lakhs in his last job as a Tour Manager. He has traveled around the world and has 15+ yrs of exp. in the travel industry. Last year he lost his job after the lockdown. 
 
He told me he is lucky that his wife is working with an IT company and taking the lead of the family in time of crisis. Everyone in the family respects her in a different way now. 
 
5 years back when his daughter was born, it was not the same. Everyone in the family told his wife to give up her job and look after her baby full-time. But she was determined to manage both. And she did with sheer determination and hard work. 
 
Towards the end of the conversation, he told me that in the last couple of years he couldn’t spend much time with his family as he had to travel a lot. 

He isn’t desperate to go back to corporate life. It might take some time, but it will happen eventually. 
 
For the moment he considers himself employed at home looking after the family doing household work, spending time with his daughter and he reports directly to the CEO - his wife. 

Question:  Why is our society over-critical about women working after having a baby? Are companies doing enough to support mothers manage work and family?

author: Collette
content:
Tour Manager John F. recently told us his top tips for travel, and we wanted to share them with you!

1️⃣ When it comes to packing, less is best. Pack comfortable clothes that you love and that fit well. Limit to two pairs of shoes and bring rain gear. Always bring a swimsuit since you never know if your hotel may have a pool!

2️⃣ You’ll never forget your phone, but charging cords, headphones, and a power adaptor to compensate for different wattage / outlets in different countries are all musts that may be a bit easier to overlook!

3️⃣ Always call your bank to let them know that you will be traveling. It’s best to carry a couple of credit cards and your debit card with you. Snap a pic of each card front and back, just in case. 

Sound off: Let us know your own top travel tip!

Las tareas que realizan los conductores implican ciertos riesgos de accidentes que pueden afectar a quienes las llevan a cabo. Entre los riesgos más comunes podemos mencionar el TEPT (trastorno de estrés post traumático) entre otros.
