Descripción del curso

Conducir un vehículo de emergencia, es una actividad que se requiere en vuestra empresa. En este sentido, es necesario que tomemos conciencia acerca de la responsabilidad que tiene el conductor en sus manos, es decir, realizar un manejo seguro y eficiente, que esté acorde con las normas establecidas.

Respecto de lo anterior, es muy importante que los conductores accedan a capacitaciones en lo que se refiere a conducción defensiva y manejo en condiciones de estrés. Capacitaciones POTENZA spa, se ha comprometido, en proporcionar los conocimientos necesarios en cuanto a técnica, rutina de trabajo, material y documentación, para el desarrollo optimo del oficio seguro y profesional.

author: Ashley Heenan
author_info: Business Strategy Lead - Special Vehicle Operations
content:
My tenure within SV Operations as Senior Production lead is very quickly coming to an end!

I joined this part of the business from Solihull operations on a ‘3week’ secondment over 6 years ago to assist in there quality and delivery output. That 3 weeks on a single shift grew into a full 3 shift - 24 hour operation with volumes increasing 10 fold. 90% of the paint team I was fortunate to interview (Over 300 candidates went through the process!) We have faced many challenges, not only COVID-19, but the worldwide semi conductor shortage that has impacted all of the automotive industry. I’ve coached individuals, Group Leaders and Production Leaders, all who have excelled in their careers. It’s not been easy, there’s been many very very long days, problems and unexpected hurdles along the way, however we’ve achieved significant and positive milestones. 

What a brilliant time it has been watching 2 innovative brands grow and the business expand, it has been quite simply outstanding. Il be sad to leave the operational aspect of the organisation, but I know the teams here will continue to push it to the next generation and I’m confident there will be plenty of ‘Wows’ along the way. 

I’m looking forwards to my new role as Business Strategy Lead for Special Operations. This role will cover strategy and business continuity for Special Vehicle Operations, Classic Operations, Event vehicle Operations and Bowler. 

So from me, Thank you. Thank you to those who have coached and guided me along the way…… and to the teams on the ground, thank you for your hard work and dedication! It’s been a pleasure to be part of it. 

As I always say,

‘I’m only ever a phone call or an email away’

All the best,

Ashley

#SpecialVehicleOperations

author: Women of Influence
content:
The 25 largest orchestras in the United States have something in common: Not one is led by a woman.

But that is about to change. The Atlanta Symphony Orchestra announced that it had chosen Nathalie Stutzmann, a conductor and singer from France, as its next music director.

Stutzmann, 56, will be only the second woman in history to lead a top-tier American orchestra when she takes the podium in Atlanta next year. She follows Marin Alsop, whose tenure as music director of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra ended in August after 14 years.

author: Guido de Haan
content:
After four years of doing my PhD at ARCNL, I am incredibly proud to be able to physically hold my PhD thesis in my hands. My thesis, titled: "Enhanced generation and detection of ultrafast laser-induced acoustic signals" explores techniques to increase the signal strength from laser-induced acoustic signals applicable in the semi-conductor manufacturing industry.

Al lot of people deserve recognition for the thesis I am presenting you with today, and they are all mentioned in the acknowledgements inside the thesis itself. I would like to highlight one person in particular without whom this work would not have been possible: my promotor and mentor Paul Planken.

The cover art of my thesis has been hand painted by my amazing girlfriend Fleur Kuijpers. During my PhD I have done a lot of research on the metal gold, which is represented here by the gold circle. Inside the gold circle a diversity of colors are present, symbolizing the different colors of light I used to investigate photo-acoustic effects during my PhD.

I will defend my Thesis to obtain the degree of Doctor on Friday the 28th of January at 16:00 in the Agnietenkapel in Amsterdam.

author: Luca Mihaly
content:
You make time for what you value. One thing I value is communication. 

So how do you write your first LinkedIn update? Let me try. Since 2006, I have been a member of the LinkedIn Community. I thoroughly enjoy the updates and news articles shared here - thanks all! However, I often wonder, should I share something? But I’m damn proud of the last few months so here it goes… 

In June 2021, the green light was given for the rollout of Insights Discovery as our communications framework within the AWS Startups Segment. Thanks to Eric Feagler and Tracy Goodman for the support. And couldn't have done without my entire team: Nathan Jordan Siobhan Connor Nikki Gomez Deniece Tan Nicole De Silva Samuel Weller! Thank you! 

Personally, here are my stats in the last 6 months of the Insights Discovery rollout: 
- 650+ Startups Amazonians participated in my sessions
- 112+ hours of facilitation 
- 75+ sessions 

Why do I think THIS post is worth it? Because: no matter how you look at it, we can all learn to be better communicators. It’s such a deep and dynamic topic, yet so simple and solvable at the same time. 

A few shoutouts: having learned the true meaning of hustle and grit at my 12 years at Conductor… shoutout to Seth Besmertnik and the entire team (congrats on the new raise!).  And Sara Oakes thanks for introducing me to Insights Discovery while we were both at Conductor. 

Thank you to Elaine Lindsay and Tim Kauffman (and the entire Insights team) for all you do for AWS!

Lastly, to those that have joined my sessions: thank you. Throughout the rollout, I iterated and learned to deliver your results, be customer obsessed, earn your trust and dive deep (see what I did there…)

Here’s the 2022 and keeping Insights Discovery Alive!

author: Kat Penn
author_info: Business Development Manager at HOLTs Textile Specialist
content:
Yesterday, Kelly Beckett & I attended British Beauty Council British Beauty Week 2021 in Covent Garden and it was so great to be at an in-person event.

 With No7 Beauty Company leading the event, we saw stands from their many beloved brands (some of which are our existing HOLTs Textile Specialists customers.)

We were educated about our own skin & it’s needs, whilst discussing the new products launching and the values & science-led developments which bring those to life.
 
Throughout the day, there were a number of panel talks.

I found Rt Hon Caroline Nokes comments on the importance and value of the UK Beauty industry (£30bn!) particular interesting.

Creating over 500,000 jobs and many female entrepreneurs, the UK Beauty industry is not one to be considered "just" Beauty.

It was also great to chat to the attendees about everything from business roles to the summer dresses we were wearing!

Such a great group of creative, entrepreneurial and innovative people.

#britishbeautycouncil #britishbeautyweek #beautyunfiltered #beauty #skincare #beautyindustry

author: Laurie Crombez
author_info: Responsable Gestion chez MyDiTex - My Digital Textile
content:
⚡️ Hey ! Envie de travailler en mode « start’up » et de contribuer au développement d’une société innovante en plein essor ? 
On recrute chez MyDiTex - My Digital Textile spécialiste de l’impression digital textile, un stagiaire Chef de projet pour le programme « Print It Again » qui marque l’engagement RSE de la société dans sa volonté de repenser un mode de production et de consommation éco responsable dans l’univers de la décoration et de l’aménagement. 

💡 Tes missions : 
• Participation à la création du programme « Print It Again » et de la création d’une marque dédiée, définition de la charte et des enjeux, de la politique marketing et commercial. 

• Mise en place d’une ligne d’accessoires de décoration 100% Upcylclés (rédaction du cahier des charges produits, suivi conception, reporting clients). 

• Création des supports de sensibilisation et d’éducation du programme (enjeux, rôles et bénéfices). 

• Mise en place des outils de communication et participation à la création des contenus rédactionnels et promotionnels  

• Participation au développement commercial du programme, préparation des rdv grands comptes. 

💡 Ton profil : 
• Passionné(e) par les problématiques de développement durable et/ou impliqué(e) dans un engagement sociétal 

• En 2ème ou 3ème année d’école de commerce ou spécialisée (RSE;textile ou autre) 

• Entreprenant, agile et polyvalent, vous usez de votre créativité pour trouver des solutions et porter un projet qui a du sens 

• Excellent relationnel et approche collaborative 

💡 Tes compétences :

• Maitrise de Pack Adobe 
• Anglais Courant 

👉🏻  Stage conventionné 4 mois minimum à partir de Janvier 2022 
À vos CV ! 

 #textile #recrute #stage #rse #engagement #créativité #digital

content:
Loomstate canvas rolls reading to be coated and converted into our sun protection and #outdoorfabric ranges like Somerton Canvas, Supaproof, Tearlok Rx12, and Camperfield. 

Did you know? #Canvasfabric was originally popularized as a useful sailcloth material and an excellent painting medium. Thanks to its durability and water-resistant properties, it has now made its way into applications such as #tents, #awnings, furniture, and designer handbags.

author: Alison Jose
author_info: CIRCULAR CENTRE: Circular Textile Waste Service & STSC. Sustainable Textile Supply Chain
content:
It’s exciting when our Textile waste partnerships start with customers replacing virgin synthetic with rPET recycled materials for their printed street banners. 

We are privileged to partner with textile specialist Julian Lowe from CORITEX (PTY) LTD who helps reduce the environmental impact as he converts customers into stepping further into circular design systems by using recycled materials. 

Closing the loop for textile waste doesn’t have to mean fibre to fibre as our Circular Textile Waste Service then takes it from printers like eco-warriors at AFI Branding  
- who collect used banners from their customers- so we can divert from landfill and reprocess with our partners Sealy of Australia into #Australianmade mattresses. 

This loop currently processes around 3 tonnes a week and we look forward to increasing the amount in 2022 and help make a real dent in stopping textile waste from causing carbon emissions as it breaks down for hundreds of years in landfill. 

Read more about this partnership on our CC NEWS 
www.circularcentre.com.au
#circulardesign #productstewardship #resourcerecovery #wealthfromwaste #remade #circulareconomy #circularwaste #circularity

author: Kelly Beckett
author_info: Marketing Manager at HOLTs Textile Specialists
content:
At the end of October, HOLTs Textile Specialists attended the Pure Beauty Awards 2021. 

It was an amazing night but the cherry on top was the HOLTs reusable cotton rounds being featured in the exclusive event gift bag and our advert running in the awards brochure! 

It was a busy month to get this organised but I am so grateful to Kat Penn and the rest of the HOLTs team who pulled together to make it happen 🎉

After all that, I took a much needed week off to visit the Suffolk countryside to reset. Now I am ready to get stuck back into more exciting projects to spread the word about HOLTs! 🌟

#PureBeauty #textilesaccessories #beautyindustry

author: Kat Penn
author_info: Business Development Manager at HOLTs Textile Specialist
content:
Last night, HOLTs Textile Specialists attended the Pure Beauty 2021 Awards to mingle with beauty brands and celebrate innovative products in the industry.

Kelly Beckett managed to get our product into the exclusive event gift bag and supporting magazine.

We were so excited to see our reusable cotton rounds in there!

I loved chatting to teams from new brands, award winners, Ru Paul's Drag Race UK's Cheryl Hole & even bumped into my Head of Buying from 10 years ago.

✨ What a night!✨

author: Keith Greville
content:
One of the highlights on our calendar of Equality, Diversity and Inclusion events at #Arup is our Diversity Design Competition. This year, we ran the competition for the month of November, with 114 colleagues from different offices across Europe collaborating during virtual lunches and tea breaks to complete a design task. Our 2020 graduate cohort did a stellar job captaining the teams.
 
Earlier this month, we held our virtual awards night, celebrating the outstanding designs created by our 17 teams. It was amazing to hear how each of our teams tackled the task we set to create an urban green space – incorporating innovative sustainability concepts and providing a connection with nature.
 
I was honoured to be one of the judges of this competition, alongside Shane Cashman who created the initial concept for this event three years ago, Eva Hinkers, Bronagh Maguire and Rena Garrett. This competition truly showcases the value of combining diverse viewpoints and it was wonderful to virtually celebrate our teams and congratulate our winners.
 
If you’d like to find out more about our Equality, Diversity and Inclusion initiatives at Arup, send me a message.
 
#Equality #Diversity #Inclusion

author: NationalAMLA
content:
Job Opening: Landscape Architect 

Landscape Architecture, Building Design and Construction Division of San Francisco Public Works provides design services for playgrounds, parks, streetscapes, bike lanes, green infrastructure, and urban design, from planning through construction.

THIS IS A POSITION BASED EXAM

Application Deadline: January 7, 2022

Annual Salary: $138,840-$168,870

Application Link: https://smrtr.io/7rykM

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Under general administrative direction, this position leads and facilitates professional landscape architectural work in connection with the design, construction, maintenance, and conversion of public landscapes. The Landscape Architect also participates in the professional development of support personnel. In conjunction with managing and performing the technical aspects of projects summarized above, the Landscape Architect provides comprehensive project planning and coordination services, including maintaining client relationships, support of contract negotiation and administration, public and user group presentations, and maintenance of budgets and schedules for the assigned projects.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Experience:

Eight (8) years of progressively responsible experience in the landscape architectural field, including landscape architectural design, landscape architectural detailing, construction documents, programming, cost budgeting, specification coordination and review, and construction administration. This experience must include two (2) years serving as a project lead/job captain, 2 years serving as a supervisor, and two (2) years of experience as a licensed landscape architect in the State of California.

LICENSE AND CERTIFICATION:

Possession of a valid license to practice landscape architecture in the State of California issued by the California Architects Board, Landscape Architects Technical Committee.

Possession of a valid California driver's license.

#LandscapeArchitecture
#LandscapeArchitectureJobs

author: First Responder Benefit Association
content:
“This is why I do the job.”

Captain Chris Blazek from the Chattanooga Fire Department posted this about a call they went out on last year and how he ended up with this baby falling asleep in his arms.

It’s just a simple story.
But sometimes those are the best.
Here’s what Captain Blazek posted:

After getting back to the hall from a house fire last Saturday in 4's district (I was literally in the shower), Engine 6 was dispatched to a car incident on Highway 58.

The incident included the driver — a pregnant mother — and her three small children who were in the back seat.

The mother was hysterical because she was having abdominal and back pain.

The children ranged in age from 7 years to 12 months.
Both big girls were fine, but the baby was screaming hysterically, too.

So I took her out of her car seat and did a quick physical exam to make sure she was okay.
She immediately laid her head on my shoulder.

Shortly after that, I decided that my guys had the scene under control, so I decided to sit and take a break with my new friend.
She immediately fell asleep in my arms.

Mom was transported and Engine 6 personnel stayed on scene with the children until they were turned over to family members.

It's moments like this that I am reminded: this is why I do the job."

Source: Captain Chris Blazek

For more information on how we give back and how you can join FRBA as an Ally supporting the families of YOUR local fallen First Responders, text “Mission” to (864) 400-1582 or visit www.frba.org.

***What happens when you donate: 100% of the funds donated to FRBA go directly to the families of fallen First Responders ( http://pos.li/2ivj4a )— not necessarily to the specific person(s) depicted in this post. While we are not affiliated with those depicted, the purpose of this content is to educate the public on the life of a First Responder and provide the opportunity to contribute to our mission.

#firefighter #fireman #rescue #firstresponder #thinredline #firedept #firelife #firefighter #firefighters #firerescue #firetruck #firestation #firemen #fire #wildlandfirefighters #dispatch #charity #giveback #nonprofit #causes #family #donations #nationalbakesale #frba #dearfirstresponder

author: David Vuagniaux
author_info: Product Manager (Northern Ireland & Wales) at Combilift Aislemaster
content:
As the saying goes, if you don’t ask you don’t get.
  
A local Family Owned Transportation Company were hit with a challenge to store more product within a very short space of time by an existing customer of theirs.

We asked if we can help and the results were perfect. Increased storage, increased productivity & downsizing current fleet. 

This was the result of installing the Aislemaster, and this particular one in their own company colours which is always a nice touch 👌.

So if you are running out of room, reach out to us. Our layout specialists will configure your existing space, and maximise storage to possibly an additional 30-50%. This is all achievable not by moving to a bigger warehouse but just by simply changing your Forklift.

I would like to give a special thank you to George Hewitt from Midac Batteries for the recommendation 🙏

 #logistics #transportation #help #warehouse #customerservice #fleetmanagement

author: Lisa ⚖️ Lang
author_info: In-House Lawyer 📌Thought Leader 📌ONCON ICON Awards Finalist📌Writer📌Speaker📌Veteran
content:
What do you do during a pandemic when you can't attend conferences, you can't attend luncheons at your local bar association, and you can't grab a drink with your co-workers after work?



If you are like me, you write! 

It is not something I planned. It just happened.

Trust me, no one was more surprised than I was. I thought college and law school had killed any joy I had for writing a long time ago, but here I am.

It did not happen overnight. It started gradually on #LinkedIn and grew.

Who knew that writing posts would eventually led to the self-publication of #Networked Book with a group of great lady lawyer friends.

Now what?

Self-publish my own book, that's what.

There has never been a better time to become a published author thanks to Amazon and the like.

New to the process? Check out "How Many 'Selves' does it take to 'Self' -Publish" by Tatia Gordon-Troy.

https://lnkd.in/e7Un77c

*Self-publishing is a misnomer.

*It involves more than self.

*You need the right help.

*For all this, certain professionals need to play a role in the production process: editors, text layout specialists, designers, and marketers.

Connect with Tatia!

#lawyers #law #inhousecounsel #generalcounsel #thoughtleader #books

author: Joanne B Enriquez
author_info: LexisNexis North Asia - Digital Marketing Supervisor
content:
How it Started: Design Production Specialist, LexisNexis Pacific
How it’s Going: Digital Marketing Supervisor II, LexisNexis North Asia

I joined Reed Elsevier Philippines in 2013 as a graphic designer, and I was reluctant to step up for other opportunities because in my mind, I did not fit any mold outside art and design. With encouragement and trust from my leaders and colleagues, I recognized my skills for marketing communications and people management. I was further empowered when I was picked to attend the Reed Elsevier Leadership Academy, and the Six Sigma Yellow Belt course. Looking back, I realize that ordinary days at work were actually special, because I was gaining knowledge from the daily interactions and fostering great working relationships. I got promoted to Integrated Marketing Campaigns Supervisor, where I led designers and campaign managers. It was hard, 😅 but I kept going until I found fulfillment amidst the challenges. 

It's 2021 and I'm progressing into the digital space, while still tapping into my design roots. I'm happily embracing the role of Digital Marketing Supervisor for LN Japan & Korea as I immerse in the B2B practices of two amazing Asian countries. Cheers to  learning more and doubting myself less with REPH!

#REPHinTENsified
#WeAreReedElsevier

author: Hammer Museum
content:
We're Hiring! #hiring #museumjobs

DESIGN AND PRODUCTION SPECIALIST

The Design & Production Specialist will work with the museum's design team on fielding and tracking design requests and projects, and designing materials in collaboration with the design team, under the supervision of the Associate Director, Communications & Marketing.

The primary responsibilities include managing the production schedule for the design projects, tracking work orders and invoices, procuring sample materials, researching vendors. Emphasis is placed on maintaining positive relationships and proactively communicating with colleagues, partners, and vendors. The design component of the position primarily focuses on working with existing templates and layouts as well as supporting the execution of the design team's projects, under the direction of the Senior Designer and in collaboration with the Graphic Designer. This position also documents and organizes records of the in-house design team's output, including but not limited to file management and photo documentation.

Application: To view a full job description and apply, visit UCLA Career Opportunities (https://lnkd.in/gaST_nBm) and search the campus job openings for Requisition #35033. author: Tom Prince
content:
PERI Thailand keeps proving to the market that we are here to stay and we are here to help the Thailand construction companies take their companies and their projects to the next level.  

The pictures in this post show our customer who just purchased 5000m2 of our Alphadeck slab formwork, setting up the first few panels on their newest project.     

This customer took advantage of our free-trial offer on a previous project.   They had just purchased another slab formwork system from a competing international formwork supplier. We challenged them to use PERI Alphadeck on the same project, at the same time, on the same level, with the same workers.  In doing this, they were quickly able to see the benefits of the PERI Alphadeck in comparison to the competition.  

What they noticed with PERI Alphadeck:

1. Faster cycling times
2. Less components to handle
3. Lighter components
4. Local design/engineering & on-site support
5. Immediate product Availability in Thailand
6. Cleaner and more aesthetically pleasing concrete finish
7. Much more...…

This side-by-side real-time comparison, resulted in them confirming a purchase of 5000m2 of PERI Alphadeck for the project you see here in the pictures.  

PERI Thailand is proud to say that our entire team of Sales, Engineers, Designers, Product Specialists, and warehouse are all located in Thailand. We are committed to serve the Thailand construction market now, and well into the future. #construction #formwork #PERI #engineering #concrete

author: Ciara Elizabeth McNamara
author_info: Lead Programme Planner - Range Rover  at Jaguar Land Rover
content:
A little late to the party, but what a week!

The fifth generation of Range Rover - the world's most iconic, most capable, luxury SUV. 

2 years of working alongside the best programme managers, launch specialists, prototype teams, logistics co-ordinators, engineers, designers, product specialists, parts suppliers, manufacturing associates and media groups, and here it finally is! 

We've gone up against a global pandemic, semi conductor chip shortages and shipping crisies, but were still able to deliver not only the fantastic core variant in both SWB and LWB with a 7 seat option, but also 2 incredibly desirable SV variants, Intrepid and Serenity.

I've also had the pleasure (and intense responsibility!) of working with Event Vehicle Operations to deliver 16 Reveal cars, 2 of which took to the stage at Tuesday's reveal event; some of which you'll see in the brand images and videos on social media and via the Land Rover UK channels; and some of which have already met our customers at private events across the world. 

Delivering the new Range Rover has been both an incredible privilege and a career defining challenge, and I hope the world loves it as much as we do!

author: Olayinka T. Hannah
author_info: Content Writer | Author | Entrepreneur | Brand Influencer |
content:
Yes, this is me back in high school 😅


My Classmate from high school sent me this picture from our yearbook and I was just laughing when I saw it 

Not because of my picture though, I'll tell you why. 


You know in every school when you are about to graduate, you are asked what you'll like to become in future so it can be added to the yearbook. 

In fact, not just in school even your uncles and aunties are interested in what course you'll like to study. 


I was asked and that was my response 

COSMETOLOGIST 


I look back at it now and I'm wondering why I choose this, then I remember my mum wanted me to be a cosmetologist. 

She told me to choose between nursing, food dietitian or cosmetology 

Honestly, I was not interested in any but I was just 15, I have to obey my mum. 

looking at it now 😅😅😅 


Who would have thought that I'll become a Writer? 

-------------------

What course did you wish to study while you were in secondary school?

Did you pursue it after high school? 

Are you like me who didn't even do anything close to what I wanted back then

Please drop your answers in the comment section 📌🤩

© iamthiana

author: Georgia Gwinnett College
content:
After years making a living as a cosmetologist, Rachel Sabatino, ’14, decided to finally pursue her degree. She enrolled at the age of 35, choosing #GGC because it was affordable and close to home. 

“I could be close to my children while pursuing a degree, and I would be able to graduate without a mountain of debt,’ she said. “GGC was going to be my fresh start.”

Unfortunately, her fresh start came to an abrupt halt a year later. Facing the end of her marriage, Rachel struggled to focus on her studies. She withdrew from classes in 2010, finalized her divorce in 2011 and lost her house in 2012, but she never gave up on her dream of a college degree.

Read more about Rachel in Alumni Voices: https://lnkd.in/d7Sw_B5u
#GoBeGreat

author: Jose Edgardo Cruz
content:
“On its face, a youth-centered, grassroots American movement that is both faith-based and conservative shouldn’t surprise anyone, and that’s how most people viewed Turning Point USA back in 2012 when it was first founded by a then 18 year old, right-wing activist named Charlie Kirk. 

But in the nearly 10 years since, TPUSA has morphed into something else entirely: a powerful political tool of the radical right that spreads vaccine and election fraud misinformation and is growing increasingly and dangerously violent in its rhetoric. 

Its recent conference, AmericaFest 2021, attracted top Trump acolytes such as Sebastian Gorka and Kayleigh McEnany; conspiracy theorist Congress members including Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene, Louie Gohmert, and Lauren Boebert; and even Fox News host Jesse Watters.”

Effusively welcoming the murderer Rittenhouse. 
 
Hmmm…

Echoes of Hitler Youth. This is today’s #GOPcult

author: Defenders of Wildlife
content:
The White House announced on Monday that it has made “significant progress” towards the national conservation goals in the first year of its America the Beautiful initiative. Announced in May, this 10-year federal conservation program has served as an update to the Biden Administration’s 30x30 initiative, which sought to preserve 30% of U.S. lands and waters by 2030 – a stated goal of the initiative. 

“We appreciate the steps the administration has taken thus far to meet President Biden’s commitment to protect biodiversity, address the climate crisis, and improve equitable access to natural spaces. Immediate and decisive action to build on these early successes will help to ensure that the nation’s public lands and waters meet the needs of wildlife and people, now and into the future,” said Monica Goldberg, our vice president of landscape conservation. 

Read more: https://dfnd.us/3EgFZwo #DefendersOfWildlife

author: Department of Environment, Land, Water and Planning
content:
More than 3,000 hectares of forest in the Yarra Valley and the Dandenong Ranges are now preserved for future generations in the first conservation zone of its type in Victoria. 

The Liwik Barring Landscape Conservation area was named by the Wurundjeri Woi Wurrung Cultural Heritage Aboriginal Corporation. Liwik Barring means ‘Ancestors’ Trail, which indicates the cultural importance of this land. 

But the landscape conservation area also protects vital habitat for the Helmeted Honeyeater and lowland Leadbeater’s Possum, Victoria’s faunal emblems. https://lnkd.in/gDDdhMDN

In addition to the personal impact that Covid had on our lives, I have no doubt that 2021 has been my most challenging work year, lack of workers, shortages of materials, target of savings, among others.
I am proud to be part of the history of the company and  contributed with all my effort and commitment to break the record for the largest number of KitchenAid mixers produced in the history.
3,000,000 stand mixers in one year!!!.
In addition to that satisfaction, as a Christmas gift we received a mixer with a unique and special color designed by a few workers, including a person from my team!.
Great job and congrats to all the team!

author: Adam Bamford
author_info: CEO @ Colleague Box. Host of the Beers & Business Club
content:
We are finally coming to the end of our 2nd Christmas as a business and a day where it came full circle for me as our first ever web customer ordered again for his colleagues ... 19 months ago but such a world apart in terms of our businesses from then until now. 

Such a busy year with our move to the Smile Factory being a highlight as we grow into our home and make it ours. 

I want to thank the amazing Colleague Box team; Natalie, Chrissy, Carly, Hannah, Gemma, Jess & Katie have been the backbone behind all the good bits this year ... your commitment to our customers is beyond anything I'd ever hoped for. 

Our suppliers old and new ... thank you. I won't tag and I won't name them all but Chris Talbot, Naked Marshmallow team, Amy Faggo, Louise Baker, Hawkens Gingerbread, Matt & Jim of Cocktail Delivery, Tony's Chocolonely, the team at Bookers, Davpack, TTK, Cathy Moseley, Divine Box, Lesley So, Jarrick, Made For Drink crew, Peoples Captain, British Food Box, Joe & Sephs and so many more that have come to my rescue or helped us improve our offerings. 

Our partners that help us function each day or have helped us in some way this year; Vibrant, Sean Clare, Kydd Cleaning, Action Coach, Mr Shaw, Levain ... thank you.  

We even started our own networking club with the added bonus that it's fuelled by beer ... thank you to all those that have attended and spent a Thursday each month discussing & laughing with us. I genuinely can't wait to get going again in Jan. 

Lastly but always top of our list are our brilliant customers ... you are amazing for letting us be part of your wonderful celebrations. Far too many to mention but you've all brightened up some tough days with your last minute requests or very specific needs (we do love a challenge!)

That's about it for 2021 but one last THANK YOU to anyone reading this that has liked a post, told a friend, suggested to someone that they use Colleague Box or has tagged us in a post ... it's always appreciated. 

Have an amazing Christmas & New Year.

Adam

author: Tamia Booker
author_info: Political Strategist & Founder, T. Booker Strategies, LLC
content:
I have always found joy working in politics, not because of the reasons most people think, but mainly because I have been able to connect with people and build coalitions for a great cause. After doing this again for the primary, I still had this in mind and I had to figure out what my life would look like and how I wanted to continue to do this work. I have spent this year working with candidates, organizations and progressive causes that I truly believe in and I have found peace and absolute joy in this new work. I decided that I would take a huge leap of faith and create the space that I wanted and I started a political consulting firm. 

My new firm T. Booker Strategies, LLC, was formed and I am very excited to share this with you. My website: tbookerstrategies.com is official and I invite you to take a look. 

God has taken care of me every single step of the way and I am truly grateful. I am humbled by all of the support I have received. I look forward to connecting with all of you regarding my newest endeavor. Please dont hesitate to reach out to me with any questions and thank you again for all the support!

author: Chris Harris
author_info: Christopher Harris serves as the Executive Director of Unhyphenated America. He is a staunch Christian Constitutional Conservative who relocated from Colorado to Washington D.C.
content:
This is my Paternal Great-Grandfather. I only met him once, in the 1980s.  He was born in Mississippi over 110 years ago,

I can't imagine saying to him that racism is worse and a bigger obstacle for me in 2021 than it was for him in the 1930's, 40's, and 50's.

His Father was born in Louisiana in 1865. His Grandfather was born as a slave on a plantation in Virginia in 1813.

From what my Father told me of the temperament and accomplishments of his Grandfather, I'm sure he would think his Great-Grandson was a fairly pathetic excuse of a man, if he ever heard me fix my lips to say that "racism" was preventing me from advancing in America...in 2021.

I keep this picture near me, because it reminds me to stay on my grind, never whine, and pursue excellence.
~ Unhyphenated America

**

“The world cares little about what a man knows; it cares more about what a man is able to do.”
&
"The individual who can do something that the world wants done will, in the end, make his way regardless of his race."
&
"No man, who continues to add something to the material, intellectual and moral well-being of the place in which he lives, is left long without proper reward."
&
"When an individual produces what the world wants, whether it is a product of hand, head or heart, the world does not long stop to inquire what is the color of the skin of the producer."
~ #ThatDude Booker T. Washington (1856-1915)

author: Emma Tamer
content:
With graduation coming up tomorrow, my time at the University of Michigan will officially come to an end. I thoroughly enjoyed my four and a half years, making this a bittersweet moment. Thanks to the unmatched resources Michigan and University of Michigan Athletics offers I will walk away from this experience with several valuable life lessons, a few of which I’d like to share:

1. Life will give you exactly what you need, when you need it. This may come in forms of adversity. Embrace the suck.
2. Fundamental principals that many of us learn as children such as hard work, accountability, and integrity, will carry you through life if you allow them. KISS.
3. Be the one to hold the highest standard for yourself.

I owe a lot of thanks to my family at Michigan Field Hockey. To Maurice J. Washington,  MSA and the rest of the MACC (Michigan Athletics Career Center) for their amazing help with career development - a resource every Michigan student-athlete should take advantage of. To Joan Booker and Jeff Magnell and everyone else at JDM Systems Consultants where I learned and grew amply as a young professional. 

I am excited to take these lesson with me to AMBE Engineering LLC, where I will start the New Year as a financial analyst. Go Blue!

author: Robert Beyer
content:
My journey with FedEx Office is coming to an end. After 8.5 years, I have made the decision to depart FXO to pursue an opportunity in the Game Development industry that is simply too good to pass up. I am exceptionally appreciative of my team here in Seattle for all of their efforts during the pandemic and know they will be in good hands with the leadership team in the Pacific Northwest. I am so proud of what we accomplished as a team and look forward to hearing phenomenal things in the very near future as it pertains to their success.

I'd like to thank Matt Foust, Chris Kunard, Marcia Booker, Tracy Wise, Keith Hege, Julie Campagna PHR, M.A., Tracy Gimbel, Heather Ezelle, Daniel Martelli, Portia Robillard and the literal army of other great people who have had a hand in my development, learning and training over the past 8+ years. I wouldn't be where I am without the leadership and support from so many people.

In January, I will be joining the Bungie team and am still in disbelief that I have been granted the opportunity to join this organization which I hold in the highest of regards. I am THRILLED to be working on Destiny 2 and can't wait to dive in!

author: Linda Esposito, MPH
author_info: Author of The BE CLEAR Method to Living with Bronchiectasis at BE CLEAR with Bronchiectasis, LLC
content:
Recently, I was asked how the water we drink that goes into our stomachs causes a MAC infection in our lungs.

The answer is two-fold: by inefficient swallowing and gastric reflux.

 As previously discussed, all of us micro-aspirate liquid into our lungs throughout the day. This might be from liquid “going down the wrong pipe” as can happen with swallowing issues, coughing, or “just because.” Although a certain number of aspirations is considered normal and not a concern for those with healthy immune systems and lungs, this may not be the case for people with impaired airways.

Gastroesophogeal Reflux is another way bacteria can enter the lungs. Both acid and non-acid gastric refluxate can come up from the stomach and enter the lungs. This liquid can contain bacteria that have not been killed off by our stomach acid and possibly cause infection. 

One way to help prevent reflux is to take GERD precautions. These precautions might include: 

🦠Raising the head of your bed
🦠Not eating several hours before lying down
🦠Losing weight if overweight
🦠Not eating trigger foods

In addition to reducing swallowing issues and GERD, we can also reduce the MAC in our drinking water. Boiling water for 10 minutes or drinking spring water will greatly reduce this exposure and is something I do. 

If you choose to drink spring water, do not drink from a water cooler as a MAC biofilm might be lining the inside of the machine. The same is true for refrigerator filtered water and ice and Brita-like charcoal pitchers.

As I have said in two previous posts regarding environmental exposure precautions, not everyone with bronchiectasis will get a MAC infection. However, there is about a 10-20% chance you will and the precautions I have laid out can reduce that probability. 

Some BE and MAC specialists tell their patients to just live their lives and to not try to control bacteria that is everywhere in our environment. Others suggest taking preventive measures. So it is best to have this conversation with your doctors and see what they recommend.

Remember, we have a life-long condition so you can always make changes gradually over time. 

#bronchiectasis #maclungdisease
#ntmlungdisease

author: 🟡Matthew ‘Mac’ Paine, MA-iPEC CPC🟡 Global COR.E Dynamics Specialist™ Success Coach
author_info: ⨠One of the few quadruple-awarded COR.E Dynamics Specialists™ in the world | iPEC trained to create more immediate, tangible value in global, urban entrepreneurs  | Questions about COR.E?  See the Featured Story below 👇
content:
😩I can’t find any clients!  😫Too many coaches out there!  😡It’s driving my prices down!  😮I need a better sales strategy!  🤔I’ll build a better website!  🙂I’ll do another course!

This is what I often hear in coaching circles.  And it’s perfectly understandable and makes a whole load of sense.  Based on weeks of looking at a corrugated sales line, a lot of people would say this.

My experience may be of some relevance here, so I put it forward:

My partner and I are both trained coaches.  Trained over 8-10 months with International Coaching Federation accredited companies.  Mine was in the US.  China, in her case.
One market is established.  One is experiencing massive growth. By 2024, 1.2 billion Chinese will be in the middle class, making up one quarter of the world total. China already makes up the largest middle-class consumption market segment in the world and is a “priority market” for major multinational firms.

Are you making it a priority?

“Mac, I don’t speak Chinese!”

Well, as an example, English is widely used in Hong Kong (Pop. 7.5 million).  Can people/companies there afford coaching?  Well, it’s nearly a quarter of my work.  They can.  

There is a big market there in China.  It’s about 22% of my work.  52% is in the US.  Often helping companies transition staff overseas or lead multinational teams.

Regardless of nationality, both clients are congruent with each other: urban, success-oriented and upwardly mobile.

What are you doing in October to boost your coaching overseas?  How would it feel to expand?

非常感谢您!

Charlotte Nicholson ACC, CPC, ELI-MP Tricia Tahsuda, BS, MHSM, SHRM Adrian 🌱 Trumbo, PCC, CPC Audra Christie, CPC, ELI-MP Susan J Hilger, ACC, ELI-MP Kimberly Sennerikuppam, CPC, ELI-MP
#marketing #work #strategy #sales #coaching

author: Serge Calon
author_info: Milieupositivist. Duurzame top 100. Creatief procesmanagement in duurzame ontwikkeling. Energie, openbare ruimte, circulaire economie, mobiliteit en educatie; het kan allemaal duurzamer en groener.
content:
Kapotte printer, haperend scheerapparaat of gescheurde spijkerbroek? Handige Harry’s en Harriëttes opgelet: we gaan het fixen!

Je hebt vast iets in huis, waarvan je van plan bent om een nieuwe aan te schaffen. Soms is het gemakzucht en maak je de beslissing in een opwelling. Soms denk je gewoon: vervangen is makkelijker dan genezen. In deze wegwerpwereld word je sowieso verleid tot het doen van aankopen. Nieuwer, groter, beter? Meestal niet een duurzame keuze. Je voelt dat de schoen wringt. Maar kan het ook anders? Natuurlijk! Fix it!

Want door te repareren geef je spullen een tweede leven. Bovendien voel je je trots en geef jij zo het goede voorbeeld aan mensen om je heen. 

Mocht je nou zelf twee linkerhanden hebben, aarzel niet. Zoek het ontbrekende onderdeel op fixpart.nl of vind jouw lokale reparateur op repareer.com. Wist je dat er ook gewerkt wordt aan 'het recht op repareren'? Yes, we gaan langzaam richting een circulaire economie!

Weggeefactie: Macleasy.nl (gespecialiseerd in het verduurzamen van Macs d.m.v. advies, onderhoud, reparatie of inruil) geeft deze week een refurbished MacBook Air weg aan de leukste reparateur die ons op originele manier zijn reparatiekunsten laat zien (foto of filmpje) en daar ook andere mensen mee weet te inspireren. Deel je bericht op social media en tag ons.

Voor meer info en achtergrond, ga naar https://lnkd.in/dMMK9dX

Succes! Caroline Buiskool (pippie), Ivo De Boer (Harry 1) en Serge Calon (Harry 2). Met speciale dank aan  Maurits Riton Sustainable MAC Specialist, Charlotte Leemans 🌱 , Lonneke Rentinck.
